misericorditer: <entryFree id="n29267" type="main" key="mi^se^ri^cordi^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭcordĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. misericors <sense id="n29267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
misericors: <entryFree id="n29268" type="main" key="mi^se^ri^cors"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭcors</orth>, <itype>cordis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>misereo-cor</etym>, <sense id="n29268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">tender-hearted, pitiful, compassionate, merciful</hi> (class.).—Of persons and things: <cit><quote lang="la">credc misericors est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordem se praebere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericors et mansuetus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 2, 17, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordem esse in aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:5:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Lig. 5, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 3:23:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 3, 23, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sint misericordes in furibus aerarii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dominus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Jacob. 5, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Deus) miseretur ei, quem viderit misericordem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> Div. Just. Epit. 5</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordior nulla est me feminarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:1:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 1, 5, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in illā gravi L. Sullae turbulentāque victoriā quis P. Sulla mitior, quis misericordior inventus est?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:26:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 26, 72</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quando misericordissimus exstitisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 48" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes misericordissimi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 6</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29268.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mean, pitiful, contemptible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui autem natura dicuntur iracundi aut misericordes aut invidi aut tale quid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:37:80" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 37, 80</bibl></cit>.— <itype>Hence</itype>, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭcordĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">tenderheartedly, pitifully, compassionately, mercifully</hi> (ante- and post-class.): crudeliter illi, nos misericorditer, Quadrig. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 510, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 6, 18, 9</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 3, 31; 5, 23.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Doctr. Chr. 1:16" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Doctr. Chr. 1, 16</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">misericordissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 149" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 149</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
miserimonium: <entryFree id="n29269" type="main" key="mi^se^ri^mo_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭmōnĭum</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-mūnĭum</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>miser</etym>, <sense id="n29269.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wretchedness, misery</hi> (ante-class. for misera), Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 214, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miseriter: <entryFree id="n29270" type="main" key="mi^se^ri^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. miser <sense id="n29270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> 2.</sense></entryFree>
miseritudo: <entryFree id="n29271" type="main" key="mi^se^ri^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>miser</etym>. * <sense id="n29271.0" n="I" level="1"> For miseria, <hi rend="ital">wretchedness, misery</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 136, 18</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 185 Rib.).—</sense><sense id="n29271.1" n="II" level="1"> For miseratio, <hi rend="ital">pity, compassion</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 136, 20</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 79 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
miseritus: <entryFree id="n29272" type="main" key="mi^se^ri^tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrĭtus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsertus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from misereor, v. misereo.</entryFree>
misero: <entryFree id="n29273" type="main" key="mi^se^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕro</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <sense id="n29273.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v., act.</hi> collat. form of miseror (ante-class.): ut miserarent mala, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 470, 23</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 195 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
miseror: <entryFree id="n29274" type="main" key="mi^se^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n29274.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form, v misero) [miser]. </sense><sense id="n29274.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To lament, bewail, deplore</hi>: miseratur is, qui conqueritur aliena incommoda: miseretur is, qui miserum sublevat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=123" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 123</bibl> Müll. (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quis illaec est mulier, quae ipsa se miseratur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">communem condicionem miserari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:27:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 27, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sortemque animo miseratus iniquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:332" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 332</bibl></cit>.—Of a lamenting speech: <cit><quote lang="la">eos miserando casum suum confirmat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">casum alicujus miseratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec copiose miseratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29274.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To have</hi> or <hi rend="ital">feel compassion, to pity, compassionate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Acestes) ab humo miserans attollit amicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:452" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 452</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:499" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 499</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenem animi miserata,</quote> <trans><tr>pitying in her heart</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:686" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 686</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostibus ipsis pallorem miserantibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:101" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 101</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29274.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): te conmiserabam magis, quam miserabar mei, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 445, 12</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 355 Rib.): <cb n="MISS" /> eorum, <bibl default="NO"><author>Min. Fel.</author> Oct. 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenae juvenem indignae miseratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:381" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 381</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n29274.4" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: servis miseratus, Coripp. Laud. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:402" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 402</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29274.5" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrandus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., lamentable, deplorable, pitiable</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29274.6" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">ut aliis miserandus, aliis irridendus esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:37:169" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 37, 169</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 509</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 882</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:359" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 359</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 276</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 178</bibl>; 11, 704.—</sense><sense id="n29274.7" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">haec mihi videntur misera atque miseranda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus Priamo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:259" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 259</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 14, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miserandum in modum,</quote> <trans><tr>in a pitiable manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n29274.8" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕ-ranter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., pitifully, pathetically</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimose atque miseranter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
misertor: <entryFree id="n29275" type="hapax" key="mi^sertor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsertor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>syncop. for miserator, from miseror</etym>, <sense id="n29275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pitier, compassionater</hi>: miserande misertor, Ven. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:478" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 478</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miserulus: <entryFree id="n29276" type="main" key="mi^se^ru^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsĕrŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [miser], <hi rend="ital">wretched, unfortunate</hi> (ante-class.): animula miserula, Ser. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 517, 4</bibl>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217</bibl>: ut illius conmiserescas miserulae orbitudinis, Turp. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 146, 18</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 211 Rib.): cupidius miserulo obito, Liv. Andr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 869</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
misisula: <entryFree id="n29277" type="gloss" key="misisu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">misisŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crust of bread hollowed out in the shape of a spoon</hi>: misisula, <foreign lang="greek">musti/lh</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
missa: <entryFree id="n29278" type="main" key="missa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mitto</etym>, <sense id="n29278.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the mass</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 5, 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
missarium: <entryFree id="n29279" type="main" key="missa_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. missum.</entryFree>
missibilia: <entryFree id="n29280" type="hapax" key="mi^ssi^bi^lia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭssĭbĭlia</orth>, <itype>ĭum, for missilia</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 20</bibl></entryFree>
missicius: <entryFree id="n29281" type="main" key="missi_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missīcĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mitto</etym>, <sense id="n29281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">discharged from military service</hi> (postAug.): <cit><quote lang="la">praetorianus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3579</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3582</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
missiculo: <entryFree id="n29282" type="hapax" key="missi^cu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missĭcŭlo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send often</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad me litteras Missiculabas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:2:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 29</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
missilis: <entryFree id="n29283" type="main" key="missi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that may be hurled</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cast, that is thrown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">hurled, missile</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">lapides missiles,</quote> <trans><tr>slingstones</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferro, quod nunc missile libro,</quote> <trans><tr>a javelin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 421</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni sibi missile ferrum,</quote> <trans><tr>which he alone can launch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:8:524" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 8, 524</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aculei (of the porcupine),</quote> <trans><tr>capable of being shot forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 35, 53, § 125</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29283.1" n="II" level="1"> <pos>Subst.</pos> </sense><sense id="n29283.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">missĭle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a missile weapon, missile, a javelin</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">missilibus Lacedaemonii pugnabant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 39</bibl></cit>; in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">missilibus lacessere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:716" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 716</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pellere missilibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 520</bibl></cit>; 10, 802; in <number>sing.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:485" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 485</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29283.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">missĭlĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, or res missiles, <hi rend="ital">presents thrown by the emperors among the people</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sparsa et populo missilia omnium rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:11" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 11</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">jocandi licentia diripiendi pomorum, et obsoniorum rerumque missilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:98" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Aug. 98</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n29283.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad haec, quae a fortunā sparguntur, sinum expandit et sollicitus missilia ejus exspectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 74:6" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 74, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
missio: <entryFree id="n29284" type="main" key="missi^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n29284.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a letting go, sending away, a sending, despatching; a throwing, hurling</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">litterarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">extra telorum missionem,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond the range of missiles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 5, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">missio sanguinis,</quote> <trans><tr>blood-letting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 29</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29284.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29284.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A release</hi> from captivity, <hi rend="ital">setting at liberty, liberation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">munus pro missione dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:48:114" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 48, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si filius familias post missionem faciat testimentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:106" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 106</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29284.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A discharge from service</hi> (of soldiers, office-holders, gladiators, etc.), <hi rend="ital">a dismission</hi> (syn. exauctoratio): <cit><quote lang="la">praemium missionis ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 86</bibl></cit>: quibus (militibus) senatus missionem reditumque in patriam negāsset ante belli finem. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitum purgare missionibus turbulentorum hominum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 39</bibl></cit>; cf.: missionum generales causae sunt tres: honesta, causaria, ignominiosa. Honesta est, quae tempore militiae impleto datur: causaria cum quis vitio animi vel corporis minus idoneus militiae renunciatur; <cit><quote lang="la">ignominiosa causa est, cum quis propter delictum sacramento solvitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:49:16:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 49, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gratiosa ante emerita stipendia,</quote> <trans><tr>a discharge obtained by favor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 43, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum justa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:14:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 14, 15</bibl></cit>.—Of a quaestor, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:7" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29284.4" n="C" level="2"> Esp., of gladiators, <hi rend="ital">release, respite, quarter</hi>:<cb n="MIST" />  cum Myrino peteretur missio laeso, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:29:7" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 29, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non enim servavit is, qui non interfecit, nec beneficium dedit, sed missionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 2:20:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 2, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—Hence, sine missione, <hi rend="ital">without favor, without quarter, to the death</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 20, 12</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid prodest, paucos dies aut annos lucrificare? sine missione nascimur,</quote> <trans><tr>without respite in the service of wisdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 37:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine missione pugnatum est,</quote> <trans><tr>for life or death</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:20:4" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 20, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29284.5" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cessation, termination, end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante ludorum missionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29284.6" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Remission</hi> from punishment: missionem puero dedit, qs. <hi rend="ital">let him go</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 52</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29284.7" n="F" level="1"> In jurid. lang., <hi rend="ital">a delivering up, giving possession</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">missio in aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:2:15:section=12" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 2, 15, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
missitius: <entryFree id="n29285" type="main" key="missi_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missītĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. missicius.</entryFree>
missito: <entryFree id="n29286" type="main" key="missi^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missĭto</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>mitto</etym>, <sense id="n29286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to send repeatedly, to send</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.): <cit><quote lang="la">supplicantes legatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 38:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 38, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Eloq. p. 234" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Eloq. p. 234</bibl></cit> Mai.: <cit><quote lang="la">codicillos missitatos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 4, § 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
missor: <entryFree id="n29287" type="main" key="missor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who sends, throws</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">shoots, an archer</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">hic missore vacans fulgens jacet una sagitta (al.: hic misso revocans),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Arat. 84</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29288" type="main" key="Missor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Missor</orth>, <sense id="n29288.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Fabr.</author> 365, 111</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
missorium: <entryFree id="n29289" type="main" key="misso_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missōrĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dish, charger</hi>, for serving up food (post-class.): aurata missoria, Ven. Vit. S. Germ. 13; cf.: lances, missoria, Gloss. Isid.</sense></entryFree>
missum: <entryFree id="n29290" type="gloss" key="missum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a prize</hi>: <foreign lang="greek">a)=qlon</foreign>, missum, Gloss. Gr. Lat.; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">mis-sārĭum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:227" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 227</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
missus: <entryFree id="n29291" type="main" key="missus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from mitto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29292" type="main" key="missus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">missus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mitto</etym>, <sense id="n29292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sending away, a sending, despatching</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29292.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29292.2" n="A" level="2"> missu Caesaris ad Ambiorigem ventitare consueverat, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">duas venisse legiones missu Caesaris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Archippi regis missu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:752" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 752</bibl></cit>: quae valido venit contorta falarica missu, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 555, 15</bibl> (Ann. v. 534 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n29292.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A throwing, hurling, launching</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilum, haud paulo quam hasta vehementius ictu missuque telum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19, 7</bibl></cit> Weissenb. ad loc.: telorum, Auct. B. Hisp. 17, 3; 31, 1.— </sense><sense id="n29292.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29292.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A cast, a shot</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix absunt nobis missus bis mille sagittae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 408</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29292.6" n="B" level="2"> In the public games, <hi rend="ital">a course, a round, a heat</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">spectaculum multiplicatis missibus in serum produxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:22" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 4</bibl>: unus est missus qui ordinarius dicitur, Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:193" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 193</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29292.7" n="C" level="2"> At table, <hi rend="ital">a course</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">novem libras carnis per tres missus ponebat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Pert. 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mistarius: <entryFree id="n29293" type="hapax" key="mista_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistārĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mixtārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>misceo</etym>, <sense id="n29293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel in which wine was mixed with water, a mixing-vessel</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 546, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
misticius: <entryFree id="n29294" type="main" key="misti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistīcĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mixtīcĭus</orth>) or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-tĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of mixed race, mongrel, born of parents of different nations;</hi> a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">su/mmiktos</foreign> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> 5</bibl>, in Jer. 25, 19.</sense></entryFree>
mistim: <entryFree id="n29295" type="hapax" key="mistim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistim</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mixtim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>mistus</etym>, <sense id="n29295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixedly</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:566" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 566</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mistio: <entryFree id="n29296" type="main" key="misti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistĭo</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mix-</orth>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>misceo</etym>, <sense id="n29296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliam mixtionem habet genus avium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 4, 7</bibl></cit>; <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 4, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:11" default="NO" valid="yes">11</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a mixture</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 34, 5</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 7, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mistura: <entryFree id="n29297" type="main" key="mistu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistūra</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mix-</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29297.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mixing, mingling</hi> (ante-class. and post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n29297.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: mistura immoderata, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 490, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:978" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 978</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unguentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 1, 2, § 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29297.2" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">carnal intercourse, copulation</hi>, with or without Veneris: <cit><quote lang="la">externae Veneris mistura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:899" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 899</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum fero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 53, 79, § 213</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29297.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">a mixture, compound</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eā misturā os perfricatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas suppletur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 10, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:57:1" default="NO">12, 57, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29297.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mixing, mingling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitiorum atque virtutum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">raram facit mixturam cum sapientiā forma,</quote> <trans><tr>beauty is seldom united with wisdom</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex diversis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:6" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mira figurarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:40" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 40</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:37" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 2, 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliorum generum cum aliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:3:63" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 3, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translationum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:11:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 11, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
misturatus: <entryFree id="n29298" type="main" key="mistu_ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistūrātus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mix-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mistura</etym>, <sense id="n29298.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mixed, mingled</hi> (post-class.), Pelag Veter. 6. <pb n="1152" /> <cb n="MITH" /></sense></entryFree>
mistus: <entryFree id="n29299" type="main" key="mistus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mix-</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from misceo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29300" type="main" key="mistus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mistus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mix-</orth>), <itype>ūs</itype> (only in the <sense id="n29300.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>misceo</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a mixing, mingling</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">seminis mistu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:37:7" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 37, 7</bibl></cit> dub.</sense></entryFree>
mistyllus: <entryFree id="n29301" type="main" key="Mistyllus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mistyllus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mistu/llw</foreign>, to cut up</etym>, <sense id="n29301.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a cook</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:51:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 51, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
misulani: <entryFree id="n29302" type="main" key="Misula_ni"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Misulāni</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Mus-</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29302.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Numidia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 30</bibl>; called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Musulamii</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
misy: <entryFree id="n29303" type="greek" key="mi^sy"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭsy</orth>, <itype>yos</itype> (in the <sense id="n29303.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> also misys, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 34" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 34</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">and, misy,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:15" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 19, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 6, 16, 1</bibl>), <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mi/su</foreign>. </sense><sense id="n29303.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of mushroom</hi> or <hi rend="ital">truffle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 12, § 36</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29303.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mineral</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">a vitriolic ore, copperas, sory</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 12, 27, § 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:19:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 19, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:27" default="NO" valid="yes">27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 34" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 34</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:240" default="NO">240</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mite: <entryFree id="n29304" type="main" key="mi_te"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mīte</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mitis <sense id="n29304.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mitella: <entryFree id="n29305" type="main" key="mi^tella"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭtella</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mitra</etym>, <sense id="n29305.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a headband</hi>, a kind of <hi rend="ital">turban</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29305.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">nobiles adulescentes Neapoli cum mitellā saepe vidimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 10, 26</bibl></cit> (dub.): <cit><quote lang="la">copa Syrisca caput Graia redimita mitella,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Verg.</author> Cop. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitellā textili contecto capite,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitellis et crocotis et carbasinis et bombycinis injecti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8</bibl></cit>, p. 214, 5.—</sense><sense id="n29305.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a bandage</hi> for the arm, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 10, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitellita: <entryFree id="n29306" type="spur" key="mi^telli_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭtellīta</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭtellĭca</orth>, <itype>false reading for mellita</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 27</bibl>.</entryFree>
mitesco: <entryFree id="n29307" type="main" key="mi_tesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītesco</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mitisco</orth>), <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n29307.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [mitis], <hi rend="ital">to become mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mellow, to grow ripe</hi> (of fruits, to lose their roughness or harsh flavor; class.). </sense><sense id="n29307.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: nec grandiri frugum fetum posse nec mitescere, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 343, 16</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 142 Rib.): uvae a sole mitescunt, Cic. Oecon. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:5:8" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 5, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mala,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 14, 15, § 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cornus, arbutus, prunus, piri,</quote> <trans><tr>to grow mellow, ripe</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt (herbae) quae mitescere flamma, Mollirique queant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 78</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ervum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:22:153" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 22, 25, 73, § 153</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29307.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to grow mild, soft; to grow gentle, tame</hi>: offirmatod animo mitescit metus, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 406, 9</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 293 Rib.): nullum est ingenium tantum neque cor tam ferum, quod non ... mitiscat malo, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 473, 6</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 684 Rib.): caelum mitescere, arbores frondescere, Poët. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:15:505" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 15, 505</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpium juga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:147" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 25, 28, § 147</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferae quaedam numquam mitescunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 45</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29307.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to grow mild, gentle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo adeo ferus est, ut non mitescere possit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 39</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mithras: <entryFree id="n29308" type="main" key="Mi^thras"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭthras</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭthres</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mi/qras</foreign>. <sense id="n29308.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The sun-god</hi> of the Persians, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:717" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 717</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:13:12" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 13, 12</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 2, § 191</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Laud. Stil. 1, 63</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29308.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The proper name of a priest of Isis</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 267, 35</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29308.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Fab. p. 384, 38.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mithrĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mithras</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sacra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mithrax: <entryFree id="n29309" type="greek" key="mithrax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mithrax</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mitrax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mi/qrac</foreign>, <sense id="n29309.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Persian precious stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 10, 63, § 173</bibl>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">mithridax</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mithridates: <entryFree id="n29310" type="main" key="Mi^thri^da_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭthrĭdātes</orth>, <itype>is</itype> (<case>dat.</case> -dati, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:1:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 1, 6</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*miqrida/ths</foreign>. <sense id="n29310.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Mithridates the Great, king of Pontus, who waged war with the Romans, was at last conquered by Pompey, and stabbed himself</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 1, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:32 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 15, 32 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:19:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 19, 52</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 24, 57</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25, 59</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 2, 3, § 5</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8</bibl> ext. 13; 3, 7, 8. He eārly fortified himself against poison by taking antidotes; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, profecit poto Mithridates saepe veneno, Toxica ne possent saeva nocere sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:5:76" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 5, 76</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">antidotum Mithridatium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 24</bibl></cit>); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:5:23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 5, 23, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:252" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 252</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29310.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A witness against Flaccus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29310.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Pergamos, a friend of Cæsar</hi>, Auct. B. Alex. 26.—</sense><sense id="n29310.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Surnamed</hi> Euergetes, <hi rend="ital">an ally of the Romans against Carthage</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:37" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29310.4" n="V" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The fifth king of the Parthians, the most powerful of all the Parthian kings</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:41" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 41</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29310.5" n="VI" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The eighth king of the Parthians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:42:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 42, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29310.6" n="VII" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A king of Armenia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:8 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 8 sq.</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">12, 45</bibl> sq.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29310.7" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭthrĭ-dātēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭthradātīum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 1, 8, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:194" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 194</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a Mithridates</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nomina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:755" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 755</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 5, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 6, 26, § 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antidotus celebratissima quae Mithridatios vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:16" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 16</bibl></cit>, <cb n="MITI" /> 6.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭthrĭdātīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an antidote</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1:12" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1, 12</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29310.8" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭ-thrĭdātĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mithridates, Mithridatic</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">bellum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 3, 7</bibl></cit> (v. Mithridates, I.): <cit><quote lang="la">victoria,</quote> <trans><tr>over Mithridates</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 25, 30, § 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimen,</quote> <trans><tr>of the witness Mithridates</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 17, 41</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mithridax: <entryFree id="n29311" type="main" key="mithri_dax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mithrīdax</orth>, v. mithrax.</entryFree>
mitifico: <entryFree id="n29312" type="main" key="mi_ti^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mitis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n29312.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mellow, to mature, ripen; to make tame, to tame</hi> (mostly postAug. for the class. mitigo, q. v.). </sense><sense id="n29312.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: in omne corpus diviso et mitigato cibo, <hi rend="ital">well digested, distributed as nutriment</hi> (al. modificatus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:26:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 26, 57</bibl> Orell. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nocte sidus tepido fulgore mitificat (marinas locustas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 31, 50, § 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">elephantos,</quote> <trans><tr>to tame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 7, 7, § 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29312.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:12:4" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 12, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mitificus: <entryFree id="n29313" type="main" key="mi_ti^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mitifico</etym>, <sense id="n29313.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mild, soft, gentle</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vapores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Prud.</author> Ham. 963</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:474" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 474</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mitigabiliter: <entryFree id="n29314" type="main" key="mi_ti^ga_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭgābĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>mitigo</etym>, <sense id="n29314.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mildly, gently</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 3:4:32" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 3, 4, 32</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitiganter: <entryFree id="n29315" type="main" key="mi_ti^ganter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭganter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mitigo <sense id="n29315.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mitigatio: <entryFree id="n29316" type="main" key="mi_ti^ga_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭgātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mitigo</etym>, <sense id="n29316.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a soothing, mitigating, mitigation</hi> (rare but class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:30:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 30, 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">multis mitigationibus lenire,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 37, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae non indiget mitigationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 37, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si est lingua curationis, est et mitigationis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Sir. 36, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mitigativus: <entryFree id="n29317" type="main" key="mi_ti^ga_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭgātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29317.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soothing, mitigative</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">curatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:5:45" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Acut. 1, 5, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cataplasma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 2:1:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tard. 2, 1, 52</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:5:2:37" default="NO">5, 2, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitigatorius: <entryFree id="n29318" type="main" key="mi_ti^ga_to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭgātōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29318.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soothing, mitigative</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 6, 17, § 63</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitigo: <entryFree id="n29319" type="main" key="mi_ti^go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭgo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mitis-ago</etym>, <sense id="n29319.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make mild, soft</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">tender, make ripe</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mellow; to make tame, to tame</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29319.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum aestivā maturitate alia mitigaverit, alia torruerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit> (cited ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 343, 21</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">mitiget auctumnus, quod maturaverit aestas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 8</bibl></cit>: cibum, <hi rend="ital">to make soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">tender, to soften</hi> by boiling or roasting, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60:151" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60, 151</bibl>.—Comically: misero mihi mitigabat sandalio caput, <hi rend="ital">mellowed, broke</hi>, Turp. ap. Non. l. l.: <cit><quote lang="la">hic, qui dura sedens porrecto saxa leone Mitigat,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>makes soft for sitting on by spreading over them a lion's skin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:44:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 44, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Indus agros, laetificat et mitigat,</quote> <trans><tr>to make fruitful</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vina diluendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 22, 29, § 149</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">silvestres arbores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 12, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amaritudinem frugum,</quote> <trans><tr>to soften, mitigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 16, 40, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervicum duritias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 22, 92, § 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rabiem suum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilos,</quote> <trans><tr>to thin</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 6, 19, § 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal,</quote> <trans><tr>to tame</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 1:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">valetudinem temperantia,</quote> <trans><tr>to mitigate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:12:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29319.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to make mild</hi> or <hi rend="ital">gentle, to pacify, soothe, calm, assuage, appease, mitigate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum alicujus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:26:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 26, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te aetas mitigabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:31:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 31, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:6:15" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">querimonias, Col. praef.: tristitiam ac severitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:58:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 58, 236</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acerbam severitatem condimentis humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:3:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 3, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem pecuniā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temporum atrocitatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acrimonia mitigabitur laude,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 37, 50</bibl></cit>: aures, <hi rend="ital">to soothe</hi> with explanatory representations, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:1:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 1, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">metus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:2:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 12, 2, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feritatem animalium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:167" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 17, 102, § 167</bibl></cit>: alicui aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to reconcile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem Romanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:31:4:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 31, 4, 4</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">vix revocanti patri mitigatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:7:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 7, 6</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭganter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">adv., in a soothing manner; in order to soothe</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:1:13" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 1, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:4:3:62" default="NO">4, 3, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 1:11:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 1, 11, 76</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitilo: <entryFree id="n29320" type="main" key="mi^ti^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mĭtĭlo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <sense id="n29320.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. n., to cry like the</hi> acredula: acredula tunc mitilans (al. trutilans, truculans), Auct. Carm. Philom. 16.</sense></entryFree>
mitis: <entryFree id="n29321" type="main" key="mi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. mith-, to associate; Lat. mutuus</etym>, <sense id="n29321.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mild, mellow, mature, ripe;</hi> of the soil, <hi rend="ital">mellow, light, kindly, fruitful;</hi> of a river, <hi rend="ital">calm, gentle, placid</hi> (class.; syn.: lenis, placidus, comis). </sense><sense id="n29321.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt nobis mitia poma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:448" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 448</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Bacchus (i. e. vinum),</quote> <trans><tr>mellow</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 344</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:690" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 690</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mite solum Tiburis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1</bibl></cit>, <cb n="MITT" /> 18, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis (fluvius) in morem stagni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flamma,</quote> <trans><tr>harmless, innoxious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:120" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 120</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29321.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">mild, soft, gentle</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29321.3" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil tam vidi mite, nihil tam placatum, quam tum meus frater erat in sororem tuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis tranquillusque homo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo mitissimus atque lenissimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex feris et immanibus, mites reddidit et mansuetos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:2:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <case>acc.</case>, in respect of: <cit><quote lang="la">nec Mauris animum mitior anguibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:10:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 10, 18</bibl></cit>. —With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mites hostibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:1:48" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 1, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenitentiae mitior,</quote> <trans><tr>towards the penitent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Agr. 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29321.4" n="B" level="2"> Of things: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis et misericors animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:55:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 55, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:5:5" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 5, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 29, 160</bibl></cit>: malum, blandum atque dolosum, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 343, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitius exsilium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:185" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:13:20" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 13, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opes,</quote> <trans><tr>acquired through a long peace</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:14:653" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 14, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectus mitiores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 82</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:184" default="NO">13, 184</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29321.5" n="C" level="2"> Of speech: <cit><quote lang="la">Thucydides si posterius fuisset, multo maturior fuisset et mitior,</quote> <trans><tr>riper and mellower, more palalable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:83:288" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 83, 288</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis et compta oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hac tam atroci, sed illa lege mitissima, causam dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29321.6" n="III" level="1"> Comically, <hi rend="ital">made soft, mellow</hi> with beating: <cit><quote lang="la">mitis sum equidem fustibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:5:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 5, 31</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 12</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mīte</orth>, <hi rend="ital">mildly, soflly, gently</hi> (rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): mite connivere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 285, 4</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitius ille perit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:7:27" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 7, 27</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitissime legatos appellare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mitiusculus: <entryFree id="n29322" type="main" key="mi_ti^uscu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītĭuscŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29322.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [mitior], <hi rend="ital">rather mild, mildish</hi> (post-class.): febres, Cael. Aur. Acut. praef. § 18.</sense></entryFree>
mitra: <entryFree id="n29323" type="greek" key="mi_^tra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mī^tra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mi/tra</foreign>. <sense id="n29323.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A headband, coif, turban</hi> of the Asiatics; <cit><quote lang="la">in Greece and Rome worn only by women, except occasionally by effeminate young men: P. Clodius a crocotā, a mitrā ... est factus repente popularis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:21:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 21, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 9, 35, § 58</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">picta lupa barbara mitra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:66" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 66</bibl></cit>. Also worn by Bacchus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4:2:31" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4, 2, 31</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29323.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A rope</hi> (late Lat.), Tert. Carm. de Jona et Ninive, 42; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 4, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitratus: <entryFree id="n29324" type="main" key="mi_^tra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mī^trātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mitra</etym>, <sense id="n29324.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">wearing a turban, turbaned</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitrati chori,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 7, 42: <cit><quote lang="la">Arabes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caput,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 9, 2, 199</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 33, 16</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitrula: <entryFree id="n29325" type="main" key="mitru^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mitrŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29325.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little headband, band, bandage</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">alba mitrula,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mittendarius: <entryFree id="n29326" type="main" key="mittenda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mittendārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mitto</etym>, <sense id="n29326.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a public officer who was sent into the provinces to collect the taxes</hi> (post-class.): e numero mittendariorum, Impp. Gratian. Valent. et Theod. Cod. Th. 6, 30, 2; <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 8</bibl> and 9.</sense></entryFree>
mittix: <entryFree id="n29327" type="main" key="mittix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mittix</orth>, v. miscix.</entryFree>
mitto: <entryFree id="n29328" type="main" key="mitto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mitto</orth>, <itype>mīsi, missum, 3</itype> (contr. form, misti for misisti, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:14:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 14, 14</bibl>: archaic <sense id="n29328.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pass.</hi> mittier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 78</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>etym. dub.; cf. Sanscr. math-, to set in motion</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to go, let go, send, to send off, despatch</hi>, etc. </sense><sense id="n29328.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: ad Trojam cum misi ob defendendam Graeciam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:13:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 13, 28</bibl> (Trag. v. 362 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">filium suum foras ad propinquum suum quendam mittit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa ... quam plurima quam primumque mittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">legatos de deditione ad eum miserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pabulatum mittebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scitatum oracula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphos consultum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missus sum, te ut requirerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego huc missa sum ludere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equitatum auxilio Caesari Aedui miserant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui subsidium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad subsidium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:Balb. Hisp. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> Balb. Hisp. 9, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">misi, pro amicitiā, qui hoc diceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui solveret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittite ambo hominem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deiotarus legatos ad me misit, se cum omnibus copiis esse venturum,</quote> <trans><tr>sent me word that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad collegam mittit, opus esse exercitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 19, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publilius duo milia militum recepta miserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:23:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 23, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dexagoridas miserat ad legatum Romanum traditurum se urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim Athenas mittit se cum exercitu venturum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:3:7" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>. Missum facere is also used for mittere, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi>: ut cohortis ad me missum facias, Pompei. ap. <pb n="1153" /> <cb n="MITT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 12</bibl>, B, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morti,</quote> <trans><tr>to put to death, despatch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 5, 34</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ad mortem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:41:97" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 41, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in possessionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to put in possession</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 26, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem ad cenam,</quote> <trans><tr>to invite one to dinner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>: sub jugum mittere, <hi rend="ital">to send</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cause to go under the yoke</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub jugo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 28 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— </sense><sense id="n29328.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29328.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To send word, announce, tell, report</hi> any thing to any one: <cit><quote lang="la">ut mihi vadimonia dilata et Chresti conpilationem mitteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Curio misi, ut medico honos haberetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitti ad principes placuit, ut secernerent se ab Etruscis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hodie Spintherem exspecto: misit enim Brutus ad me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 10, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salutem alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to send greeting to, to greet one</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:13:1" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita existimes velim, me antelaturum fuisse, si ad me misisses, voluntatem tuam commodo meo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>if you had sent to me for aid, applied to me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 20, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29328.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To send as a compliment, to dedicate to any one</hi>, of a book or poem: <cit><quote lang="la">liber Antiochi, qui ab eo ad Balbum missus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:7:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc librum de Senectute ad te misimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29328.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To send, yield, produce, furnish, export</hi> any thing (as the product of a country): <cit><quote lang="la">India mittit ebur, molles sua tura Sabaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Padus) electra nuribus mittit gestanda Latinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:366" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 366</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quos frigida misit Nursia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:715" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 715</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordea, quae Libyci ratibus misere coloni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,003:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Med. Fac. 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quas mittit dives Panchaia merces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 213</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:12:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 12, 10</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29328.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To dismiss</hi> a thing from the mind: <cit><quote lang="la">maestumque timorem Mittite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:203" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 203</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittere ac finire odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">leves spes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missam iram facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:5:2:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 5, 2, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29328.7" n="E" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To put an end to, end</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:286" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 286</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29328.8" n="F" level="1"> Esp. in speaking, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pass over, omit, to give over, cease, forbear</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">praetermitto, praetereo, relinquo): quin tu istas mittis tricas?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:3:1:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 3, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto proelia, praetereo oppugnationes oppidorum,</quote>
