<trans><tr>omit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:15:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 15, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maledicta omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam scrutari mitto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:4:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 4, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitte male loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 5, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera mitte loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:13:7" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud dicere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Quint. 27, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:19:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 19, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto iam de rege quaerere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:7:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 7, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc exsequi mitto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incommoda mortalium deflere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 2.— With <hi rend="ital">quod</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitto, quod omnes meas tempestates subire paratissimus fueris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 4, 12</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">de.</hi> mitto de amissā maximā parte exercitūs (sc. dicere), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:20:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 20, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">verum, ut haec missa faciam, quae, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:45:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 45, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missos facere quaestus triennii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:44:section=104" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 44, § 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29328.9" n="G" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To let go, let loose, to quit, release, dismiss</hi>: mitte rudentem, sceleste, <hi rend="ital">Tr.</hi> Mittam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:4:3:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 4, 3, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">unde mittuntur equi, nunc dicuntur carceres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=153" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 153</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">quadrijuges aequo carcere misit equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:2:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 3, 2, 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 100</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mittin' me intro?</quote> <trans><tr>will you let me go in?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cutem,</quote> <trans><tr>to let go, quit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mitte me,</quote> <trans><tr>let me alone</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos missos face,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:5:1:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> And. 5, 1, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missum fieri,</quote> <trans><tr>to be let loose, set at liberty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11</bibl></cit>: eum missum feci, Caes. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 7</bibl>, G, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">nec locupletare amicos umquam suos destitit, mittere in negotium,</quote> <trans><tr>to set up in business</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rab. Post. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: sub titulum lares, <hi rend="ital">to put a bill on one's house</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to offer it for sale</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to be let</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> R. Am. 302</bibl>: in consilium, <hi rend="ital">to let the judges go and consult</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to send the judges to make out their verdict</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:9:section=26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 9, § 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sues in hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>to set upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1309</bibl></cit>: se in aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to fall upon, assail, attack</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vota enim faceretis, ut in eos se potius mitteret, quam in vestras possessiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:28:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 28, 76</bibl></cit> (B. and K. immitteret): <cit><quote lang="la">se in foedera,</quote> <trans><tr>to enter into, conclude, make</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:190" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missos faciant honores,</quote> <trans><tr>to let go, renounce, not trouble one's self about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:66:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 66, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos missos facio, et quantum potest, abesse ex Africā jubeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. Afr. 54" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. Afr. 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missam facere legionem,</quote> <trans><tr>to dismiss</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:69" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">remotis, sive omnino missis lictoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Lolliam Paulinam conjunxit sibi, brevique missam fecit,</quote> <trans><tr>put her away</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 25</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 70</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29328.10" n="H" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To let</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bring out, to put forth, send out, emit</hi>: <cb n="MNES" /> sanguinem incisā venā, <hi rend="ital">to let blood, to bleed</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 2, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguinem alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:ib" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 91</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: mittere sanguinem provinciae, <hi rend="ital">to bleed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">drain, exhaust</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">missus est sanguis invidiae sine dolore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 16, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">radices,</quote> <trans><tr>to put forth roots, to take root</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">folium,</quote> <trans><tr>to put forth leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 10, § 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">florem,</quote> <trans><tr>to blossom, bloom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membranas de corpore,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw off, shed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serpens horrenda sibila misit,</quote> <trans><tr>gave forth, emitted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 38</bibl></cit>: mittere vocem, <hi rend="ital">to utter a sound, raise one's voice, speak, say</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem pro me ac pro re publica nemo mittit,</quote> <trans><tr>speaks a word</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:19:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 19, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocem liberam,</quote> <trans><tr>to speak with freedom</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flens diu vocem non misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adeo res miraculo fuit, ut unus ex barbaris miserit vocem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:10:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 4, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">repente vocem sancta misit Religio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:4:11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 4, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec labra moves, cum mittere vocem debueras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:114" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec Scipionis oratio ex ipsius ore Pompeii mitti videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Afranios sui timoris signa misisse,</quote> <trans><tr>have showed signs of fear</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:229" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 229</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signum sanguinis,</quote> <trans><tr>to show signs of blood, look bloody</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:882" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 882</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29328.11" n="K" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To send, throw, hurl, cast, launch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hastam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides in aliquem,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina,</quote> <trans><tr>to hurl</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:12:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 12, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid igni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:313" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de ponte,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast, precipitate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:17:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 17, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praecipitem aliquem ex arce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 250</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se saxo ab alto,</quote> <trans><tr>to cast one's self down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:340" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 340</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in rapidas aquas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:6:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 6, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se in medium,</quote> <trans><tr>to plunge into the midst</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:54" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 54</bibl></cit>. —Of nets: <cit><quote lang="la">retia misit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:148" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 148</bibl></cit>.—Of dice, <hi rend="ital">to throw</hi>: talis enim jactatis, ut quisque canem, aut senionem miserat, etc., Aug. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">talos in phimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">panem alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to throw to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:1:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 1, 22, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexandrum manum ad arma misisse,</quote> <trans><tr>laid his hand on his weapons</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pira in vasculo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fert missos Vestae pura patella cibos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:310" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accidere in mensas ut rosa missa solet,</quote> <trans><tr>which one has let fall</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:360" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 360</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29328.12" n="L" level="1"> = <foreign lang="greek">pe/mpein</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">to attend, guide, escort</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alias (animas) sub Tartara tristia mittit (Mercurius),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:243" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 243</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sic denique victor Trinacriā fines Italos mittēre relictā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 440</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Missus</orth>, <itype>a</itype>, um; as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Missus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">he that is sent, the messenger</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ambassador</hi> of God, i. e. Christ, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 73</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 7, 2, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitulus: <entryFree id="n29329" type="greek" key="mi_tu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītŭlus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mȳtŭlus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mȳtĭlus</orth>), <itype>n</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mu/tulos,</foreign> <sense id="n29329.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of mussel, seamussel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 51, 74, § 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:32:111" default="NO" valid="yes">32, 9, 36, § 111</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">mutulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 158</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:4:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 4, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mitylene: <entryFree id="n29330" type="main" key="Mi^ty^le_ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mĭtylēnē</orth> and its derivv., v. Mytilene.</entryFree>
mitylus: <entryFree id="n29331" type="main" key="mi_ty^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mītylus</orth>, v. mytilus.</entryFree>
mitys: <entryFree id="n29332" type="hapax" key="Mitys"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mitys</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-yos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-yis</orth>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29332.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a river of Macedonia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
miurus: <entryFree id="n29333" type="greek" key="mi_^u_rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mī^ūrus versus</orth>, <foreign lang="greek">mi/ouros, mei/ouros</foreign>, <sense id="n29333.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a hexameter that has at the end an iambus instead of a spondee</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ter.</author> de Metr. p. 2425</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Centim. p. 1824</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
mius: <entryFree id="n29334" type="main" key="mius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, an old form for meus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 319</bibl> P.: v. meus.</entryFree>
mixtarius: <entryFree id="n29335" type="main" key="mixta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mixtārĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mixtĭo</orth>, etc., v. mist-.</entryFree>
mna: <entryFree id="n29336" type="main" key="mna"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. mina.</entryFree>
mnaseas: <entryFree id="n29337" type="main" key="Mnase^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnasĕas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mnase)as,</foreign> <sense id="n29337.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an author who wrote</hi> De Re Rustica, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:9" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 2, 11, § 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mnemon: <entryFree id="n29338" type="main" key="Mne_mon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnēmon</orth>, <itype>ŏnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mnh/mwn</foreign> (having a good memory). <sense id="n29338.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of king Artaxerxes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,021:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Reg. 1, 3</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29338.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 819, 2.</sense></entryFree>
mnemonides: <entryFree id="n29339" type="main" key="Mne_mo^ni^des"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnēmŏnĭdes</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29339.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Muses, daughters of Mnemosyne</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:268" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 268</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">280</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mnemosyne: <entryFree id="n29340" type="main" key="Mne_mo^sy^ne_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnēmŏsynē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mnhmosu/nh</foreign> (remembrance). <sense id="n29340.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The mother of the Muses</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 114</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:31:54" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 31, 54</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl> prol. 18: <cit><quote lang="la">natae Mnemosynes,</quote> <trans><tr>the Muses</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 4, 64</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29340.1" n="II" level="1"> In <number>plur.</number>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnēmŏ-synae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the Muses</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 11, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mnemosynon: <entryFree id="n29341" type="greek" key="mne_mo^sy_non"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mnēmŏsȳnon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mnhmosunon,</foreign> <sense id="n29341.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a memorial</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mnemosynon mei sodalis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 12, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mnesarchus: <entryFree id="n29342" type="main" key="Mne_sarchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnēsarchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mnh/sarxos</foreign>. <sense id="n29342.0" n="I" level="1"> Acc. to some, <hi rend="ital">the father of Pythagoras</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. 2, p. 55</bibl> Oud.—</sense><sense id="n29342.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Stoic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:11:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 11, 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 18, 83 al.</bibl> <cb n="MOCI" /></sense></entryFree>
mnester: <entryFree id="n29343" type="greek" key="mne_ster1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mnēster</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mnhsth/r,</foreign> <sense id="n29343.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a wooer, suitor</hi>, pure Lat. procus: <cit><quote lang="la">ad mnesteras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 126" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 126</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29344" type="main" key="Mne_ster2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnēster</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29344.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">M. Lepidus Mnester,</quote> <trans><tr>a pantomime, favorite of Caligula</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:36" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 36</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">55</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">57</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mnestheus: <entryFree id="n29345" type="main" key="Mnestheus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnestheus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">dissyl.</orth>), <itype>ĕi and ĕōs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mnhsqeu/s,</foreign> <sense id="n29345.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Trojan</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mnesthea vocat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:288" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 288</bibl></cit>.—On account of the metre, also Menestheus (trisyl.): <cit><quote lang="la">fratre Menestheo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:129" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 129</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mnevis: <entryFree id="n29346" type="main" key="Mne_vis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mnēvis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mneu=is,</foreign> <sense id="n29346.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a black ox consecrated to the sun-god at Heliopolis</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mnevidis regia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 8, 14, § 65</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 22, 14, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moab: <entryFree id="n29347" type="main" key="Mo_ab"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōab</orth>, <gen>f.</gen> <sense id="n29347.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">indecl., the mountainous region on the eastern coast of the Dead Sea, extending from Zoar to the river Arnon</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:36:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 36, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">48, 15</bibl> and 20, etc.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29347.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōăbītēs</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">an inhabitant of Moab, a Moabite</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> 1</bibl> Chron. 11, 46.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: Moabitae (= <foreign lang="greek">*mwabi=tai</foreign>), <hi rend="ital">the Moabites</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:19:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 19, 37</bibl> et saep.—</sense><sense id="n29347.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōăbītis</orth>, <itype>tĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (<foreign lang="greek">*mwabi=tis</foreign>). </sense><sense id="n29347.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Moabite</hi> (sc. regio), <hi rend="ital">the land of the Moabites, Moab</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 1, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29347.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Subst., a Moabitish woman</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Ruth, 1, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mobilis: <entryFree id="n29348" type="main" key="mo_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōbĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>for movibilis, from moveo</etym>, <sense id="n29348.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easy to be moved, movable; loose, not firm</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29348.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum pernix pedibus manibus mobilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobiles turres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:11:32" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 11, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:57:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 57, 142</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supercilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 51, § 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">penna,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobilissimus ardor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:11:30" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 11, 30</bibl></cit>: mobiles res and mobilia bona, in law, <hi rend="ital">movable things, movables, chattels</hi> (opp. to lands, houses, fixtures), as <hi rend="ital">cattle, money, clothes</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 6, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">remedium ad dentium mobiles firmandos,</quote> <trans><tr>loose</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29348.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29348.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Pliable, pliant, flexible; excitable; nimble, quick, active, agile, rapid, swift, fleet</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum mobilis aetas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">populus mobilior ad cupiditatem agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">volat ambiguis mobilis alis hora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Hippol. 1141" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Hippol. 1141</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Oedip. 992" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Oedip. 992</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobile et expeditum agmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:14:16" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti,</quote> <trans><tr>the fleet winds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:5:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 5, 110</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">puncto mobilis horae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">transitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:7" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <trans><tr>versatility of talent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29348.4" n="B" level="2"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">changeable, inconstant, fickle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec in te animo fui mobili, sed ita stabili, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: Galli sunt in consiliis capiendis mobiles. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 5</bibl>; cf. under the <pos>adv.</pos> 2: <cit><quote lang="la">gens ad omnem auram spei mobilis atque infida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 46, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:66:2" default="NO" valid="yes">66, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">favor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 1:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Vit. Beat. 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobiles et fluxae res humanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 104:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 104, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobilis et varia est ferme natura malorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:237" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 237</bibl></cit>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n29348.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōbĭ-lĭa</orth>, <itype>ium</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">movable goods, chattels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mobilia quidem et moventia, quae modo in jus adferri adducive possent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 4:16" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 4, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29348.6" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Adv.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mōbĭlĭter</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with rapid motion, rapidly, quickly</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29348.7" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Lit</orth>. (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mobiliter quae feruntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:745" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 745</bibl></cit> cor mobiliter palpitare, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:9:24" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 9, 24</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">reverti mobilius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:635" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 635</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n29348.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnes fere Gallos ad bellum mobiliter celeriterque excitari,</quote> <trans><tr>hastily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 10, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mobilitas: <entryFree id="n29349" type="main" key="mo_bi^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōbĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mobilis</etym>, <sense id="n29349.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">movableness, mobility, activity, speed, rapidity, quickness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29349.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">animal mobilitate celerrimā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:15:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 15, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguae,</quote> <trans><tr>volubility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:28:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 28, 127</bibl></cit>: equitum, <hi rend="ital">agility, rapidity</hi> (opp. stabilitas peditum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulminis,</quote> <trans><tr>quickness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 323</bibl></cit>. sanare mobilitates dentium, <hi rend="ital">looseness</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 21, 84, § 224</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29349.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29349.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Changeableness, fickleness, inconstancy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid est inconstantiā, mobilitate, levitate turpius?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:3:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 7, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Dion. 6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Dion. 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenii,</quote> <trans><tr>inconstancy of character</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 88:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 88, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29349.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Quickness, vivacity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">opus est naturali quādam mobilitate animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mobiliter: <entryFree id="n29350" type="main" key="mo_bi^li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōbĭlĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. mobilis <sense id="n29350.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
mobilito: <entryFree id="n29351" type="main" key="mo_bi^li^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōbĭlĭto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mobilis</etym>, <sense id="n29351.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make movable, to make quick</hi> (ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">omnia mobilitantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:248" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 248</bibl></cit>: laetitia me mobilitat, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 4, 346, 14</bibl>: mobilitatā mente, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 137, 27</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 91 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
mocilla: <entryFree id="n29352" type="main" key="Mo_cilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mōcilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. L. Julius Mocilla, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 11</bibl>. <pb n="1154" /> <cb n="MODE" /></sense></entryFree>
mocosus: <entryFree id="n29353" type="spur" key="mo_co_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōcōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um, a false reading for inotiosus</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:183" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 183</bibl>; <sense id="n29353.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">and for morosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moderabilis: <entryFree id="n29354" type="hapax" key="mo^de^ra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>moderor</etym>, <sense id="n29354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil moderabile suadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:6:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 6, 59</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moderamen: <entryFree id="n29355" type="main" key="mo^de^ra_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of managing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">governing</hi>, e. g. <hi rend="ital">a rudder, helm</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose). </sense><sense id="n29355.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29355.2" n="A" level="2"> Innixus moderamine navis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 726</bibl>; so in <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:644" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 644</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29355.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Management, direction, control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 48</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29355.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: rerum, <hi rend="ital">the helm</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">the management of affairs, the government of the state</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:677" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 677</bibl>; also, <hi rend="ital">a means of moderating, mitigating, controlling</hi>: verum serenitas nostra certum moderamen invenit, Cod. Th. 11, 30, 64.</sense></entryFree>
moderamentum: <entryFree id="n29356" type="main" key="mo^de^ra_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of guidance, a guide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">accentus moderamenta vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:6:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 6, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moderanter: <entryFree id="n29357" type="hapax" key="mo^de^ranter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕranter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with control</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderanter habere habenas, = moderari habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:1096" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 1096</bibl></cit> Munro ad loc.</sense></entryFree>
moderate: <entryFree id="n29358" type="main" key="mo^de^ra_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. modero <sense id="n29358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
moderatim: <entryFree id="n29359" type="hapax" key="mo^de^ra_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>moderatus</etym>, <sense id="n29359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in due measure, gradually</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">crescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:323" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 323</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moderatio: <entryFree id="n29360" type="main" key="mo^de^ra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moderor</etym>. <sense id="n29360.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A moderating, moderation</hi> in any thing; <hi rend="ital">moderateness, temperateness</hi> of the weather (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">dummodo illa praescriptio moderatioque teneatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:18:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cael. 18, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio et continentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicendi,</quote> <trans><tr>in speaking</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio modestiaque in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effrenati populi,</quote> <trans><tr>a moderating, restraining</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:9:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 9, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conflagrare terras necesse est a tantis ardoribus, moderatione et temperatione sublatā,</quote> <trans><tr>temperate state</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:36:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 36, 92</bibl></cit>.— In gen., <hi rend="ital">regular arrangement, regularity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatio et conformatio continentiae et temperantiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:25:96" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 25, 96</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29360.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Guidance, government</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:35:185" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 35, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rei publicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moderator: <entryFree id="n29361" type="main" key="mo^de^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a manager, ruler, governor, director.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29361.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">rector et moderator tanti operis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:35:90" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 35, 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:28:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 28, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:245" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arundinis,</quote> <trans><tr>an angler</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:8:856" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 856</bibl></cit>: pectinis unci, <hi rend="ital">a wool-comber</hi>, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 2, 381</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventae,</quote> <trans><tr>a tutor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:90:1" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 90, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Nazar.</author> Pan. ad Const. 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29361.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">He who moderates</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec moderator adest,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who could moderate, put a limit to the evil</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:561" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 561</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 49</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moderatrix: <entryFree id="n29362" type="main" key="mo^de^ra_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moderator</etym>. <sense id="n29362.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">She who moderates</hi> or <hi rend="ital">allays; a directress, mistress, governess</hi> (mostly Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29362.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">That which rules, guides, controls</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantia est moderatrix omnium commotionum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:14:42" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 14, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">materiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:39:92" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 39, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">factorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:18:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 18, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 24, 57</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moderatus: <entryFree id="n29363" type="main" key="mo^de^ra_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. modero <sense id="n29363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
modernus: <entryFree id="n29364" type="main" key="mo^dernus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdernus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>from modo, just now; like hodiernus from hodie</etym>, <sense id="n29364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">modern</hi> (post-class.); as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏderna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">things</hi> or <hi rend="ital">institutions of the present</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">antiquorum diligentissimus imitator, modernorum nobilissimus institutor,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 4, 51</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modero: <entryFree id="n29365" type="main" key="mo^de^ro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>modus</etym>, <sense id="n29365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to moderate</hi> a thing (in <hi rend="ital">verb. fin.</hi> only anteand post-class.). </sense><sense id="n29365.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29365.2" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: neque tuum te ingenium moderat, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 471, 7</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29365.3" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego voci moderabo meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:2:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 2, 115</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29365.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to regulate</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:5:14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 5, 14</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita res moderatur, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:3:39" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 23, 3, 39</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., keeping within due bounds, observing moderation, moderate</hi> (Ciceron.). </sense><sense id="n29365.5" n="A" level="2"> Of persons: <cit><quote lang="la">moderati senes tolerabilem agunt senectutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:3:7" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in omnibus vitae partibus moderatus ac temperans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:14:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 14, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatum esse in re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 40</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Gracchis cupidine victoriae haud satis moderatus animus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29365.6" n="B" level="2"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">moderated, kept within due measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">bounds, moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivium moderatum atque honestum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 6, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:4:57" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 4, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:2:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Brut. 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:29:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 29, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:8:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 8, 34</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cb n="MODE" /> quando annona moderatior? <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:126:3" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 126, 3</bibl>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: moderatissimus sensus, Planc. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 24, 5</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕ-rātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with moderation, moderately</hi> (Ciceron.): <cit><quote lang="la">moderate dictum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:10:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Font. 10, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia humana placate et moderate feramus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderate et clementer jus dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderatius id volunt fieri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>. —<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">res moderatissime constituta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:5:12" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moderor: <entryFree id="n29366" type="main" key="mo^de^ror"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĕror</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype> (<sense id="n29366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> moderarier for moderari, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1298" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1298</bibl>), <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>modus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to set a measure, set bounds</hi> to a thing (syn.: tempero, rego, guberno). </sense><sense id="n29366.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to moderate, mitigate, restrain, allay, temper, qualify;</hi> with <case>dat.</case> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">moderari linguae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:4:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 4, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderare animo, ne sis cupidus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 5, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dictis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:20:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 20, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moderari uxoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:4:6:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 4, 6, 16</bibl></cit> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 499, 15</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">quis illi finem statuet aut quis moderabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 51, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 2, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae suae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:35:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 35, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animo et orationi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cursui,</quote> <trans><tr>to sail slowly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29366.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">gaudium moderans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritiam legum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Dom. 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29366.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to manage, regulate, rule, guide, govern, direct</hi> (class. with <case>acc.</case>): <cit><quote lang="la">senatum servire populo, cui populus ipse moderandi et regendi sui potestatem tradidisset?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus, qui regit et moderatur et movet id corpus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:6:24:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 6, 24, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">linguam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moderari equos ac flectere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 4, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:223" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 223</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hocine fieri, ut inmodestis te hic moderere moribus? i. e. immodeste te geras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res rusticas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:98:section=227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 98, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officio consilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:25:81" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 25, 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem blandius Orpheo,</quote> <trans><tr>to strike more harmoniously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:24:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 24, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens quae omnia moderetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 37, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cantus numerosque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:36:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 36, 104</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego inscitus sum, qui ero me postulem moderarier,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 2, 3, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non vinum hominibus moderari, sed homines vino solent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleni moderari frena theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:128" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">funiculo navi moderari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:51:154" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 51, 154</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in utroque magis studia partium quam bona aut mala sua moderata (sunt),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 73:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 73, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortuna, cujus libido gentibus moderatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 51:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> C. 51, 25</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modeste: <entryFree id="n29367" type="main" key="mo^deste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. modestus <sense id="n29367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
modestia: <entryFree id="n29368" type="main" key="mo^desti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>modestus</etym>, <sense id="n29368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">moderateness, moderation;</hi> esp. in one's behavior, <hi rend="ital">unassuming conduct, modesty</hi> (opp. immodestia, superbia, licentia; class.). </sense><sense id="n29368.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: eam virtutem Graeci <foreign lang="greek">swfrosu/nhn</foreign> vocant: <cit><quote lang="la">quam soleo equidem tum temperantiam, tum moderationem appellare, nonnumquam etiam modestiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:8:16" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modestia est in animo continens moderatio cupiditatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rectum dividitur in prudentiam, justitiam, fortitudinem, modestiam,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">disserebat de suā modestiā,</quote> <trans><tr>want of confidence in himself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n29368.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29368.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Unassuming conduct, discretion, moderation, sobriety</hi> of behavior (the predom. signif. of the word): <cit><quote lang="la">sarta tecta tua precepta usque habui mea modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine modo et modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperantiae partes sunt continentia, clementia, modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:54:164" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 54, 164</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modestia est, per quam pudor honestus claram et stabilem comparat auctoritatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minus se in milite modestiam et continentiam, quam virtutem et animi magnitudinem desiderare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in dicendo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modestia et humanitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 5, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque modum, neque modestiam victores habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 11:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 11, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29368.4" n="B" level="2"> </sense><sense id="n29368.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Shame, shamefacedness, modesty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">et sententiarum et compositionis et vocis et vultūs modestia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:55" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 55</bibl></cit>: virginalis, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:31:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 31, 66</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">primaeque modestia culpae Confundit vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:2:232" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 2, 232</bibl></cit>; <usg type="style">poet.</usg>: vacui lecti, i. e. (chaste) <hi rend="ital">celibacy</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Silv. 1, 2, 162</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29368.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Sense of honor, honor, dignity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque sumptui, neque modestiae suae parcere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29368.7" n="C" level="2"> As a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">eu)taci/a</foreign>, in the lang. of the Stoics, the quality of saying and doing everything in the proper place and at the proper time, <hi rend="ital">correctness of conduct, propriety</hi>: sic fit, ut modestia haec, quam ita interpretamur, <cb n="MODI" /> ut dixi, scientia sit opportunitatis idoneo rum ad agendum temporum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:40:142" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 40, 142</bibl> (v. the entire context).—</sense><sense id="n29368.8" n="D" level="2"> (Post-Aug) </sense><sense id="n29368.9" n="1" level="3"> Of the weather, <hi rend="ital">mildness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 43</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">clementia hiemis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 5, 6</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n29368.10" n="2" level="3"> Of the course of a stream, <hi rend="ital">gentleness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquarum modestia,</quote> <trans><tr>gentle course</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 20, 23, § 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modestinus: <entryFree id="n29369" type="main" key="Mo^desti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏdestīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, Inscr. Marin. Frat. Arv. 36; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 712, 2</bibl>.—So, Herennius Modestinus, <hi rend="ital">a celebrated lawyer under Alexander Severus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
modestus: <entryFree id="n29370" type="main" key="mo^destus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>modus</etym>, <sense id="n29370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">keeping due measure, moderate;</hi> esp. in behavior, <hi rend="ital">modest;</hi> as respects anger, <hi rend="ital">calm, gentle, dispassionate;</hi> towards others, <hi rend="ital">kind, forbearing, temperate, mild;</hi> in morals, <hi rend="ital">honest, virtuous, sober, discreet, moral</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">vir modestus et frugi,</quote> <trans><tr>unassuming, modest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentuli modestissimi pudor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:11:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 11, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plebs modestissima (opp. seditiosa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:31:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 31, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistula ut adversus magistrum morum modestior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 2, 4, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:1:4:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 18</bibl></cit> (19), 63: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:14:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 14, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o modestum ordinem,</quote> <trans><tr>kind, gentle, mild</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:47:section=124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ea (urbe) isti vestri satellites modesti insolentiam suam continebunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:1:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 1, 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mendicis modesti,</quote> <trans><tr>kind, friendly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 1, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier proba et modesta,</quote> <trans><tr>modest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:8:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 8, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">videas, dolere rebus flagitiosis modestos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modestissimi mores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ingenui parum modesti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servitia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vultus modesto sanguine fervens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:300" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 300</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdestē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with moderation, moderately, temperately, discreetly, modestly</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">modice et modeste vitam vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea quae, etiam ... cum modeste fiunt, tamen ipsa per se molesta sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 9, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rebus secundis modeste ac moderate uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hosti intrepide modesteque obviam ire,</quote> <trans><tr>quietly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:11:6" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 11, 6</bibl></cit>: modestissime vivere, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 1, 274</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui modeste paret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intueri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parcius et modestius praetentare misericordiam judicis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ille Romam modeste venturus est,</quote> <trans><tr>without hostile violence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modialis: <entryFree id="n29371" type="main" key="mo^di^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>modius</etym>, <sense id="n29371.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">containing a</hi> modius or <hi rend="ital">Roman peck</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aulae, calicesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:4:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 4, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">figura,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> ad Nat. 2, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modiatio: <entryFree id="n29372" type="main" key="mo^di^a_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring by</hi> modii (post-class.), Cod. Th. 11, 24, 2.</sense></entryFree>
modice: <entryFree id="n29373" type="main" key="mo^di^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. modicus <sense id="n29373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
modicellus: <entryFree id="n29374" type="hapax" key="mo^di^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭcellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [modicus], <hi rend="ital">very moderate, very little</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">modicella culcita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:48" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 48</bibl></cit> dub. (al. modica; v. Oud. ad loc.).</sense></entryFree>
modico: <entryFree id="n29375" type="main" key="mo^di^co_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭcō</orth>, v. modicus.</entryFree>
modicus: <entryFree id="n29376" type="main" key="mo^di^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>modus</etym>, <sense id="n29376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having</hi> or <hi rend="ital">keeping a proper measure, moderate</hi> (cf. mediocris); esp. in behavior, <hi rend="ital">modest, temperate;</hi> also, of size, <hi rend="ital">moderate-sized; middling, ordinary, mean, bad</hi> (class.; syn.: moderatus, mediocris). </sense><sense id="n29376.1" n="I" level="1"> In a good sense: <cit><quote lang="la">modico gradu ire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:3:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 3, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:51:115" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 51, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">convivia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:13:44" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">severitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 18, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">industrios, supplices, modicos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domi modicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 63:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 63, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicum quoddam corpus (historiae),</quote> <trans><tr>a book of a tolerable size</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amant (mala) modicas rigationes,</quote> <trans><tr>gentle, moderate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 3, 25, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29376.2" n="II" level="1"> In a disparaging sense, <hi rend="ital">middling, ordinary, mean, scanty, small</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">genus dicendi subtile in probando, modicum in delectando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 21, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oculi,</quote> <trans><tr>middling-sized</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 37, 53, § 141</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea, valde et modica, et illustria sunt,</quote> <trans><tr>few in number</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:32:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 32, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graecis hoc modicum est,</quote> <trans><tr>not frequent</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:19:62" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 19, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecunia,</quote> <trans><tr>little, scanty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:6:2:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Par. 6, 2, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acervus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 190</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incrementa,</quote> <trans><tr>small</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <trans><tr>short</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 2, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rem pateris modicam,</quote> <trans><tr>a trifling affliction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modici amici,</quote> <trans><tr>humble, poor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:108" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 108</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabinus modicus originis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:4" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecuniae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 73</bibl></cit>. —As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. spatium), <hi rend="ital">a little way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicum progredi,</quote> <trans><tr>a little</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 6, p. 180, 38</bibl></cit>: modico contentus. <pb n="1155" /> <cb n="MODI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:9" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 9</bibl>.—Also, in <case>abl.</case>, modico adverbially: <cit><quote lang="la">modico deinde regressa,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>after a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modico prius, quam Larissam accederem,</quote> <trans><tr>a short time before</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 105 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modico secus progredi,</quote> <trans><tr>to go a little farther</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> p. 112, 10.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">with moderation, moderately; modestly; in a proper manner;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">in an ordinary manner, meanly, poorly</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29376.3" n="1" level="3"> Modice hoc faciam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolorem modice ferre,</quote> <trans><tr>quietly, calmly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:46:111" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 46, 111</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 11, 3, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">se recipere,</quote> <trans><tr>quietly, in good order</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 15</bibl></cit>: verecunde et modice, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 342, 23</bibl> (Trag. v. 241 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">modice et modeste vitam vivere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice et scienter uti re aliquā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:29:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 1, 29, 132</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29376.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Slightly, not very, not much</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minae Clodii modice me tangunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice vinosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locuples,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:14:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 38, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modice instratus torus,</quote> <trans><tr>slightly, meanly, scantily</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 73</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modificatio: <entryFree id="n29377" type="main" key="mo^di^fi^ca_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭfĭcātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>modificor</etym>, <sense id="n29377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measuring, measure</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">versuum lex ac modificatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:10:3:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 10, 3, 15</bibl></cit>; cf. Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=160:10" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 160, 10</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
modificator: <entryFree id="n29378" type="main" key="mo^di^fi^ca_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭfĭcātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29378.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who gives the proper measure</hi> to a thing, <hi rend="ital">a moderator, manager</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tibicen omnis modi peritus modificator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Flor. p. 341</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modificatus: <entryFree id="n29379" type="main" key="mo^di^fi^ca_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. modificor <sense id="n29379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> b.</sense></entryFree>
modifico: <entryFree id="n29380" type="main" key="mo^di^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>āre, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n29380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [modusfacio]. </sense><sense id="n29380.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr., to limit, set limits to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui in aliquā re intercedere aut modificare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:3" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 3</bibl></cit> Mai.—</sense><sense id="n29380.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act., to control, regulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitalis motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:de Music. 6:17:58" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> de Music. 6, 17, 58</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass. reflex., to observe due measure, keep within bounds, to be moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modificari in sumptibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Doctr.
