Plat. p. 18, 37</bibl></cit>.—Class. only in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.</hi> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭfĭcātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">measured off, measured</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba modificata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,038:5:17" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Part. Or. 5, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">membra modificata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ... modificata utriusque rei participatione,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> de Deo Socr. p. 47, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29380.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Melodious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">luseiniarum querelae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 9, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modificor: <entryFree id="n29381" type="main" key="mo^di^fi^cor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭfĭcor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> (<sense id="n29381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form, v. modifico), <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> and <gen>n.</gen> <etym>modificus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to measure off, measure</hi> a thing (post-class. in <hi rend="ital">verb. finit.</hi>). </sense><sense id="n29381.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">comprehensa mensura Herculani pedis, quanta longinquitas corporis ei mensurae conveniret ... modificatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:3" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29381.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to set a measure, set bounds to, to moderate;</hi> with <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">immaturis liberorum desideriis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 267, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Flor. p. 365, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">desideriis omnibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:ad Ver. Imp. 6" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> ad Ver. Imp. 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modificus: <entryFree id="n29382" type="main" key="mo^di^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>modus-facio</etym>, <sense id="n29382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">measured</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">mela modifica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Parent. 27, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modimperator: <entryFree id="n29383" type="hapax" key="mo^dimpe^ra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdimpĕrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for modi imperator</etym>, <sense id="n29383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the president</hi> or <hi rend="ital">chairman of a convivial party</hi>, who prescribes the quantity to be drunk (the magister bibendi, the Greek <foreign lang="greek">sumposi/arxos</foreign>): potandi modimperatores, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 142, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
modiolum: <entryFree id="n29384" type="main" key="mo^di^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of modium, v. modius</etym>, <sense id="n29384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the yolk</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quinque ovorum modiola,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modiolus: <entryFree id="n29385" type="main" key="mo^di^o^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭŏlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>modius</etym>, lit., <sense id="n29385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small measure;</hi> hence, transf., </sense><sense id="n29385.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of drinking-vessel</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:2:37" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 2, 37</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29385.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A bucket</hi> on a water-wheel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 9</bibl>: modioli gemelli, <hi rend="ital">the boxes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">cylinders</hi> of a forcing-pump, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29385.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The nave</hi> of a wheel, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 4, 3, § 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29385.4" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The box</hi> to receive the axle-tree of an oilmill, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29385.5" n="V" level="1"> A surgical instrument, <hi rend="ital">a cylindrical borer with a serrated edge, a trepan</hi>, <foreign lang="greek">xoini/kion</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 8, 3 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
modium: <entryFree id="n29386" type="main" key="mo^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, v. modius.</entryFree>
modius: <entryFree id="n29387" type="main" key="mo^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype> (<sense id="n29387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> modiūm: <cit><quote lang="la">qui CCCC. modium quinque milia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:36:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 36, § 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 72</bibl></cit>), <gen>m.</gen> (<hi rend="ital">neutr.</hi> collat. form: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl>; so in <number>plur.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">modia vicena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 16, 43, § 145</bibl></cit>) [modus], <hi rend="ital">the Roman corn-measure, a measure, peck</hi>, containing sixteen sextarii, or the sixth part of a Greek medimnus (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">salis modium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 58</bibl></cit>: tritici modius, Cic. Div. <cb n="MODO" /> in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0013,001:10:30" default="NO"><author>Caecil.</author> 10, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">siligneae farinae modius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 9, 20, § 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modium populo dare asse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:17:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri Leontini decumae tertio anno venierunt tritici medimnum XXXVI., hoc est tritici modium CC. et XVI. milibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:46:section=110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 46, § 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non minorem quam decem milium modiorum navem fabricare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 3, 6</bibl></cit>.— <cit><quote lang="la">Prov.: verum illud est, quod dicitur, multos modios salis simul edendos esse, ut amicitiae munus expletum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:19:67" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 19, 67</bibl></cit>: modio nummos metiri, <hi rend="ital">to measure one's money by the peck</hi>, said of a rich woman, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 37</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dives, ut metiretur nummos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego nunc mihi modium mille esse argenti velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:4:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 4, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:220" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 220</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pleno modio,</quote> <trans><tr>in full measure, abundantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 1, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">argumentum vobis demensum dabo, non modo neque trimodio, verum ipso horreo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:prol. 15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. prol. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum ventres modio castigat iniquo,</quote> <trans><tr>with short measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:126" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 126</bibl></cit>.—Also as a measure for other things, <hi rend="ital">a peck</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">metiri modio oleario,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut metientibus dimidium (anulorum aureorum) super tres modios explesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 6, 4, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29387.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29387.2" n="A" level="2"> Among surveyors, <hi rend="ital">the third part of a</hi> jugerum, Auct. de Limit. p. 264 and 312 Goes.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mai. 4 al.</bibl> —</sense><sense id="n29387.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The socket, step, shoe</hi> in which the mast of a ship stands, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 19, 2, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
modo: <entryFree id="n29388" type="main" key="mo^do^"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŏ</orth> (scanned mŏdō, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:2:3:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 2, 3, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:11:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 11, 35</bibl>; Cic. poët. N. D. 2, 42, 107; v. Corss. Ausspr. 2, p. 480; Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2, p. 140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, p. 140</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>orig. <case>abl.</case> of modus, q. v.</etym>. <sense id="n29388.0" n="I" level="1"> Qs., by measure, expressing, like tantum, a restriction of the idea, <hi rend="ital">only, merely, but</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29388.1" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n29388.2" n="1" level="3"> Affirmatively: ter sub armis malim vitam cernere, Quam semel modo parere, <hi rend="ital">even once</hi>, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=81" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 81</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 298 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">semel modo,</quote> <trans><tr>only once</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 3, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uni modo gessi morem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 3, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc autem si ita sit, ut unum modo sensibus falsum videatur, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Ac. 2, 32, 101</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum genera plura sunt: hi unum modo quale sit suspicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec audiendi quidam, qui tres modo primas esse partes volunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:3:4" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">paulum modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 1, 5</bibl></cit>, b, 2; Varr. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:15" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">perpauxillum modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 2, 74</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">manus erat nulla, quae parvam modo causam timoris afferret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:35:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 35, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae pacisci modo scis, sed quod pacta es, non scis solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad ornandam modo, non augendam orationem assumuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:8:6:39" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 8, 6, 39</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solere modo non etiam oportere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:4:18" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 4, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">doctrina ac litterae secundis rebus delectationem modo habere videbantur, nunc vero etiam salutem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:12:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circi modo spectaculum fuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl></cit>: modo facito ut illam serves, <hi rend="ital">only see that</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo fac, ne quid aliud cures, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:11:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aetatem velim servire, Libanum ut conveniam modo,</quote> <trans><tr>if I can only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:2:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 2, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ut tacere possis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">concede, ut impune emerit, modo ut bonā ratione emerit,</quote> <trans><tr>if but. provided that</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:5:section=10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 5, § 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ut haec nobis loca tenere liceat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:14:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 14, 14, 1</bibl></cit>.— For the expressions dummodo, solummodo, and tantummodo, v. dum, solum, and tantum.—</sense><sense id="n29388.3" n="2" level="3"> Negatively: non modo ... sed (verum) etiam (et, or simply sed), <hi rend="ital">not only ... but also</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut non modo secunda sperare debeas, sed etiam adversa fortissimo animo ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo agendo, verum etiam cogitando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:19:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 19, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illum non modo favisse, sed et, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 11, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non modo falsum id esse, sed hoc verissimum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:44:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 2, 44, 71</bibl></cit>.— As to these expressions, and also respecting the omission of a second non in the latter clause, v. under sed and non.—</sense><sense id="n29388.4" n="B" level="2"> In partic., in restrictive clauses, for ullo or aliquo modo, <hi rend="ital">in any way</hi> or <hi rend="ital">degree, at all, only, even</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servus est nemo, qui modo tolerabili conditione sit servitutis, qui, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>who is in any tolerable condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:4:8:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 4, 8, 16</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam quis ignorat, qui modo umquam mediocriter res istas scire curavit, quin, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 64</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">quis est omnium, qui modo cum Musis habeat aliquod commercium, qui? etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nemo aliter philosophus sensit, in quo modo esset auctoritas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:39:86" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 39, 86</bibl></cit>; <cb n="MODO" /> cf.: servitus, honorifica modo, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,059:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> ad Brut. 1, 17, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum quam plurimis modo dignis, se utilem praebent,</quote> <trans><tr>be they but worthy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:26:92" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 26, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bonis viris ... faciendum est, modo pro facultatibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 17, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decerne, modo recte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:48:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 48, 138</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque veniam, quo vocas, modo adjutore te,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 13</bibl></cit>, a, 1: <cit><quote lang="la">atque utinam posset aliquā ratione hoc crimen quamvis falsa, modo humana atque usitata defendere,</quote> <trans><tr>if only</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:97:section=224" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 97, § 224</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.5" n="b" level="4"> Si modo, <hi rend="ital">if only</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu si modo es Romae: vix enim puto, sin es, hoc vehementer animadvertas velim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tute scis (si modo meministi) me tibi tum dixisse, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 18, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortasse vici, si modo permansero,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 44, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si modo sola queant saxa tenere fidem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.6" n="c" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in jurid. Latin, modo si, for dummodo, <hi rend="ital">if only, provided that</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">persequar inferius, modo si licet ordine ferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:263" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 263</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo si ejus nomine opus fiat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:39:1:18" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 39, 1, 18</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:26:2:28" default="NO">26, 2, 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:2:19:section=10" default="NO">19, 2, 19, § 10</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.7" n="d" level="4"> As a conjunction with <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>, for dummodo, <hi rend="ital">if only, provided that</hi> (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">quos valetudo modo bona sit, tenuitas ipsa delectat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:16:64" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 16, 64</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 9, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">manent ingenia senibus, modo permaneat studium et industria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 7, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:131" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 131</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo Juppiter adsit, Tertia lux classem Cretaeis sistet in oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:116" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 116</bibl></cit>.—So, modo ne for dummodo ne, <hi rend="ital">if only not, provided that not</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae de Sicinio audīsti, ea mihi probantur: modo ne illa exceptio in aliquem incurrat bene de nobis meritum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 5, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quis est paulo ad voluptates propensior, modo ne sit ex pecudum genere, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:105" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 30, 105</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 43, 132</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.8" n="2" level="3"> Modo non, like the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mo/non ou)xi/</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">all but, almost, nearly</hi>, = propemodum (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">modo non montes auri pollicens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 17</bibl></cit> Don.: <cit><quote lang="la">favet Fabi gloriae, quae modo non suā contumeliā splendeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:24:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 24, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pictor equum venientem, modo non vivum, comprehenderat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>, ext. 7: <cit><quote lang="la">modo non reclamante publico vigore,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 7, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">16, 12, 16</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">21, 14, 1</bibl>; 22, 6, 2 al.—</sense><sense id="n29388.9" n="3" level="3"> In colloq. lang. with imperatives, <hi rend="ital">just, now, only</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sequere hac modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:4:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 4, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedete hic modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:3:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rud. 3, 3, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propera modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:1:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 1, 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vide modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:14:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 14, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem scrutare modo, inquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:276" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 276</bibl></cit>.—Indignantly: <cit><quote lang="la">quin tu i modo,</quote> <trans><tr>begone now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:182" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 182</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">i modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:3:2:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Stich. 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tace modo,</quote> <trans><tr>be still now</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> As. 5, 2, 19</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">tu</hi> or <hi rend="ital">vos</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tu modo, dum licet, hunc fructum ne desere vitae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:15:49" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 15, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 73</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu modo posce deos veniam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos modo, inquit, parcite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:2:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 2, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:24" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:2:25" default="NO">9, 2, 25</bibl>.</sense><sense id="n29388.10" n="II" level="1"> With specifications of time, like Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)/rti</foreign> (reaching to the full measure of the time, fully). </sense><sense id="n29388.11" n="A" level="2"> In gen. </sense><sense id="n29388.12" n="1" level="3"> Of the pressent time, <hi rend="ital">just now, just</hi> (ante-class. and <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">quid? ego modo huic frater factus, dum intro eo atque exeo?</quote> <trans><tr>just now?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:5:1:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 5, 1, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo dolores, meatu, occipiunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 1, 2</bibl></cit> (evidenter hic modo temporis praesentis adverbium est, Don.): <cit><quote lang="la">advenis modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:5:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Hec. 3, 5, 8</bibl></cit> Don.: <cit><quote lang="la">devoravi nomen imprudens modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:4:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 4, 2, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam modo nunc possum contentus vivere parvo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:25" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 25</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">peccare fuisset Ante satis, penitus modo nunc genus omne perosos Femineum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.13" n="2" level="3"> Of time just passed, <hi rend="ital">just now, but this moment, a little while ago, lately</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nuper homines nobiles hujusmodi, judices, et quid dico nuper? immo vero modo ac plane paulo ante vidimus, qui, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:3:section=7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Ita uti dudum dixeras? <hi rend="ital">Am.</hi> Dudum? quam dudum istuc factum est? <hi rend="ital">Al.</hi> Temptas: <cit><quote lang="la">jam dudum, pridem, modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quando? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Hodie. <hi rend="ital">Ph.</hi> Quamdudum? <hi rend="ital">Do.</hi> Modo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sum illi villae amicior modo factus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:2:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaeras putemne talem esse deorum naturam, qualis modo a te sit exposita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:21:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 1, 21, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">declaravit id modo temeritas C. Caesaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:8:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 8, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo hoc malum in rem publicam invasit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 21, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si hodie bella sint, quale Gallicum modo (i. e. twenty-two years earlier),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 40, 17</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:14:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 14, 13</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:99" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 44, 99</bibl>.—Opp. to <hi rend="ital">nunc</hi>: qui nunc primum te advenisse dicas,<pb n="1156" /> <cb n="MODU" />  modo qui hinc abieris, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 63</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quā urbe modo gratiā, auctoritate, gloriā floruimus, in eā nunc iis quidem omnibus caremus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 13, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:40:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 40, 86</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">41, 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:18:7" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 18, 7</bibl>.—With <hi rend="ital">tunc</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 75</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.14" n="3" level="3"> Of time just to come, <hi rend="ital">immediately, directly, in a moment</hi> (rare, and perh. not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">domum modo ibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:3:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 3, 4, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Artabanus tardari metu, modo cupidine vindictae inardescere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">4, 50</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.15" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29388.16" n="1" level="3"> Modo ... modo, <hi rend="ital">now ... now, at one moment ... at another, sometimes ... sometimes</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">modo ait, modo negat,</quote> <trans><tr>sometimes he says Yes, and sometimes No</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cotta meus modo hoc, modo illud,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 18, 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:44:93" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 2, 44, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo his, modo illis ex partibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:19:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 19, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">o Academiam volaticam et sui similem, modo huc, modo illuc!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:25:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 13, 25, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">citus modo, modo tardus incessus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 15:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 15, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetos modo, modo pavidos animadverteres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 60:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 60, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nebulonem modo, modo nugatorem appellat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 56</bibl></cit>.—Instead of modo ... modo, we sometimes find: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc ... modo: nunc quereretur eundem accusatorem ac judicem esse, modo vitam sibi eripi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:32:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 32, 9</bibl></cit>.—Again, instead of the second modo (esp. in poets and in post-Aug. prose writers), we find: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc aliquando, interdum, nonnumquam, saepe, rursus.—So, modo ... nunc,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:922" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 13, 922</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:643" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 643</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:2:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ut reciperet imperium, nunc ut legatione fungeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... aliquando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11, 34</bibl>; 16, 10; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:74" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 74</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... interdum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 42, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:55:9" default="NO" valid="yes">55, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:62:9" default="NO" valid="yes">62, 9</bibl> Kritz.; 74, 1; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:9:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 9, 9</bibl> et saep.: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... nonnumquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:66" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 66</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Claud. 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 52</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... modo ... saepe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 45:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 45, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 84</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... rursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:3:41" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 3, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29388.17" n="2" level="3"> Modo ... tum (deinde, postea, etc.), <hi rend="ital">at first ... then, at one time ... at another</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol modo accedens, tum autem recedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:40:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 40, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Xenophon) facit Socratem disputantem ... et modo unum, tum autem plures deos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et modo mundum, tum mentem divinam esse putat,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 34</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">modo (Theophrastus) menti divinum tribuit principatum, modo caelo, tum autem signis sideribusque caelestibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et forte in eo loco grandis ilex coaluerat inter saxa paulum modo prona, deinde flexa, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 93:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 93, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... paulo post,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:7:4:5" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 7, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modo ... modo ... postremum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid agerent, modo timentes, vicissim contemnentes religiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:17:43" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 17, 43</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modulabilis: <entryFree id="n29389" type="hapax" key="mo^du^la_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>modulor</etym>, <sense id="n29389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that can be sung</hi> or <hi rend="ital">played</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">carmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:4:63" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 4, 63</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modulamen: <entryFree id="n29390" type="main" key="mo^du^la_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlāmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29390.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melody, euphony</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Cicero) in secundā (in Verrem, i. e. Verr. 2, 2, 78, § 191) simili usūs modulamine, manifesto peccatu inquit, non peccato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:21" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 21</bibl></cit> (20), 16: <cit><quote lang="la">caeli ac siderum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 1, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
modulamentum: <entryFree id="n29391" type="main" key="mo^du^la_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">melody, euphony</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">modulamenta orationis M. Tullii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modulate: <entryFree id="n29392" type="main" key="mo^du^la_te_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlātē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. modulor <sense id="n29392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
modulatio: <entryFree id="n29393" type="main" key="mo^du^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>modulor</etym>, <sense id="n29393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a regular measure</hi> (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n29393.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">operis modulationes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dorica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incedendi,</quote> <trans><tr>a marching to time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:18" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 18</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29393.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">a rhythmical measure, modulation;</hi> hence, <hi rend="ital">singing and playing, melody</hi>, in poetry and music, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:139" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 139</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatione produci aut corripi (verba),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 4, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatio pedum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scenica,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>melody</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:59" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musica,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 25, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modulator: <entryFree id="n29394" type="main" key="mo^du^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who measures by rule, a director</hi> of music, <hi rend="ital">a musician</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and post-Aug. prose).—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimus est modulator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocis et cantūs,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1</bibl></cit> prooem. § 3.</sense></entryFree>
modulatrix: <entryFree id="n29395" type="main" key="mo^du^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>modulator</etym>, <sense id="n29395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that regulates</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Bapt. 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
modulatus: <entryFree id="n29396" type="main" key="mo^du^la_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. modulor <sense id="n29396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29397" type="main" key="mo^du^la_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>modulor</etym>, <sense id="n29397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a modulating</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">canoro saxa modulatu trahens,</quote> <trans><tr>music, a playing on the lute</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 263" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 263</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MODU" /></sense></entryFree>
modulor: <entryFree id="n29398" type="main" key="mo^du^lor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>modulus</etym>, <sense id="n29398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to measure off properly, to measure; to manage properly, to regulate</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29398.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (only post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in modulanda statūs longitudinisque ejus praestantiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quanta longinquitas corporis ei mensurae conveniret, modificatus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita modulante naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:142" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 54, 55, § 142</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29398.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., of singing, speaking, dancing, etc., <hi rend="ital">to measure rhythmically; to modulate;</hi> hence, transf., <hi rend="ital">to dance, to represent by dancing; to sing, to play</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">ipsa natura, quasi modularetur hominum orationem, in omni verbo posuit acutam vocem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 58</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum aures vocem naturā modulantur,</quote> <trans><tr>modulate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:48:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 48, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae, Saliares dictae, quoniam in symphoniae cantu ad ictus modulantium pedum moventur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:209" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96, § 209</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29398.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">virgines sonum vocis pulsu pedum modulantes incesserunt,</quote> <trans><tr>beating time to, accompanying with the dance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 37 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(carmina) pastoris Siculi modulabor avenā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:10:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 10, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina descripsi, et modulans alterna notavi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba fidibus modulanda Latinis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:39" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 39</bibl></cit> —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif. </sense><sense id="n29398.4" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Played upon, made by playing, played</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29398.5" n="1" level="3"> Of an instrument: <cit><quote lang="la">dic Latinum, Barbite, carmen Lesbio primum modulate civi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:32:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 32, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29398.6" n="2" level="3"> Of a song, tune, etc., <hi rend="ital">sung</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">carmina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a canticis ad aliorum similitudinem modulatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:2:35" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 2, 35</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29398.7" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Properly measured, in due measure, in time, melodious, musical</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">ipso modulata dolore Verba fundebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:428" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 428</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sonus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 43, § 81</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001::section=85" default="NO" valid="yes">§ 85</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut moderatiores modulatioresque fierent animi,</quote> <trans><tr>more harmonious</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lingua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:15:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 15, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem modulatiorem aptioremque reddit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:24:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 24, 9</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Sup.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modulatissimus cantus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:7:15" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 7, 15</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏ-dŭlātē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">measuredly, according to measure, in time, melodiously</hi>: modulate canentes tibiae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:8:22" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 8, 22</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">haec tu quam perite, quam concinne, quam modulate enuntiāsti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 19</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Comp.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ars modulatius incedendi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba modulatius collocata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:11:13:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 11, 13, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
modulus: <entryFree id="n29399" type="main" key="mo^du^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>modus</etym>, <sense id="n29399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small measure, a measure</hi> (not in Cic. or Cæs.). </sense><sense id="n29399.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquitur de numero, quem faciunt alii majorem, alii minorem, nulli enim hujus moduli naturales,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:2:20" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 2, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab imo Ad summum moduli bipedalis,</quote> <trans><tr>two feet high</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:309" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 309</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">metiri se quemque suo modulo ac pede,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to be content with his own condition</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 7, 98</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29399.2" n="2" level="3"> In archit., <hi rend="ital">a module</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si Dorici generis erunt columnae, dimetiantur earum altitudines cum capitulis in partes quindecim, et ex eis partibus una constituatur, et fiat modulus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:5:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 5, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 3, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 3, 3</bibl> sq.—</sense><sense id="n29399.3" n="3" level="3"> In aqueducts, <hi rend="ital">a watermeter</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">est autem calix modulus aeneus, qui rivo, vel castello induitur: huic fistulae applicantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 36" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29399.4" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Rhythmical measure, rhythm, music, time, metre, mode, melody</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moduli Lydii, Dorii, Phrygii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:5:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 5, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tibiarum modulis in proeliis uti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:1:11:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29399.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur non ponderibus modulisque suis ratio utitur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 78</bibl></cit>: ganeones, quibus modulus est vitae culina, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 119, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
modus: <entryFree id="n29400" type="main" key="mo^dus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root med-, measure, weigh; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">me/domai, me/dontes, mh/stwr, me/dimnos</foreign>; cf.: modius, modestus, moderor</etym>, <sense id="n29400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a measure</hi> with which, or according to which, any thing is measured, its <hi rend="ital">size, length, circumference, quantity</hi> (freq. and class.). </sense><sense id="n29400.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29400.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">modi, quibus metirentur rura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">is modus acnua Latine appellatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:ib. 1:10:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">filio agri reliquit ei non magnum modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:prol. 13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. prol. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc erat in votis, modus agri non ita magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de modo agri scripsit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:33:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 33, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de modo agri (actio), cum a venditore emptor deceptus est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 1, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus hic agri nostro non sufficit horto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:172" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus altitudinis et latitudinis (sulcorum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">collis modum jugeri continens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnium par modus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 27</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:23" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsus,</quote> <trans><tr>false measure</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:6" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cb n="MODU" /> magnus legionum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:73:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 73, 2</bibl>: hic mihi conteritur vitae modus, <hi rend="ital">measure</hi> or <hi rend="ital">term of life</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29400.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29400.4" n="1" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">a proper measure, due measure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in modo fundi non animadverso lapsi sunt multi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:11" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suus cuique (rei) modus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:22:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 22, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordine et modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 5, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum alicujus rei habere,</quote> <trans><tr>to observe measure in a thing, not exceed the bounds of moderation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vox quasi extra modum absona,</quote> <trans><tr>beyond measure, immoderately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:11:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 11, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum lacus praeter modum crevisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:44:100" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Div. 1, 44, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii sine dubio fidem et modum transeunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">supra modum in servos suos saevire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 1:53" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 1, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine modo modestiāque,</quote> <trans><tr>without measure, without moderation</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 41:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 41, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine modo ac modestia agi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:48:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 48, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29400.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The measure of tones, measure, rhythm, melody, harmony, time;</hi> in poetry, <hi rend="ital">measure, metre, mode</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vocum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:3:9" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">musici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:10:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 10, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lyrici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 15, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidibus Latinis Thebanos aptare modos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 3, 12</bibl></cit>: Bacchico exsultas (i. e. exsultans) modo, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 214</bibl> P. (Trag. v. 152 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">flebilibus modis concinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:44:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 1, 44, 106</bibl></cit>: saltare ad tibicinis modos, <hi rend="ital">to the music</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sound of the flute</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nectere canoris Eloquium vocale modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:19" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 19</bibl></cit>.—Fig.: <cit><quote lang="la">verae numerosque modosque ediscere vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>moral harmonies</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 144</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29400.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29400.7" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A measure which is not to be exceeded, a bound, limit, end, restriction</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">modus muliebris nullust, neque umquam lavando et fricando modum scimus facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis modus tibi tandem exilio eveniet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum aliquem et finem orationi facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to set bounds to</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:48:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 48, § 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ludendi est quidem modus retinendus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:104" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 29, 104</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:24:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 24, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum modum irae nullum faceret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:50:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 50, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum transire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:17:4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 4, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinibus statuat natura modum quem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inimicitiarum modum facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum statuarum haberi nullum placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui rebus infinitis modum constituant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">constituere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:59:section=145" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 59, § 145</bibl></cit>: modus vitae, <foreign lang="greek">tou= bi/ou te/los</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:9" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 9</bibl>. —With <hi rend="ital">gen. gerund.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum lugendi aliquando facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to make an end of mourning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 16, 6</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nam quis erit saevire modus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:573" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 573</bibl></cit>; cf. the foll.—</sense><sense id="n29400.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A way, manner, mode, method</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">modus est, in quo quem ad modum, et quo animo factum sit, quaeritur, Ejus partes sunt prudentia, et imprudentia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:27:41" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 1, 27, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum modum esse hominis occidendi quo ille non aliquot occiderit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:35:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rosc. Am. 35, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec enim semper (hae partes) tractantur uno modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:35:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 35, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitae,</quote> <trans><tr>way of life</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:23:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 23, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestium ordinem ... imitari vitae modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:21:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 21, 77</bibl></cit>: quibus modis, <hi rend="ital">by what method of acting</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">what means</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 5, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cultores has Alpis modo tuto transmittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:30:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 30, 8</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg> with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec modus inserere atque oculos imponere simplex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 73</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29400.9" n="2" level="3"> Esp. freq.: modo, in modum, or ad modum, with a <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> or <hi rend="ital">adj., in the manner of, like</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">servorum modo,</quote> <trans><tr>in the manner of, like slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pecorum modo trahi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in modum ramorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:Arbor. 22" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> Arbor. 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostrum modum,</quote> <trans><tr>in our manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">servilem in modum cruciari,</quote> <trans><tr>like slaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 5, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:19:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 19, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 56</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mirum in modum,</quote> <trans><tr>in a wonderful manner, wonderfully</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hunc modum distributis legionibus,</quote> <trans><tr>in this manner</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">naves ad hunc modum factae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nos nostras more nostro et modo instruximus legiones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non tuo hoc fiet modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si humano modo, si usitato more peccāsset,</quote> <trans><tr>after the manner of men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 8</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Carneadeo more et modo disputata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Univ. 1</bibl></cit>; for which with <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">apis Matinae More modoque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 2, 28</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">agendi more ac modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:29" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tali modo,</quote> <trans><tr>in such a manner, in such wise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,025:21:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Att. 21, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo modo,</quote> <trans><tr>in no wise, by no means</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:76:section=186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 76, § 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omni modo egi cum rege et ago cotidie,</quote> <trans><tr>in every way, earnestly, urgently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: omnibus modis tibi esse rem salvam <pb n="1157" /> <cb n="MOEN" /> ut scias, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 4, 6, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus modis miser sum,</quote> <trans><tr>every way, wholly, completely</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:4:4:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 4, 4, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">miris modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:3:section=9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 3, § 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:17:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 17, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mille modis amor ignorandust,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc multis modis reprehendi potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:26:82" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 2, 26, 82</bibl></cit> (v. Madv. ad h. l.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">filium multis modis jam exspecto, ut redeat domum,</quote> <trans><tr>very much</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:2:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 2, 3, 7</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">multimodis: mira miris modis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:3:5:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 3, 5, 5</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mirimodis: eum tibi commendo in majorem modum,</quote> <trans><tr>very much, greatly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12</bibl></cit> (14), 3: <cit><quote lang="la">nullo modo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:31:102" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 31, 102</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:9:8" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tit.:2" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tit. 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono modo,</quote> <trans><tr>moderately</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bono modo desiderare aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 6, 3</bibl></cit>: ejus modi, <hi rend="ital">of that kind, of such a kind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sort</hi> (freq.): <cit><quote lang="la">ejusmodi sunt tempestates consecutae, ut,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in ejusmodi casu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 33, 4</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 34, 7: erant ejusmodi fere situs oppidorum, ut,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">petitionis nostrae hujusmodi ratio est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">cujusquemodi, cujusdammodi, cujusmodicumque, cuimodi, cuicuimodi, v. Zumpt, § 678: cujusmodi,</quote> <trans><tr>of what sort</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:15:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 15, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujuscemodi,</quote> <trans><tr>of what sort soever</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:45:134" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 45, 134</bibl></cit>: hujusmodi, hujuscemodi, <hi rend="ital">of this kind, such</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujusmodi casus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hujuscemodi verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illiusmodi,</quote> <trans><tr>of that kind</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:21:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 21, 68</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">istiusmodi amicos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29400.10" n="3" level="3"> In gram., <hi rend="ital">a form</hi> of a verb, <hi rend="ital">a voice</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mood</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in verbo fiunt soloecismi per genera, tempora, personas, modos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:5:41" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 5, 41</bibl></cit>: patiendi modus (<hi rend="ital">the passive voice</hi>) ... faciendi modus (<hi rend="ital">the active voice</hi>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:3:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 3, 7</bibl>; cf. 1, 6, 26.</sense></entryFree>
moecha: <entryFree id="n29401" type="main" key="moecha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† moecha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">moixh/</foreign>, <sense id="n29401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adulteress</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sequerer moechas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 113</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turpis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">putida,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bustuaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:93:15" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 93, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastosa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:13:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 13, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">zelotypa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:278" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 278</bibl></cit>.—In apposition: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor moecha,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moechia: <entryFree id="n29402" type="main" key="moechi_a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† moechīa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">moixei/a</foreign>, <sense id="n29402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adultery</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pudic. 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moechile: <entryFree id="n29403" type="main" key="moechi_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moechīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>moechus</etym>, <sense id="n29403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a place where adultery is committed</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">moechile (al. cubile),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moechillus: <entryFree id="n29404" type="hapax" key="moechillus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moechillus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an adulterer, paramour</hi>: moechilli, facto, v. l. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:113:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 113, 2</bibl> dub. for mucillam.</sense></entryFree>
moechimenium: <entryFree id="n29405" type="hapax" key="moechi^me_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moechĭmēnĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adultery</hi>, Laber. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:16:7:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 16, 7, 2</bibl> (also ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 140, 31</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
moechisso: <entryFree id="n29406" type="main" key="moechisso"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moechisso</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29406.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to ravish</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:5:4:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 5, 4, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moechocinaedus: <entryFree id="n29407" type="hapax" key="moecho^ci^naedus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moechŏ-cĭnaedus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>moechuscinaedus</etym>, <sense id="n29407.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a man abandoned to lewdness</hi>, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 493, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moechor: <entryFree id="n29408" type="main" key="moechor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moechor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <pos>v. dep.</pos> <etym>moechus</etym>, <sense id="n29408.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to commit adultery</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and late Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:94:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 94, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:91:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 91, 2</bibl>; Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 4, 1, 1.</sense></entryFree>
moechus: <entryFree id="n29409" type="main" key="moechus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† moechus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">moixo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a fornicator, an adulterer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnus mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 180</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:2:1:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. 2, 1, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:4:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Eun. 5, 4, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 25, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 7, 13</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">72</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:25" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:26" default="NO">14, 26</bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
moene: <entryFree id="n29410" type="main" key="moene"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moene</orth>, v. moenia <sense id="n29410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
moenera: <entryFree id="n29411" type="main" key="moene^ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moenĕra</orth>, <itype>um, for munera</itype>, v. munus.</entryFree>
moenia: <entryFree id="n29412" type="main" key="moeni^a1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moenĭa</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype> (<sense id="n29412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen. plur.</hi> moeniōrum for moenium, like anciliorum for ancilium, acc. to Cledon. p. 1898 P.; <hi rend="ital">abl. plur.</hi> MOENIIS for moenibus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 408, 1, 34</bibl>; in <number>sing.</number> moene: moene singulariter dixit Ennius (al. Naevius), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=145" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 145</bibl> Müll.), <gen>n.</gen> <etym>perh. Sanscr. root mū-, bind; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">a)mu/nw, mu/nh</foreign>; cf.: munus, immunis, munio</etym>, <hi rend="ital">defensive walls, ramparts, bulwarks, city walls</hi>, as a means of protection and security. </sense><sense id="n29412.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">uti haberent tuta oppida quod operis muniebant, moenia dicta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=141" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 141</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">domicilia conjuncta, quas urbes dicimus, moenibus sepserunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:42:91" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 42, 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentius urbem religione quam ipsis moenibus cingitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:40:94" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 3, 40, 94</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 44, 137</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:11:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 1, 11, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum paene inaedificata in muris ab exercitu nostro moenia viderentur,</quote> <trans><tr>bulwarks, fortifications</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 16</bibl></cit>: summa arcis, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 4</bibl> (Ann. v. 170 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">dividimus muros, et moenia pandimus urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 234</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29412.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29412.3" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">walls, enclosure</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia navis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:532" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 532</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">angusta theatri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 82</bibl></cit>: mundi, id. <cb n="MOLA" /> 1, 73;
