cf. <cit><quote lang="la">caeli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:401" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 401</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29412.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A city enclosed by walls, a walled town</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): nulla jam pernicies moenibus ipsis intra moenia comparabitur, <hi rend="ital">to our walls</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">our city</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia lata videt triplici circumdata muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia circumdare muro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:4:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 4, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 8, 4</bibl>. —* </sense><sense id="n29412.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mansion, dwelling</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ditis magni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:541" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 541</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
<entryFree id="n29413" type="main" key="moeni^a2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moenĭa</orth>, <itype>for munia</itype>, v. h. v.</entryFree>
moenio: <entryFree id="n29414" type="main" key="moeni^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moenĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, for munio</itype>, v. h. v.</entryFree>
moenis: <entryFree id="n29415" type="main" key="Moenis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moenis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the River Main, in Germany</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:3:3:3" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 3, 3, 3</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Moenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 28</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 15, 17, § 45</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moenitus: <entryFree id="n29416" type="main" key="moeni_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moenītus</orth>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from moenio, v. munio.</entryFree>
moenus: <entryFree id="n29417" type="main" key="Moenus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moenus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Moenis.</entryFree>
moera: <entryFree id="n29418" type="main" key="moera1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† moera</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mīra</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">moi=ra</foreign>, <sense id="n29418.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a part, a degree</hi>, in the astronomical sense (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 15, 66</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">14</bibl> prooem.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29419" type="main" key="Moera2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moera</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of one of the Fates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:16:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 16, 11</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moerens: <entryFree id="n29420" type="main" key="moerens"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moerens</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">maerens</orth>), <itype>entis</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. maereo <sense id="n29420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
moereo: <entryFree id="n29421" type="main" key="moereo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moereo</orth>, <itype>ēre</itype>, <orth extent="full" lang="la">moereor</orth>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">moe-ror</orth>, v. maereo and maeror.</entryFree>
moerica: <entryFree id="n29422" type="main" key="moerica"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moerica</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">merica</orth>), <itype>vitis</itype>, <sense id="n29422.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of grape-vine</hi>, otherwise unknown, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moeris: <entryFree id="n29423" type="main" key="Moeris1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moeris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*moi=ris</foreign>, <sense id="n29423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Mœris, a king of Egypt in the fifteenth century</hi> A. C., <hi rend="ital">who caused the lake which bears his name to be excavated</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Moeridis lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 9, 9, § 50</bibl></cit>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29424" type="main" key="Moeris2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moeris</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*moi=ris</foreign>, <sense id="n29424.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Lake Mœris, in Egypt, an artificial lake, fifty miles in width, between Memphis and Arsinoë, designed as a reservoir to hold the superfluous water of the Nile when overflowing</hi>, now <hi rend="ital">Birket-Karum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0929,001:1:9:5" default="NO"><author>Mel.</author> 1, 9, 5</bibl> (ap. Plin. always Moeridis lacus).</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29425" type="main" key="Moeris3" n="3"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moeris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a shepherd and sorcerer</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:96:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 96, 98</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">9, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">53, 54</bibl>, etc.</sense></entryFree>
moerus: <entryFree id="n29426" type="main" key="moerus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moerus</orth>, <itype>i, for murus</itype>, v. h. v.</entryFree>
moesa: <entryFree id="n29427" type="hapax" key="Moesa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moesa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29427.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the grandmother of Heliogabalus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moesi: <entryFree id="n29428" type="main" key="Moesi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Moesi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29428.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Mœsians, a people in the modern Bulgaria and Servia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:41" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 11, 18, § 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:143" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 9, 143</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4984</bibl>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Moesĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the country of the Mœsi, Mœsia</hi>, the modern <hi rend="ital">Bulgaria</hi> and <hi rend="ital">Servia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:149" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 26, 29, § 149</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 80</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 66</bibl> et saep.—As Moesia superior and inferior, also in <number>plur.</number>, Moesiae, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 15</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29428.1" n="II" level="1"> Derivv. </sense><sense id="n29428.2" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Moesĭăcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mœsia, Mœsian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:6" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">copiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29428.3" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Moesĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Mœsia, Mœsian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 1, 1, § 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moesileum: <entryFree id="n29429" type="main" key="moesi_le_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moesīlēum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, corrupted from mausoleum, <sense id="n29429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a tomb, mausoleum</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Limit. Agror. p. 43" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Limit. Agror. p. 43</bibl> Goes.</sense></entryFree>
moeste: <entryFree id="n29430" type="main" key="moeste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moestē, moestĭfĭco, moestĭter, moestĭtia, moestĭtūdo, moesto</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moestus</orth>, v. maeste, etc.</entryFree>
moeta: <entryFree id="n29431" type="main" key="moeta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">moeta</orth>, <itype>for meta</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:de Colon. p. 141" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> de Colon. p. 141</bibl>.</entryFree>
mogontiacum: <entryFree id="n29432" type="main" key="Mogonti^a^cum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mogontĭăcum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a city of Germany</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Mayence</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">Mainz</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 7, 8</bibl>.—Called also <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magontĭăcum</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">25</bibl>; 33 al.: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Magontĭăcus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 11, 8</bibl>; and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Moguntĭă</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, Ven. Fort. 9, 9.</sense></entryFree>
moirus: <entryFree id="n29433" type="main" key="moirus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ moirus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. murus.</entryFree>
mola: <entryFree id="n29434" type="main" key="mo^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>cf. <foreign lang="greek">mu/lh, mu/los</foreign>, mill, millstone; <foreign lang="greek">mu/lai</foreign>, grinders, molar-teeth; cf. molaris</etym>, <sense id="n29434.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a millstone;</hi> and usu. <number>plur.</number> molae, <hi rend="ital">a mill</hi> (driven by slaves, animals, or water): <cit><quote lang="la">verbera, compedes, molae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: molarum strepitum audire, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 506, 4</bibl> (Com. 7 Vahl. p. 153): <cit><quote lang="la">molae oleariae duro et aspero lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:55" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trusatiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:14" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pumiceae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:318" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquariae,</quote> <trans><tr>water-mills</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digni molam versare Nepotis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:67" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">versatiles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 18, 29, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mola asinaria,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>millstone, too heavy for a man to drive</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:18:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 18, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,002:9:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Marc. 9, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molae olivariae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29434.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29434.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Grits</hi> or <hi rend="ital">grains of spelt coarsely ground and mixed with salt</hi> (hence called mola salsa),<cb n="MOLE" />  which it was customary to strew on the victims at sacrifices: mola etiam vocatur far tostum, et sale sparsum, quod eo molito hostiae aspergantur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=141" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 141</bibl> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">sparge molam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:8:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 8, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molam et vinum inspergere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:16:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 16, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut molā salsā aut ture comprecari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:2:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 2, 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molā salsā supplicare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: litare, id. praef. <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consumpsi salsasque molas et turis acervos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:7:5:4" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 7, 5, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29434.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A false conception, moon-calf, mole</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 15, 13, § 63</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:184" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 64, 84, § 184</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29434.4" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A jawbone</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">the teeth</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molas leonum confringet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,027:57:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Psa. 57, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molae: <entryFree id="n29435" type="main" key="Molae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Molae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, in the relig. lang. of the Italic people, perh. <sense id="n29435.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the daughters of Mars, the protectresses of mills</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:22" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molaris: <entryFree id="n29436" type="main" key="mo^la_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlāris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mola</etym>, <sense id="n29436.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to grinding, mill-</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29436.1" n="I" level="1"> <pos>Adj.</pos> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">molaris lapis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 19, 30, § 137</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> 19, 10, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">petrae molares, Grom. Vet. 401, 20: saxum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 212, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis molaris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Luc. 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deus,</quote> <trans><tr>grinding, molar</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Judic. 15, 19</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29436.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlāris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29436.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A millstone;</hi> <usg type="style">poet.</usg> for <hi rend="ital">any large stone</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ramis vastisque molaribus instat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:250" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 250</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 22</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 59</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapis quasi molaris magnus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,027:18:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Apoc. 18, 21</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 82:25" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 82, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29436.4" n="B" level="2"> (Sc. dens.) <hi rend="ital">A grinder, molar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">interque molares Difficili crescente cibo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:13:212" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 13, 212</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">presso stridere molari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 6, 160</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molares superiores (of horses' teeth),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:29:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 29, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 4, 13, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molarius: <entryFree id="n29437" type="main" key="mo^la_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29437.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to grinding, mill-</hi> (anteclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">asinus molarius,</quote> <trans><tr>a mill-ass, an ass that turns a mill</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:19:3" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 19, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molaxo: <entryFree id="n29438" type="hapax" key="mo^laxo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlaxo</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos>, for malaxo, Pelag. Vet. 5.</entryFree>
molemonium: <entryFree id="n29439" type="main" key="molemoni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">molemonĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n29439.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant that promotes vomiting</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 25, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molendarius: <entryFree id="n29440" type="main" key="mo^lenda_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlendārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>1. molo</etym>, <sense id="n29440.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">to grinding, mill-</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">asina molendaria,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 2</bibl></cit>: meta (al. molendinaria), ib. § 5.</sense></entryFree>
molendinarius: <entryFree id="n29441" type="main" key="mo^lendi_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlendīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29441.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mill, mill-</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n29441.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molendinariae metae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 17, 4, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molendinaria meta (al. molendaria),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:18:section=5" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 18, § 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29441.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlen-dīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a miller</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1114, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molendinum: <entryFree id="n29442" type="main" key="mo^lendi_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlendīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29442.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a millingplace, mill-house</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:in Psa. 132:4" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> in Psa. 132, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:36:2" default="NO">36, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moles: <entryFree id="n29443" type="main" key="mo_les"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōles</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>prob. for mog-les; root magh-; cf. magnus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">mo/xqos, mogei=n, mo/gis</foreign>; cf.: <foreign lang="greek">moxlo/s</foreign>, molīri, molestus; Germ. Mühe</etym>, <sense id="n29443.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shapeless, huge, heavy mass, huge bulk</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29443.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29443.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Chaos, rudis indigestaque moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vastā se mole moventem Pastorem Polyphemum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:656" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 656</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">taurus et ipsa mole piger,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:12" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stetit aequore moles Pinea,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a fleet of large ships</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 6, 19.—</sense><sense id="n29443.3" n="B" level="2"> Esp. </sense><sense id="n29443.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mass, pile, a cliff</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ridge of rock</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mole sedens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">13, 923</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29443.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A mass</hi> or <hi rend="ital">pile of waves</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venti, tantas audetis tollere moles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 134</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 790</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29443.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A huge, massive structure</hi>, esp. of stone; <hi rend="ital">a dam, pier, mole; a foundation</hi>, etc. (freq. and class.): <cit><quote lang="la">molem atque aggerem ab utrāque parte litoris jaciebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles oppositae fluctibus,</quote> <trans><tr>moles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:4:14" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:53:section=118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 53, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus insulae muniti mirificis molibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:16:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 4, 16, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exstructa moles opere magnifico, incisaeque litterae, virtutis testes sempiternae,</quote> <trans><tr>a monument</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:12:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 12, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles propinqua nubibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:29:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 29, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">insanae substructionum moles,</quote> <trans><tr>huge buildings, piles</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:31:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 31, 85</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sepulcri moles,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a tomb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:8:865" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 8, 865</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem aggeris ultra venire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:16:26" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 16, 26</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29443.7" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A huge engine</hi> or <hi rend="ital">machine</hi>, used at sieges: <cit><quote lang="la">velut celsam oppugnat qui molibus urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:439" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 439</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29443.8" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Warlike apparatus, munitions of war</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">belli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non alias majore mole concursum,</quote> <trans><tr>with a greater mass</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 46</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29443.9" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29443.10" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Greatness, might, power, strength, great quantity, heap</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">moles pugnae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molem invidiae austinere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:9:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 9, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">moles mali,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 7, 17</bibl></cit>: vis consili expers mole ruit suā, Hor. <pb n="1158" /> <cb n="MOLI" /> C. 3, 4, 65: <cit><quote lang="la">rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:84" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortunae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Herculea,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:143" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">densā ad muros mole feruntur,</quote> <trans><tr>a vast crowd, immense body</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:575" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 575</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curarum,</quote> <trans><tr>multitude, crowd</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae corporum moles in fugam consternati sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:46:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 46, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29443.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Difficulty, labor, trouble</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">transveham naves haud magnā mole,</quote> <trans><tr>without great difficulty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tantae molis erat Romanam condere gentem,</quote> <trans><tr>so much labor did it cost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Corbuloni plus molis adversus ignaviam militum, quam, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moleste: <entryFree id="n29444" type="main" key="mo^leste_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlestē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. molestus <sense id="n29444.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
molestia: <entryFree id="n29445" type="main" key="mo^lesti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlestĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>molestus</etym>, <sense id="n29445.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">trouble, troublesomeness, irksomeness, uneasiness, annoyance, molestation, vexation, disgust, dislike</hi>, etc. (class.). </sense><sense id="n29445.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29445.2" n="A" level="2"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine molestiā,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 154</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sine molestiā tuā,</quote> <trans><tr>without trouble to yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:13:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 13, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiam exhibere,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 30, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habeo etiam illam molestiam, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 12, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fasces habent molestiam,</quote> <trans><tr>produce, cause</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 8, 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ex pernicie rei publicae molestiam trahere,</quote> <trans><tr>to feel troubled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capere,</quote> <trans><tr>to be vexed, annoyed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sull. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui aspergere,</quote> <trans><tr>to give, occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">afferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:3:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">demere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:5:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 5, 3, 33</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestiis se laxare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">navigandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:23" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 23</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29445.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">stiffness, affectation</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diligens elegantia sine molestiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:38:143" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 38, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si nihil habere molestiarum Atticorum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 91, 315</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29445.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, concr., <hi rend="ital">that which causes trouble, an annoyance</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sermones ne et hic viris sint et domi molestiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:prol. 35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. prol. 35</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of spots or blotches on the face: molestiae in facie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 28, § 109</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molesto: <entryFree id="n29446" type="main" key="mo^lesto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlesto</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29446.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to trouble, annoy, molest</hi>: aliquem, Petr. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> p. 566, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sat. 58</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 71</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">neminem molestari volo nomine debiti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:3:20" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 3, 20</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva raro valde molestat,</quote> <trans><tr>is troublesome</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Larg. 71" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Larg. 71</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molestus: <entryFree id="n29447" type="main" key="mo^lestus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlestus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>moles</etym>, <sense id="n29447.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">troublesome, irksome, grievous, annoying</hi> (class.; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">importunus): abscede hinc, molestus ne sis!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:4:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 4, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:8:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 8, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">operosus ac molestus labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:39" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui odiosum et molestum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:47" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 14, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu autem, nisi molestum est, paulisper exsurge,</quote> <trans><tr>if it will not incommode you</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:60:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 60, 168</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil erit his laboriosius molestiusque provinciae?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:8:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 8, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arrogantia ingenii atque eloquentiae est multo molestissima,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:11:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Div. in Caecil. 11, 36</bibl></cit>: tunica, <hi rend="ital">a dress of pitch</hi>, in which a malefactor was burned (tunicam alimentis ignium et illitam et intextam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 14:5" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 14, 5</bibl>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:8:235" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 8, 235</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:25:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 25, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29447.1" n="B" level="2"> In partic., of speech, <hi rend="ital">labored, affected</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">simplex in agendo veritas non molesta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 116</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pronuntiatio gesticulationibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:183" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dialectos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:56" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 56</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29447.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29447.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">That is done with difficulty, difficult</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">molesta separatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:2:27:section=14" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 9, 2, 27, § 14</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n29447.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Dangerous, injurious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">otium, Catulle, tibi molestum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:51:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 51, 12</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlestē</orth>. </sense><sense id="n29447.5" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">With trouble</hi> or <hi rend="ital">difficulty</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">moleste fero,</quote> <trans><tr>I take it ill, it vexes, annoys me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:13:22:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 13, 22, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestissime fero, quod, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:6:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 3, 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molestius ferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:1:1:section=2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 1, 1, § 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fero,</quote> <trans><tr>I lament</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 67:13" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 67, 13</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29447.6" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">In a troublesome</hi> or <hi rend="ital">offensive manner;</hi> of speech, <hi rend="ital">in a labored manner, affectedly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mimice ac moleste,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 42, 8</bibl></cit>: scribere, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:86" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moleste uti distinctionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:181" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 181</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moletrina: <entryFree id="n29448" type="main" key="mo^letri_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏletrīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. molo</etym>, <sense id="n29448.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mill</hi> (ante-class.), Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 63, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molicina: <entryFree id="n29449" type="main" key="mo^li^ci^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlĭcĭna</orth>, v. molocina.</entryFree>
molile: <entryFree id="n29450" type="main" key="mo^li_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mola</etym>, <sense id="n29450.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the drawing-ropes</hi> or <hi rend="ital">traces</hi> of an ass in a mill, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 10</bibl> and 11.</sense></entryFree>
molimen: <entryFree id="n29451" type="main" key="mo_li_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlīmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>molior</etym>, <sense id="n29451.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great exertion, effort, endeavor, attempt, undertaking</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, not in Cic.): <cit><quote lang="la">ventus Trudit agens magnam magno molimine navem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:902" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 902</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">revellere Annosam pinum magno molimine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:357" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 357</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quanto cum fastu, quanto molimine circum Spectemus vacuam Romanis vatibus aedem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sceleris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:473" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 473</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res, suo ipsa molimine gravis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 56</bibl></cit>: rerum, <cb n="MOLI" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:2:75" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 2, 75</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">molimine vasto tabularia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:809" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 15, 809</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molimentum: <entryFree id="n29452" type="main" key="mo_li_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>molior</etym>, <sense id="n29452.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a great exertion, effort, endeavor, attempt, undertaking</hi> (good prose, but not in Cic.): magno cum molimento procedunt, Sisenn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 142, 5</bibl>: neque se exercitum sine magno commeatu atque molimento in unum locum contrahere posse, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 34, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">motam certe sede suā parvi molimenti adminiculis,</quote> <trans><tr>by machines of little power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo minoris molimenti ea claustra esse,</quote> <trans><tr>would cost the less labor</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex magni molimenti est,</quote> <trans><tr>that has a great spirit of enterprise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Cons. ad Marc. 11:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Cons. ad Marc. 11, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molina: <entryFree id="n29453" type="main" key="mo^li_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlīna</orth>, v. molinus.</entryFree>
molinarius: <entryFree id="n29454" type="main" key="mo^li_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ mŏlīnārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>molina</etym>, <sense id="n29454.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a miller</hi>: molinarius, <foreign lang="greek">u(drale/ths</foreign>, Gloss. Philox.</sense></entryFree>
molinus: <entryFree id="n29455" type="main" key="mo^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlīnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mola</etym>, <sense id="n29455.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mill, mill-</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">saxum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 35</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29455.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a mill</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 18, 8, 11</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n29455.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a mill</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Litt. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molio: <entryFree id="n29456" type="main" key="mo_li^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlĭo</orth>, <itype>īre, 4</itype> (<sense id="n29456.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">act.</hi> collat. form of molior). </sense><sense id="n29456.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To build, erect</hi> (post-Aug.): neque quis quid molit, S. C. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Aquaed. 129" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Aquaed. 129</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29456.2" n="II" level="1"> In a <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi> signif., <hi rend="ital">to set in motion, start</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam sospitatricis deae peculiaris pompa moliebatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 11, p. 261, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molior: <entryFree id="n29457" type="main" key="mo_li^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlĭor</orth>, <itype>ītus, 4</itype> (<sense id="n29457.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> molirier for moliri, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:934" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 934</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [moles]. </sense><sense id="n29457.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29457.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set one's self</hi> or <hi rend="ital">one's powers in motion, to make exertions, exert one's self, to endeavor, struggle, strive, toil</hi>, etc. (rare but class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: conor, nitor): viden ut misere moliuntur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:3:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 1, 3, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agam per me ipse et moliar,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nōsti mores mulierum: Dum moliuntur, dum comuntur, annus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horam amplius jam in demoliendo signo permulti homines moliebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:43:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 43, § 95</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29457.3" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To set one's self in motion, endeavor to depart, to depart</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molientem hinc Hannibalem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum naves moliuntur a terra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 37, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quam (insulam) gladiatores navibus molientes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 35</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29457.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi> </sense><sense id="n29457.5" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To labor upon</hi> any thing, <hi rend="ital">exert one's self at</hi> or <hi rend="ital">upon, set in motion, work</hi> an instrument or engine; <hi rend="ital">to work</hi> any thing (cf. ago; class.). </sense><sense id="n29457.6" n="1" level="3"> Nihil enim agit (vita deorum), ... nulla opera molitur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:19:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 19, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">res dura et regni novitas me talia cogant moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:564" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 564</bibl></cit>: validam in vites molire bipennem, <hi rend="ital">to work</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">wield</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 331</bibl>: ancoras, <hi rend="ital">to work</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">hoist the anchor, weigh anchor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">agricola incurvo terram molitus aratro,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>to work, cultivate, till the ground</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:494" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 494</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1 praef" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1 praef.</bibl> 17; <cit><quote lang="la">11, 2, 19: erro molirier arva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:932" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 932</bibl></cit>: fores, <hi rend="ital">to work</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to force, to break open</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 39</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 82</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:18:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 18, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:46:5" default="NO" valid="yes">24, 46, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Atharrias ad Philotam missus clausum aditum domus moliebatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:8:20" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 8, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habenas,</quote> <trans><tr>to guide</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:327" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 327</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulmina molitur dextrā,</quote> <trans><tr>hurls</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 329</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opera,</quote> <trans><tr>to begin work</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:2:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid sub divo moliri potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:8:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 8, 9</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29457.7" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set in motion, bestir, rouse, cause to remove, displace</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">deicio, deturbo): montes suā sede,</quote> <trans><tr>displaces</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora ex somno moliebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>aroused</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:36:24:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 36, 24, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">onera objecta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 36</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29457.8" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To build, make, erect, construct</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">condo, fundo, construo): muros,</quote> <trans><tr>to build</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">classem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 424</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">atrium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:1:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 1, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:7" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum,</quote> <trans><tr>prepares</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:158" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 158</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pocula de inimicorum capitibus hominum,</quote> <trans><tr>to construct, make</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 15</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29457.9" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to endeavor to do; to undertake, attempt, set about</hi> any thing (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">aggredior, apparo): nec ea, quae agunt, molientes cum labore operoso,</quote> <trans><tr>performing, doing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam clipei molita per oras,</quote> <trans><tr>made its way</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:477" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inde datum molitur iter,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 477</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque alio moliris iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:2:61" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 2, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam et gressus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 278</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 438</bibl>: animum, <hi rend="ital">to form</hi> or <hi rend="ital">acquire for one's self</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:2:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 2, 119</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">laborem,</quote> <trans><tr>to undertake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:233" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 233</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">struere et moliri aliquid calamitatis alicui,</quote> <trans><tr>to try to bring upon</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:64:178" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 64, 178</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fortissimis atque optimis civibus periculum moliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pestem patriae nefarie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">perniciem rei publicae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: insidias avibus, <hi rend="ital">to lay snares</hi>, <cb n="MOLL" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:271" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 271</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">crimina et accusatorem,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring about, find out</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 719</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:109" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 109</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moram,</quote> <trans><tr>to cause, make, occasion</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 414</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opem extremam alicui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:431" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 431</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dolos apertos,</quote> <trans><tr>to devise</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:249" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 249</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bellum in animo,</quote> <trans><tr>to design, meditate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:46" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses urbem ex integro condere moliuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mundum efficere moliens deus,</quote> <trans><tr>attempting</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=4" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fallere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:491" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 491</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de occupando regno moliens,</quote> <trans><tr>striving to usurp the government</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:35:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 35, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nuptias,</quote> <trans><tr>to bring about</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apud judices oratione molienda sunt amor, odium, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>are to be excited, called forth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:51:206" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 51, 206</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tumorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vorandi facultatem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidem moliri coepit,</quote> <trans><tr>began to meddle with, disturb</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 11, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molitio: <entryFree id="n29458" type="main" key="mo_li_ti^o1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlītĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>molior</etym>, <sense id="n29458.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a putting in motion, moving, removing; a laborious undertaking, preparation, contrivance</hi> (rare but class.): molitio agrorum, <hi rend="ital">a working, ploughing, digging</hi>, Col. prooem.: <cit><quote lang="la">terrena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:11:2:98" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 2, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facilis molitio eorum valli erat,</quote> <trans><tr>a tearing out, demolishing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:5:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 5, 6</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">a building, making</hi>, of the creation of the world, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:8:19" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 8, 19</bibl>.—In gen., <hi rend="ital">an enterprise, undertaking</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 9, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29459" type="main" key="mo^li^ti^o2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>molo</etym>, <sense id="n29459.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a grinding</hi> (late Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Serm. 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molitor: <entryFree id="n29460" type="main" key="mo_li_tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlītor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>molior</etym>, <sense id="n29460.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who undertakes</hi> to do a thing, <hi rend="ital">an attempter, author, framer, contriver</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">effector mundi molitorque deus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,072:chapter=5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Univ. 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:302" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 302</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=dom.:10" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Dom. 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maximorum molitores scelerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 7:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 7, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29461" type="main" key="mo^li^tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>1. molo</etym>, <sense id="n29461.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a miller</hi> (post-class.). </sense><sense id="n29461.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:12:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 12, § 15</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n29461.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ep. 90, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molitrix: <entryFree id="n29462" type="main" key="mo_li_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlītrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. molitor</etym>, <sense id="n29462.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she who attempts, frames, contrives</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">novarum rerum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:35" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 35</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molitura: <entryFree id="n29463" type="spur" key="mo^li^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlĭtūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>1. molo</etym>, a false read. for moluntur, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 23, 25, § 52</bibl>.</entryFree>
molitus: <entryFree id="n29464" type="main" key="mo^li^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from molo.</entryFree>
<entryFree id="n29465" type="main" key="mo_li_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from molior.</entryFree>
molleo: <entryFree id="n29466" type="hapax" key="molle^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĕo</orth>, <itype>2</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>mollis</etym>, <sense id="n29466.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to be soft</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Theod. Prisc.</author> 1, 28</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mollesco: <entryFree id="n29467" type="main" key="mollesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n29467.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [molleo], <hi rend="ital">to become soft, to soften</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; cf. liquesco). </sense><sense id="n29467.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">rura colit nemo: mollescunt colla juvencis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ebur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:283" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 283</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tactu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 17, 37, § 76</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29467.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29467.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To become soft, mild</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">gentle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tum genus humanum primum mollescere coepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1014" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1014</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pectora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:1:6:8" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 1, 6, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29467.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To become effeminate, unmanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollescat in undis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:386" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 386</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne forte mollescat cor vestrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:51:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 51, 46</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mollestra: <entryFree id="n29468" type="main" key="mollestra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">‡ mollestra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29468.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sheepskin, sheep'sfelt, for wiping helmets</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=135" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 135</bibl> Mull.</sense></entryFree>
mollicellus: <entryFree id="n29469" type="main" key="molli^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcellus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29469.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [mollis], <hi rend="ital">soft, tender, delicate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">nates,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 25, 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mollicia: <entryFree id="n29470" type="main" key="molli^ci^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcĭa</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcĭes</orth>, v. mollitia.</entryFree>
mollicina: <entryFree id="n29471" type="main" key="molli^ci_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mollis</etym>, <sense id="n29471.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of soft garment</hi> (post-class.), Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 540, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mollicomus: <entryFree id="n29472" type="main" key="molli^co^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcŏmus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mollis-coma</etym>, <sense id="n29472.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">soft-haired</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">herbae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 1082</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molliculus: <entryFree id="n29473" type="main" key="molli^cu^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29473.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [mollis]. </sense><sense id="n29473.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">soft, tender, delicate</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">escae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meus molliculus caseus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:154" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 154</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29473.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">voluptuous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">versiculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:16:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 16, 4</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentulus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 183</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29474" type="main" key="Molli^cu^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mollĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29474.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, e. g. Ti. Minucius Molliculus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 40, 35</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
mollifico: <entryFree id="n29475" type="main" key="molli^fi^co"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭfĭco</orth>, <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mollis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n29475.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to make soft, to soften, mollify</hi>, Caesar. Epist. Hortat. ad Virgg.; cf.: mollifico, <foreign lang="greek">a(palu/nw, mala/ssw</foreign>, Gloss. Lat. Gr.</sense></entryFree>
mollificus: <entryFree id="n29476" type="main" key="molli^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mollifico</etym>, <sense id="n29476.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">making soft, softening</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">phlebotomia est mollifica corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 4:1:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 4, 1, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molligo: <entryFree id="n29477" type="main" key="molli_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollīgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, v. mollugo.</entryFree>
mollimentum: <entryFree id="n29478" type="main" key="molli_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollīmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mollio</etym>, <sense id="n29478.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a means of softening</hi> or <hi rend="ital">mitigating</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">calamitatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Tranq. 10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Tranq. 10</bibl></cit>. 2. <pb n="1159" /> <cb n="MOLL" /></sense></entryFree>
mollio: <entryFree id="n29479" type="main" key="molli^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭo</orth>, <itype>īvi and ii, ītum, 4</itype> (mollibat for molliebat, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 347, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 21</bibl>: <sense id="n29479.0" n="I" level="1"><cit><quote lang="la">mollirier for molliri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:4:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 4, 3, 27</bibl></cit>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mollis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to make soft, pliant, flexible</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">supple, to soften</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29479.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigoribus durescit umor, et idem vicissim mollitur tepefactus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:10:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanam trahendo,</quote> <trans><tr>by spinning</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:411" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 411</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artus oleo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum ferrum molliat ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:4:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 4, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:7:123" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 123</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humum foliis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:4:741" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 741</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">glebas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:6:220" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 220</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventrem,</quote> <trans><tr>to relax, purge moderately</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duritias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 17, 70, § 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri molliti,</quote> <trans><tr>softened, loosened</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:50:130" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 50, 130</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29479.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29479.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To soften, moderate, mitigate; to tame, restrain, check; to render easier, lighter, pleasanter</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">less disagreeable</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hannibalem juveniliter exsultantem patientiā suā molliebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:4:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 4, 10</bibl></cit>: quā mons mollibat mare, <hi rend="ital">broke the violence of the sea</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 347, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">indocili numero cum grave mollit opus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:1:6" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 4, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:3:5:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 5, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivum,</quote> <trans><tr>to make the ascent of a hill easier</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:37:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 37, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba usu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:1:34:95" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 1, 34, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">translationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:165" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 165</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fructus feros colendo,</quote> <trans><tr>to render milder</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:124" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 124</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacrimae meorum me interdum molliunt,</quote> <trans><tr>overcome me</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:9:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 9, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Deus mollivit cor meum,</quote> <trans><tr>softened</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 23, 16</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29479.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To soften, render effeminate</hi> or <hi rend="ital">unmanly</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:11:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 2, 11, 27</bibl></cit>: vocem, <hi rend="ital">to make soft</hi> or <hi rend="ital">womanish</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:24" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 24</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum,</quote> <trans><tr>to unman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:68" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 68</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mollipes: <entryFree id="n29480" type="main" key="molli^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭ-pes</orth>, <itype>pĕdis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mollis-pes</etym>, <sense id="n29480.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">softfooted</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): boves, Cic. poët. Div. 1, 9, 15.</sense></entryFree>
mollis: <entryFree id="n29481" type="main" key="mollis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">malako/s, a)malo/s, mw=lus</foreign>; cf. <foreign lang="greek">blhxro/s</foreign>, perh. Lat. mulier (mollior)</etym>, <sense id="n29481.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">easily movable, pliant, flexible, supple; soft, tender, delicate, gentle, mild, pleasant</hi> (class.; syn.: tener, facilis, flexibilis, lentus). </sense><sense id="n29481.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis juncus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:2:72" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 2, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comam mollis ... hyacinthi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>flexible</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:818" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 10, 818</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tiliae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:622" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 11, 622</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bracchia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:595" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 595</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cervix,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:185" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 185</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">commissurae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:60" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle litus,</quote> <trans><tr>of soft sand</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:577" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 577</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:476" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 1, 476</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraga,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:13:816" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 13, 816</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castaneae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:1:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 1, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollissima vina ( = mitissima, lenissima),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:341" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 341</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">molli mero,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:7:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 7, 19</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">molle Calenum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:69" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alvus,</quote> <trans><tr>relaxed, open bowels</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cibus,</quote> <trans><tr>mild, not sharp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ovum,</quote> <trans><tr>soft</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:4:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:384" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 384</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gramen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:328" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 328</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:688" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 688</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:742" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 742</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 4, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arcus,</quote> <trans><tr>slack, unbent, unstrung</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">feretrum,</quote> <trans><tr>made soft by a layer of leaves</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollissima cera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:45:177" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 45, 177</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollia panis,</quote> <trans><tr>the soft part of bread, the crumb</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 13, 12, 26, § 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molles genae,</quote> <trans><tr>soft, delicate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">capilli,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> P. 3, 3, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 4, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">latus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:710" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 710</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molles Zephyri,</quote> <trans><tr>soft, gentle</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:728" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A.
