A. 3, 728</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:5:83" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 5, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aestas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:312" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 312</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:1:16:3" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 1, 16, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:4:12:27" default="NO">4, 12, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Euphrates mollior undis,</quote> <trans><tr>gentler, calmer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 726</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aditus,</quote> <trans><tr>easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:491" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 491</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:4:2:46" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 4, 2, 46</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:6:22" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fastigium,</quote> <trans><tr>gentle, not steep</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clivus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 9, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modicis et mollibus clivis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:39:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 39, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jugum montis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">trames,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:13" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: molli bracchio objurgare aliquem, <hi rend="ital">with a gentle arm</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">in a forbearing manner</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 1, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in molli carne vermes nascuntur,</quote> <trans><tr>it is the soft flesh that breeds the worms</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 57</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mollia</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of fishes, mollusks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:267" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 11, 51, 112, § 267</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29481.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29481.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Tender, delicate, susceptible</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollibus annis,</quote> <trans><tr>in tender youth</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">os molle,</quote> <trans><tr>easily blushing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:4:3:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 4, 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollissima corda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:131" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 131</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollissimae aures,</quote> <trans><tr>modest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:68" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 68</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29481.4" n="2" level="3"> In a bad sense, <hi rend="ital">soft, effeminate, unmanly, weak</hi> (syn. effeminatus): <cit><quote lang="la">philosophus tam mollis, tam languidus, tam enervatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:52:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 52, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Sabaei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri molles, i. e. pathici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 87" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 87</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <trans><tr>effeminate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:11:37" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 11, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicatior ... molliorque ratio,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:5:3:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 5, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: desine mollium querellarum,<cb n="MOLL" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:9:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 9, 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis teneraque vox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">educatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">actio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:128" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Gallorum mens est mollis ac minime resistens ad calamitates perferendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sententiae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si taedio laboris longaeque viae, ut est mollis ad talia gens (Gallorum), dilaberentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 22, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Romanos molliores facere ad paciscendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 62, 6</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sunt qui in rebus contrariis parum sibi constent, voluptatem severissime contemnant, in dolore sint molliores, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:21:71" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 21, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">molles in aure fenestrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:104" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 104</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29481.5" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Soft, pleasant, mild, easy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem mollem teneramque reddidit,</quote> <trans><tr>soft, pleasant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:9:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 9, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis et jucunda senectus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita eum placidum mollemque reddidi, ut, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>calm and gentle</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Caecil. 10, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:5:83" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 5, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollia jussa,</quote> <trans><tr>mild, easy</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vincuntur molli pectora dura prece,</quote> <trans><tr>soft, tender, touching</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:76" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic accensum sed molliora referre jussum dimittit,</quote> <trans><tr>to return a gentler answer</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 32 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepius molliora respondens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 12, 46</bibl></cit>: mollis versus, <hi rend="ital">an elegiac</hi> or <hi rend="ital">amatory poem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:307" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 307</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:1:7:19" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 1, 7, 19</bibl> (opp. durus versus, <hi rend="ital">a heroic poem</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:1:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 1, 41</bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ridere mollia,</quote> <trans><tr>to smile gently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 3, 513</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cuncta tamen ad imperatorem in mollius relata,</quote> <trans><tr>in a milder, more favorable light</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pilenta,</quote> <trans><tr>having a gentle motion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 666</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:389" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 2, 389</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollissima fandi tempora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:293" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 293</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hora mollior,</quote> <trans><tr>more favorable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:3:84" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 3, 84</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:18:70" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 18, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">duriora Callon, jam minus rigida Calamis, molliora adhuc supra dictis Myron fecit,</quote> <trans><tr>more agreeable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:10:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 10, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollis animus et ad accipiendam et ad deponendam offensionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 17, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in inimicitiis auricula infima mollior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 13</bibl></cit> (15), 4.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">molle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">softness, smoothness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">molle atque facetum Vergilio adnuerunt Camenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29481.6" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Weak, untrustworthy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil est tam molle, tam tenerum, tam aut fragile aut flexibile quam voluntas erga nos civium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:16:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mil. 16, 42</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭter</orth>. </sense><sense id="n29481.7" n="1" level="3"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">softly, gently, agreeably</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">molliter sustine me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:5:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 5, 2, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aves nidos mollissime substernunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:52:129" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 52, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recubans,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 17, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ossa cubent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:3:76" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 3, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">excudent alii spirantia mollius aera,</quote> <trans><tr>more easily, agreeably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:847" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 847</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cura molliter semina conlocandi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 10, 9, § 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">colles ad orientem molliter devexi,</quote> <trans><tr>gently, gradually</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:2:3 sq" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 2, 3 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n29481.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod ferendum est molliter sapienti,</quote> <trans><tr>calmly, patiently</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:2:5" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abnuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">delicate et molliter vivere,</quote> <trans><tr>voluptuously</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:30:106" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 30, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aegritudinem pati,</quote> <trans><tr>sensitively, weakly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 82:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 82, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid per metum, mollius consuleretur,</quote> <trans><tr>too compliantly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 7, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interpretari mollius aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>rather mildly, favorably</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 96</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mollitia: <entryFree id="n29482" type="main" key="molli^ti^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭtĭa</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcĭa</orth>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mol-lĭtĭes</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mollĭcĭes</orth>), <itype>ēi</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>mollis</etym>, <sense id="n29482.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">movableness, pliability, flexibility, suppleness; softness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29482.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollitia cervicum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:162" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 45, § 162</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lanae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 19, 3, 18, § 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 17, 28, § 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">teneritas et mollitia quaedam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:21:58" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 5, 21, 58</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29482.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">softness, tenderness, susceptibility; weakness, irresolution; effeminacy, voluptuousness, wantonness</hi> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">inertia, desidia): quā mollitiā sum animi ac lenitate, numquam mehercule illius lacrimis ac precibus restitissem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:6:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 6, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agilitas mollitiesque naturae,</quote> <trans><tr>sensitive disposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 17, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frontis,</quote> <trans><tr>bashfulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:29:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 29, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi est ista mollities, non virtus, inopiam paulisper ferre non posse,</quote> <trans><tr>weakness, irresolution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Niciae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:26:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 26, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inertiā et mollitiā animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollitia socordiaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 70, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in munditiis, mollitiis deliciisque aetatulam agere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitatum mores lapsi ad mollitiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:15:38" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 15, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollities luxuriaque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:7:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 7, 13</bibl></cit>: vocis, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 1, 441</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenas otio ac mollitiis paene ultra feminam fluens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:88:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 88, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:6:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 6, 2</bibl>.—Esp., <hi rend="ital">unchastity</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 106</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 11, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mollitorius: <entryFree id="n29483" type="main" key="molli^to_rius"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭtōrius</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29483.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">emollient</hi> (late Lat.), Auct. de Virt. Herb. 30, p. 137.</sense></entryFree>
mollitudo: <entryFree id="n29484" type="main" key="molli^tu_do"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollĭtūdo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29484.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">suppleness, flexibility,<cb n="MOLO" />  softness</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n29484.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">mollitudo vocis,</quote> <trans><tr>flexibility of the voice</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 11, 20</bibl></cit>: manuum, Pac. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:26:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 26, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">assimilis spongiis mollitudo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:55:136" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 55, 136</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 6 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes">10, 2, 11</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n29484.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">softness, susceptibility, weakness</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:40:161" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 40, 161</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corrumpi mollitudine vitiorum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 64</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mollitus: <entryFree id="n29485" type="main" key="molli_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollītus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from mollio.</entryFree>
mollugo: <entryFree id="n29486" type="main" key="mollu_go"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mollūgo</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29486.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a variety of the plant</hi> lappago, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:102" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 10, 65, § 102</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">also called molligo,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molluscus: <entryFree id="n29487" type="main" key="molluscus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">molluscus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mollis</etym>. <sense id="n29487.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Soft</hi>: mollusca nux; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mollu-sca</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of soft nut with a thin shell</hi>, Plaut. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 22, 24, § 90</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29487.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">molluscum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a fungus that grows on the maple-tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 68</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molo: <entryFree id="n29488" type="main" key="mo^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>mola</etym>, <sense id="n29488.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to grind</hi> in a mill. </sense><sense id="n29488.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">molendum usque in pistrino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:2:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 2, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hordeum in subtilem farinam,</quote> <trans><tr>to grind into fine flour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 14, § 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tolle molam, et mole farinam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:47:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 47, 2</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in mola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:24:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Matt. 24, 41</bibl></cit>: molentes in unum, <hi rend="ital">at one mill</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stone</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:17:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 17, 35</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n29488.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in mal. part., <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Epigr. 71, 7</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 23</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlĭ-tus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">ground;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlĭ-tum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">food made of flour</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">edo lubentius molitum quam praehibeo a me,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:6:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 6, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29489" type="main" key="Mo^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29489.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Apollonius of Rhodes, a Greek rhetorician, one of Cicero's teachers, who came to Rome as an ambassador of the Rhodians</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:70:245" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 70, 245</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">90, 311</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:1:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 2, 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:12:6:7" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 12, 6, 7</bibl>, etc.</sense></entryFree>
moloche: <entryFree id="n29490" type="main" key="mo^lo^che"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlŏche</orth>, v. malache.</entryFree>
molochina: <entryFree id="n29491" type="main" key="mo^lo^chi^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† mŏlŏchĭna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moloche</etym>, = <foreign lang="greek">moloxi/nh</foreign>, <sense id="n29491.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a garment woven of fibres from the mallow</hi>: carbasina molochina ampelina, Caecil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 548, 14</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 139 Rib.).—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlucĭum</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">moli-cina</orth>, Nov. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 539, 20</bibl> (Com. Rel. v. 71 Rib.).</sense></entryFree>
molochinarius: <entryFree id="n29492" type="main" key="mo^lo^chi^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlŏchĭnārĭus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">moloci-</orth>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n29492.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mallow-dyer, one who dyes with the color of mallows</hi> (ante- and post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:3:5:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 3, 5, 40</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29492.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A seller of mallowcolored garments</hi>, Inscr. Mar. 939, 6.</sense></entryFree>
molochites: <entryFree id="n29493" type="main" key="mo^lo^chi_tes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† mŏlŏchītes</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">moloxi/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n29493.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an Arabian gem of the color of mallows</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">malachite</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 8, 36, § 114</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molon: <entryFree id="n29494" type="main" key="Mo^lon1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlon</orth>, v. Molo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29495" type="main" key="mo_lon2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōlon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29495.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant, also called</hi> syron, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 7, 19, § 33</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molorchus: <entryFree id="n29496" type="main" key="Mo^lorchus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlorchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29496.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poor vine-dresser near Nemea, who hospitably entertained Hercules when about to slay the lion of that place</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:29" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 6, 51</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:4:160" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 4, 160</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:64:30" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 64, 30</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alpheum linquens lucosque Molorchi,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>the Nemean Forest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 19</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlor-chaeus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj., of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Molorchus</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:4:1:13" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 4, 1, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molorthus: <entryFree id="n29497" type="hapax" key="mo^lorthus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlorthus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29497.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sounding-lead</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">gravis molorthus (al. molybdis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
molossi: <entryFree id="n29498" type="main" key="Mo^lossi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlossi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*molossoi/</foreign>, <sense id="n29498.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the Molossians, a people in the eastern part of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4</bibl> prooem.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:34:76" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 34, 76</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,002:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Them. 8, 4</bibl>.—They were so called from Molossus, the son of Pyrrhus, king of Epirus, and Andromache, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 297</bibl>.—Hence,</sense></entryFree>
molossia: <entryFree id="n29499" type="main" key="Mo^lossi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlossĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*molossi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n29499.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Molossia, the country of the</hi> Molossi, <hi rend="ital">in Epirus</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 297</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molossiambos: <entryFree id="n29500" type="main" key="mo^lossi^ambos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlossĭambos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>molossus-iambus</etym>, <sense id="n29500.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metrical foot consisting of three long syllables and an iambus</hi> (e. g. ādmīrābĭlēs), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
molossicus: <entryFree id="n29501" type="main" key="Mo^lossi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlossĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Molossus</etym>, <sense id="n29501.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Molossian</hi> (ante- and post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">parasiti Molossici (v. Molossus, A.),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>as ravenous as Molossian hounds</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:1:1:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 1, 1, 18</bibl></cit>: carmen, <hi rend="ital">consisting wholly of</hi> molossi (———; <cit><quote lang="la">e. g.: Romani victores Germanis devictis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 513</bibl></cit> P.</sense></entryFree>
molossis: <entryFree id="n29502" type="main" key="Mo^lossis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlossis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*molossi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29502.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Molossis, the country of the</hi> Molossi, <hi rend="ital">in the eastern part of Epirus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molossopyrrhichius: <entryFree id="n29503" type="main" key="mo^losso^pyrrhi^chi^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlossŏ-pyrrhĭchĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>molossus-pyrrhichius</etym>, <sense id="n29503.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metrical foot consisting<pb n="1160" /> <cb n="MOME" />  of a</hi> molossus <hi rend="ital">and a</hi> pyrrhichius (e. g. ādmīrābĭlĭs), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 478</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
molossospondeus: <entryFree id="n29504" type="main" key="mo^lossosponde_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlosso-spondēus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>molossusspondeus</etym>, <sense id="n29504.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a metrical verse consisting of a</hi> molossus <hi rend="ital">and a</hi> spondee (e. g. cōntūrbātōrēs), <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 479</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
molossus: <entryFree id="n29505" type="main" key="Mo^lossus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlossus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">*molosso/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29505.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Molossi, Molossian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">missi de gente Molossā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 226</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">canes, famed for their strength,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:6:114" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 6, 114</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:108" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gladii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:162" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 14, 162</bibl></cit>.—Also, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlossus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n29505.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A Molossian</hi> (hound): <cit><quote lang="la">Molossus acer,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:3:405" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 3, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Molossūm for Molossorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1063" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1063</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29505.2" n="B" level="2"> In prosody: pes, <hi rend="ital">a metrical foot consisting of three long syllables</hi> (e. g. Arpinas, evertunt), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:82" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 82</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 475</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29506" type="main" key="Mo^lossus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlossus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29506.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">son of Pyrrhus, king of Epirus, and Andromache, the progenitor of the</hi> Molossi, acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 297</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molucrum: <entryFree id="n29507" type="main" key="mo^lu_^crum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlū^crum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>mola</etym>. <sense id="n29507.0" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A millbroom</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a broom for sweeping out a mill</hi>: molucrum, quo molae verruntur, quod Graeci <foreign lang="greek">mulh/koron</foreign> dicunt, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=140" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 140</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n29507.1" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A handle for turning a mill</hi>: molucrum, quo molae vertuntur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=142" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 142</bibl> Müll. dub.; al. teruntur; cf. A. supra.—</sense><sense id="n29507.2" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A square log of wood at the place where sacrifices were offered</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">where the</hi> mola salsa <hi rend="ital">was sprinkled on the victim</hi>: Cloatius in libris sacrorum, molucrum esse, aiunt, ligneum (al. lignum) quoddam quadratum, ubi immolatur. Idem Aelius in explanatione carminum Saliarium eodem nomine appellari ait, quod sub molā supponatur. Aurelius Opilius appellat, ubi molatur, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=141" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 141</bibl> Müll.—</sense><sense id="n29507.3" n="D" level="2"> = Mola, <hi rend="ital">a mooncalf, mole</hi>: molucrum ... tumor ventris, qui etiam virginibus incidere solet, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=140" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 140</bibl> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
molus: <entryFree id="n29508" type="main" key="Mo^lus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlus</orth>, v. Tmolus.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29509" type="hapax" key="Mo^lus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏlos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/los</foreign>, <sense id="n29509.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the father of</hi> Meriones, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 97" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 97</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moly: <entryFree id="n29510" type="greek" key="mo_ly"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōly</orth>, <itype>yos</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mw=lu</foreign>. <sense id="n29510.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A plant with a white flower and a black root</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 4, 8, § 26</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29510.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Another plant, a kind of nightshade</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 21, 31, 105, § 180</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molybdaena: <entryFree id="n29511" type="greek" key="mo^lybdaena"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlybdaena</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">molu/bdaina</foreign>. <sense id="n29511.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Sulphuret of lead, galena</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 18, 53, § 173</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29511.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The plant leadwort</hi> (pure Lat. plumbago), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:155" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 97, § 155</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molybditis: <entryFree id="n29512" type="greek" key="mo^lybdi_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlybdītis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">molubdi=tis</foreign>, <sense id="n29512.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the spume of lead, lead-ashes</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 106</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
molybdus: <entryFree id="n29513" type="greek" key="mo^lybdus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlybdus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏlybdis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mo/lubdos</foreign> and <foreign lang="greek">molubdis</foreign>, <sense id="n29513.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">lead</hi> (pure Lat. plumbum), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:2:30" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 2, 30</bibl>; v. molorthus.</sense></entryFree>
momar: <entryFree id="n29514" type="gloss" key="momar"><orth extent="full" lang="la">momar</orth>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mw=mar</foreign>: Siculi stultum appellant, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=140" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 140</bibl> Müll.</entryFree>
momen: <entryFree id="n29515" type="main" key="mo_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōmen</orth>, <itype>ĭnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for movimen, from moveo</etym>. <sense id="n29515.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Movement, motion</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">e salso consurgere momine ponti,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>from the salt billows</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:474" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 474</bibl></cit>; so also <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:632" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 632</bibl>, and 4, 179; v. Lachm. (where others read numine); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 144</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29515.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Weight, momentum; importance, moment</hi> (ante- and postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">momine parvo moveri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:188" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 188</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius mominis esse,</quote> <trans><tr>to be of no consequence, of no moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 2, 77</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n29515.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A moment</hi> of time, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 3, 675</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
momentaliter: <entryFree id="n29516" type="hapax" key="mo_menta_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōmentālĭter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>momentum</etym>, <sense id="n29516.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">in a moment</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
momentana: <entryFree id="n29517" type="main" key="mo_menta_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōmentāna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29517.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a delicate pair of scales for weighing gold and silver</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">momentana pro parva modicaque pecunia,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 25, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
momentaneus: <entryFree id="n29518" type="main" key="mo_menta_ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōmentānĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29518.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">short, of brief duration, momentary</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">momentaneus ardor gentium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 17</bibl></cit> dub.: <cit><quote lang="la">vices rerum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 2, 24 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">felicitas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Fulg.</author> Myth. 2, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 69</bibl> (83), 9; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,008:4:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 2 Cor. 4, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
momentarius: <entryFree id="n29519" type="main" key="mo_menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōmentārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29519.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">brief, of brief duration, momentary; quick</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">maritus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>who stays but a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 164, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2</bibl></cit>, p. 127, 24: <cit><quote lang="la">cura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:34:1:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 34, 1, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29519.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">instantaneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">venenum,</quote> <trans><tr>that operates quickly</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 281, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
momentosus: <entryFree id="n29520" type="hapax" key="mo_mento_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōmentōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29520.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">rapid, momentary</hi>: rapina (apis), Ps.-<bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:Decl. 13:12" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> Decl. 13, 12</bibl>. <cb n="MOME" /></sense></entryFree>
momentum: <entryFree id="n29521" type="main" key="mo_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mōmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>for movimentum, from moveo</etym>, <sense id="n29521.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a movement, motion</hi> (as an indwelling force; cf.: motio, motus; class.). </sense><sense id="n29521.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">astra forma ipsa figuraque sua momenta sustentant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:46:117" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 46, 117</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pisces levi caudae in utrumque momento velocitatem suam flectunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 90:24" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 90, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque leves tactus momentaque parva sequantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:180" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 180</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29521.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29521.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An alteration, change, disturbance, movement, revolution</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cetera populi Romani vectigalia, perlevi saepe momento fortunae, inclinatione temporis pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:29:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 29, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum momentum annonae facere,</quote> <trans><tr>to effect no alteration in the price of corn</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincias magnis momentis concusserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:78:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 78, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sine momento rerum, partisque ruinā cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 118</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29521.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A particle sufficient to turn the scales</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">momentum staterae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:40:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Isa. 40, 15</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,033:11:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sap. 11, 23</bibl>; hence, <hi rend="ital">a particle, a part, a point</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">myrrhae momentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 10, 27, § 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus (regnis) pro ignobili momento erat accessura Macedonia,</quote> <trans><tr>a make-weight</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:3:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 7, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sol cotidie ex alio caeli momento, quam pridie, oritur,</quote> <trans><tr>a point, part</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:333" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 34, 77, § 333</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpus orationis in parva momenta diducendo consumere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:3:11:23" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 3, 11, 23</bibl></cit>; <hi rend="ital">to lose the main subject in minute divisions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo rerum tribus momentis consertus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:71" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 10, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officiorum,</quote> <trans><tr>parts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 2, 3</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29521.5" n="b" level="4"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29521.6" n="(a)" level="5"> Of time, <hi rend="ital">a short time, brief space, moment</hi> (syn. punctum): <cit><quote lang="la">parvis momentis multa natura affingit,</quote> <trans><tr>instants, moments</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:52:118" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 52, 118</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">momentis certis dimensis,</quote> <trans><tr>at certain fixed times</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:30:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 30, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non cunctandum ratus Hannibal, totis viribus adgressus urbem momento cepit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:14:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 14, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">momento temporis,</quote> <trans><tr>in a moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:11:13" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 11, 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">momento horae,</quote> <trans><tr>in quick lapse of time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 1, 7</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">momento unius horae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 9, 6, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horae momento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 7, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:16" default="NO" valid="yes">9, 16</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Maecenati triennio supremo nullo horae momento contigit somnus,</quote> <trans><tr>could not sleep a single hour</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 51, 52, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">brevi horarum momento,</quote> <trans><tr>in a few hours</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 14, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut momentum horae pereat,</quote> <trans><tr>that a short hour be lost</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3</bibl></cit> prol. 5: <cit><quote lang="la">momento fit cinis diu silva,</quote> <trans><tr>in a moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:27:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 27, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in momento, in ictu oculi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,007:15:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Cor. 15, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in momento indignationis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,048:54:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Isa. 54, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pruna stomacho non utilissima, sed brevi momento,</quote> <trans><tr>are hurtful, but only for a short time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 66, § 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quantum quoquo momento temporis adiciatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:70" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc fit dicis gratia uno momento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:ib. 1:141" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 141</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29521.7" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of space, distance, <hi rend="ital">a little way</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvo momento antecedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">visūs nostri tarditas non subsequitur momenta currentis (sc. stellae), sed videt simul et unde exsilierit et quo pervenerit,</quote> <trans><tr>does not trace the successive points of its course, but sees the whole at once</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 1:14:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 1, 14, 4</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n29521.8" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a cause, a circumstance; weight, influence, importance, moment</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">minimis momentis maximae inclinationes temporum fiunt,</quote> <trans><tr>from the slightest causes spring the greatest changes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:10:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">momenta omnia observare,</quote> <trans><tr>all the circumstances</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 6, 10, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">unamquamque rem momento suo ponderare,</quote> <trans><tr>according to its importance</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,007:6:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Font. 6, 21</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ut omnia verborum momentis, non rerum ponderibus examinet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:3:8:12" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rep. 3, 8, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita parvae res magnum in utramque partem momentum habuerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quorum adventus hoc tamen momenti fecit, ut Scipio abscederet inde, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullum momentum in dando adimendoque regno habere,</quote> <trans><tr>no decisive influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:47:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 47, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">momenti aliquid apud Magnetas ad repetendam societatem Romanam facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:39:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 39, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cave quidquam habeat momenti gratia,</quote> <trans><tr>weight, influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magno ad persuadendum momento esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:26:77" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 2, 26, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">potentia,</quote> <trans><tr>motives</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:285" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 285</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Leonis (sideris),</quote> <trans><tr>influence</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 10, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praebe nostrae momenta saluti,</quote> <trans><tr>promote</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:13:49" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 13, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">erant octo cohortes ... tum discordiā temporum a legione digressae, prout inclinassent, grande momentum sociae aut adversae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">levi momento aestimare aliquid,</quote> <trans><tr>to consider of little moment, to prize lightly</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullius momenti aliquid putare,</quote> <trans><tr>of no moment, unimportant</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: nullius momenti apud exercitum<cb n="MONE" />  futurum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 8, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod (oppidum) per se parvum magni momenti locum obtinuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id est maximi momenti et ponderis,</quote> <trans><tr>of the greatest moment</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,023:4:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Vatin. 4, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exponunt, se tentāsse etiam haud magni momenti finitimarum gentium auxilia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 16, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed in bello nihil tam leve est, quod non magnae interdum rei momentum faciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:18:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 18, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:17:10" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 17, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes">27, 45, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inpensam in rem maximi ad omnia momenti facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:43:23:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 43, 23, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nullā in re nisi in virtute propensionem ne minimi quidem momenti esse ad, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:4:17:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 4, 17, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnino nihil habere momenti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 12, 38</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mona: <entryFree id="n29522" type="main" key="Mo^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/na</foreign>, <sense id="n29522.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of two islands</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29522.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Isle of Man</hi>, near Britain, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 13</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29522.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">The Isle of Anglesea</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 75, 77, § 187</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monacha: <entryFree id="n29523" type="greek" key="mo^na^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnăcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monaxh/</foreign>, <sense id="n29523.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a nun</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 39, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monachicus: <entryFree id="n29524" type="greek" key="mo^na^chi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnăchĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">monaxiko/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29524.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monkish</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">certamen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Novell. Constit. 133:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Novell. Constit. 133, 5</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monachium: <entryFree id="n29525" type="greek" key="mo^na^chi_um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnăchīum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monaxei=on</foreign>, <sense id="n29525.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a monastery</hi> (post-class.), Impp. Valent. et Marc. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 1, 2, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monachus: <entryFree id="n29526" type="greek" key="mo^na^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monaxo/s</foreign> (that lives alone), <sense id="n29526.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a monk</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Rutil.</author> Nam. 1, 441</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 22, 34</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monaeses: <entryFree id="n29527" type="main" key="Mo^naeses"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏnaeses</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29527.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a king of the Parthians</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Monaeses et Pacori manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 6, 9</bibl></cit> (Monaeses et Pacorus reges Persarum fuere, Schol. Acr.).</sense></entryFree>
monaliter: <entryFree id="n29528" type="main" key="mo^na_li^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnālĭter</orth>, v. monauliter.</entryFree>
monarcha: <entryFree id="n29529" type="greek" key="mo^narcha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnarcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mona/rxhs</foreign>, <sense id="n29529.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an absolute ruler, a monarch</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): caeruli monarcha ponti, Vet. poët. ap. Mar. Victor. p. 2551 P.</sense></entryFree>
monarchia: <entryFree id="n29530" type="main" key="mo^narchi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnarchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monarxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n29530.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">absolute rule, monarchy</hi> (post-class. for unius dominatio, imperium singulare, regnum, regalis potestas), Capitol. Max. and Balb. 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Prax. 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 1, 5, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monarius: <entryFree id="n29531" type="main" key="mo^na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mo/nos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29531.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having but one form</hi> in inflection: nomen, Gram. Vatic. de Nom. 68 (class., Auct. 5, p. 240 Mai.).</sense></entryFree>
monas: <entryFree id="n29532" type="greek" key="mo^nas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnas</orth>, <itype>ădis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mona/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29532.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unity; a unit, monad</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> Somn. Scip. 1, 6, 7</bibl> sqq.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Val. 37</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Praescr. 49 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> et saep.</sense></entryFree>
monasterialis: <entryFree id="n29533" type="main" key="mo^naste_ri^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnastērĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monasterium</etym>, <sense id="n29533.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monastic, monasterial</hi> (eccl. Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">disciplina,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 7, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monasteriolum: <entryFree id="n29534" type="gloss" key="mo^naste_ri^o^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnastērĭŏlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29534.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little monastery</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 192</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> Ep. 105, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monasterium: <entryFree id="n29535" type="greek" key="mo^naste_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnastērĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monasth/rion</foreign>, <sense id="n29535.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a monastery</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">7, 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:ad Casul. Ep. 86" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> ad Casul. Ep. 86</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monastriae:
<entryFree id="n29536" type="greek" key="mo^nastri^ae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnastrĭae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mona/striai</foreign>, <sense id="n29536.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nuns</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:Novell. Constit. 123:27" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> Novell. Constit. 123, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:44" default="NO">44</bibl>.
‡† <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnaules</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monau/lhs</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">a player on the single flute</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 173</bibl>; cf. monaulos.</sense></entryFree>
monauliter: <entryFree id="n29537" type="main" key="mo^nauli^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnaulĭter</orth>, <sense id="n29537.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adv., on a single flute</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">sonare (al. monaliter alone),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 906</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monaulos: <entryFree id="n29538" type="greek" key="mo^naulos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnaulos</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnaulus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mo/naulos</foreign>, <sense id="n29538.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a single flute, a flute with a single pipe</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fistulam et monaulum (invenit) Pan Mercurii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:204" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 204</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe monaulon habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:64:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 64, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. monaules.</sense></entryFree>
monazontes: <entryFree id="n29539" type="greek" key="mo^nazontes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnazontes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mona/zontes</foreign> (who live alone), <sense id="n29539.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monks</hi> (post-class.), Cod. Th. 12, 1, 63.</sense></entryFree>
monda: <entryFree id="n29540" type="main" key="Monda"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Monda</orth>, v. Munda, II. <sense id="n29540.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
monedula: <entryFree id="n29541" type="main" key="mo^ne_du^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnēdŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29541.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a jackdaw, daw</hi>, Corvus monedula, Linn.: <cit><quote lang="la">examina graculorum monedularum, cui soli avi furacitas auri argentique praecipue mira est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 29, 41, § 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:99" default="NO" valid="yes">17, 14, 22, § 99</bibl>. Acc. to the myth, the nymph Arne was turned into a daw, for having betrayed her country for gold, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:465 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 465 sq.</bibl>—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">non plus aurum tibi quam monedulae committebant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 31, 76</bibl></cit>.—As a term of endearment, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 103</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:4:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Capt. 5, 4, 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monela: <entryFree id="n29542" type="main" key="mo^ne_la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnēla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moneo</etym>, <sense id="n29542.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reminding, admonition</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Pat. 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Marc. 4, 34</bibl>. <pb n="1161" /> <cb n="MONE" /></sense></entryFree>
monemeron: <entryFree id="n29543" type="greek" key="mo^ne_me^ron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnēmĕron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monh/meron</foreign>, <sense id="n29543.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of eye-salve</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Marc. Emp.</author> 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
moneo: <entryFree id="n29544" type="main" key="mo^ne^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĕo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ĭtum, 2</itype> (<sense id="n29544.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">inf. pres. pass.</hi> monerier, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:2:3:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 2, 3, 36</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">perf. subj.</hi> moneris pro monueris, Pac. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 507, 24 sq.</bibl>; cf. Trag. Rel. p. 66 Rib.; likewise: di monerint meliora, Pac. ap. Non. l. l. p. 74 Rib.), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>causative from the root men; whence memini, q. v., mens, mentio; lit. to cause to think</etym>. </sense><sense id="n29544.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to remind, put in mind of, bring to one's recollection; to admonish, advise, warn, instruct, teach</hi> (syn.: hortor, suadeo, doceo): bene mones; tute ipse cunctas, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 469, 25</bibl> (Com. v. 3 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">ea (auctoritas) adhibeatur ad monendum non modo aperte, sed etiam acriter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:13:44" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 13, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">melius nos Zenonis praecepta monent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:15:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 15, 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29544.2" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem de re</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">oro, ut Terentiam moneatis de testamento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:11:16:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 11, 16, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 3, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29544.3" n="(g)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Fabius ea me ex tuis mandatis monuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ipsum, quod me mones,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:19:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 14, 19, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sed eos hoc moneo, desinant furere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:9:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cat. 2, 9, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos quo pauca monerem advocavi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 58:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 58, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 96, 8</bibl>.— Hence also in <hi rend="ital">pass.</hi>, moneri <hi rend="ital">aliquid</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut moneatur semper servos homo officium suam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:1:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 1, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec ea, quae ab eā (naturā) monemur, audimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:88" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 88</bibl></cit>; cf. infra. <foreign lang="greek">c</foreign>.—</sense><sense id="n29544.4" n="(d)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">Aliquem alicujus rei</hi> (post-Aug., and only in Tac.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">admoneo, commonefacio): Caecina milites temporis ac necessitatis monet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 67</bibl></cit> Nipperd. ad loc.: <cit><quote lang="la">Plancinam Augusta monuit Agrippinam insectandi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 43</bibl></cit>.— (<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">ut, ne</hi>, or the simple <hi rend="ital">subj.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monere te atque hortari, ut in rem publicam incumberes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:10:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 10, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monet ut suspiciones vitet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: moneo, praedico, ante denuntio, abstineant, manus <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:12:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 12, 36</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">moneo obtestorque ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 10:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 10, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:49:2" default="NO" valid="yes">49, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 4:61:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 61, 23</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos, ne amittatis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 31:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 31, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Macedonas monebat, ne multitudine hostium ... moverentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quamquam edicto monuisset ne quis quietem ejus interrumperet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 67 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>—（<foreign lang="greek">c</foreign>) With an <hi rend="ital">object-</hi> or <hi rend="ital">rel.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Caesar) monuit ejus diei victoriam in earum cohortium virtute constare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:89:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 89, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moneret rationem frumenti esse habendam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:34" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cerealis propinquos monebat fortunam belli mutare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arminius colligi suos et propinquare silvis monitos vertit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ultro struebantur qui monerent perfugere ad Germaniae exercitus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 67</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Radamistum obpugnationem celerare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 46</bibl></cit>; 13, 37; 16, 11; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si te unum illud monuerimus, artem sine assiduitate dicendi non multum juvare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moneo, quid facto opus sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:4:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 4, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res monet cavere, consultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alio properare tempus monet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 19, 2</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Nicanorem insidiari Piraeo a Dercillo moneretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,019:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Phoc. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29544.5" n="b" level="4"> Of inanim. and abstr. subjects: <cit><quote lang="la">res ipsa monebat tempus esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:8:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sol) caecos instare tumultus Saepe monet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immortalia ne speres, monet annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:7:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura monet festinare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:227" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 25, 60, § 227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut monet ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:41:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 2, 41, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ratio ipsa monet amicitias comparare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:20:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 20, 66</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29544.6" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose). </sense><sense id="n29544.7" n="A" level="2"> Without the accessory notion of reminding or admonishing, in gen., <hi rend="ital">to teach, instruct, tell, inform, point out;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">to announce, predict, foretell</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu vatem, tu diva, mone,</quote> <trans><tr>instruct thy bard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut divinitus mente monitā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc moneas precor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:247" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 247</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amici somnio monitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">reddebant parvuli, quae monebantur,</quote> <trans><tr>what they were taught</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:26" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vates Helenus cum multa horrenda moneret,</quote> <trans><tr>announced, foretold</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:712" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 712</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ante sinistra cavā monuisset ab ilice cornix, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid augurales alites vel cantus monerent,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 28, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recte monemur, causas non utique ab ultimo esse repetendas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:83" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 83</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29544.8" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To punish, chastise</hi> (only in Tacitus): <cit><quote lang="la">puerili verbere moneri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:5:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 5, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
moneris: <entryFree id="n29545" type="greek" key="mo^ne_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnēris</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monh/rhs</foreign> (sc. <foreign lang="greek">nau=s</foreign>), <sense id="n29545.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a vessel with a single bank of oars, a galley</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:38:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 38, 8</bibl> (cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:5:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 5, 23</bibl>).</sense></entryFree>
moneta: <entryFree id="n29546" type="main" key="Mo^ne_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏnēta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype> (archaic <sense id="n29546.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> Monetas, Liv. Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moneo</etym>. </sense><sense id="n29546.1" n="I" level="1"> <cb n="MONI" /> <hi rend="ital">The mother of the Muses</hi>, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">*mnhmosu/nh</foreign>: <foreign lang="greek">*mnhmosu/nh</foreign> Moneta, Gloss. Philox.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:3:18:47" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 3, 18, 47</bibl>; Hyg. Fab. praef.: filia Monetas, Liv.
