Andron. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 679</bibl> P.—</sense><sense id="n29546.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname of Juno, in whose temple at Rome money was coined</hi>: cum terrae motus factus esset, Ut sue plena procuratio fieret, vocem ab aede Junonis ex arce exstitisse; <cit><quote lang="la">quocirca Junonem illam appellatam Monetam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:45:101" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 45, 101</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 28, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:638" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 638</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">6, 183</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:3" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 7, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi nunc aedes atque officina Monetae est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:20:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 6, 20, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29546.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29546.4" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The place for coining money, the mint</hi>: ad Philotimum scripsi de viatico, sive a moneta, sive ab Oppiis, i. e. <hi rend="ital">taken from the mint</hi> or <hi rend="ital">borrowed from the Oppian usurers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:8:7:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 8, 7, 3</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 23, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monetae officinator,</quote> <trans><tr>master of the mint</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3227</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monetae aequator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 3228</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29546.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Coined money, coin, money</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">victaque concedit prisca moneta novae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:222" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nigrae, i. e. aereae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:100:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 100, 13</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 5, 25, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">falsam monetam percussisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">probata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:23:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 23, 16</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29546.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A stamp</hi> or <hi rend="ital">die</hi> for coining money: <cit><quote lang="la">a novā monetā,</quote> <trans><tr>of a new stamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:55:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 55, 8</bibl></cit>.—Hence, trop.: <cit><quote lang="la">communi feriat carmen triviale moneta,</quote> <trans><tr>of the common stamp, in ordinary style</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:55" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam tempus est quaedam ex nostrā, ut ita dicam, monetā proferri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 3:35:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 3, 35, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nomina Graeca Latinā monetā percussa,</quote> <trans><tr>of the Latin stamp</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Mag. p. 298, 33</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monetalis: <entryFree id="n29547" type="main" key="mo^ne_ta_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnētālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>moneta</etym>, <sense id="n29547.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the mint; minted, coined</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">triumviri monetales,</quote> <trans><tr>the directors of the mint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:2:2:section=30" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 2, 2, § 30</bibl></cit>.—In jest of one who asks for money: <cit><quote lang="la">monetali ascripsi, quod ille ad me pro consule,</quote> <trans><tr>the money-man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:11:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 11, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum,</quote> <trans><tr>coined</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 7, p. 190, 21</bibl></cit>: pes monetalis, <hi rend="ital">the Roman foot</hi> (because the standard was kept in the temple of Juno Moneta), Grom. Vet. p. 128, 2 sq.</sense></entryFree>
monetarius: <entryFree id="n29548" type="main" key="mo^ne_ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnētārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29548.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the mint</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">FAMILIA,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3226</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnētārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a master of the mint</hi>, Inscr. Mur. 968, 5: monetarii, <hi rend="ital">minters, coiners</hi> (post-class.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:Epit. Eutr. 35" default="NO"><author>Aur. Vict.</author> Epit. Eutr. 35</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 14</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 38</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monile: <entryFree id="n29549" type="main" key="mo^ni_le"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnīle</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>kindr. to Sanscr. mani; Lat. gemma, margarīta; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">ma/nnos, mo/nnos</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29549.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a necklace, a collar</hi> (esp. of women, but also of boys and of animals), Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=138" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 138</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:1:3" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 1, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum (Eriphyle) vidisset monile ex auro et gemmis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:18:section=39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 18, § 39</bibl></cit>; Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 150, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">colloque monile Baccatum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:654" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 654</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 3, 11, § 44</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: monilia, <hi rend="ital">jewels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto posuere monilia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:85" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super gemmas et monilia calcare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, 1, p. 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monilibus legatis, aurum vel argentum non debetur, nisi, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 60</bibl></cit>.—Worn by boys: <cit><quote lang="la">vidit in Herculeo suspensa monilia collo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 9, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ornabant aurata monilia collum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 5, 52</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">A collar</hi>, worn by horses: <cit><quote lang="la">aurea pectoribus demissa monilia pendent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:278" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 278</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">by a stag,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:10:113" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 10, 113</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monimentarius: <entryFree id="n29550" type="main" key="mo^ni^menta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭmentārĭus</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭmentum</orth>, v. monum-.</entryFree>
monitio: <entryFree id="n29551" type="main" key="mo^ni^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭtĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>moneo</etym>, <sense id="n29551.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reminding, admonishing, advice, admonition, warning</hi> (rare but class.): objurgatio post turpe factum castigatio: monitio vero est ante commissum, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=196" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 196</bibl> Müll.: monitio acerbitate, objurgatio contumeliā careat, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:24:89" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Lael. 24, 89</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">volebat credi, monitione ejus futura praenoscere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 56</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ne monitione quidem proficiant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:39" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:30" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 30</bibl></cit>.—In <number>plur.</number>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:6" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monito: <entryFree id="n29552" type="main" key="mo^ni^to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭto</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. freq. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29552.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to remind, admonish</hi> (post-class.), Venant. Vit. S. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:2:387" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 2, 387</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:Carm. 5:5:23" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Carm. 5, 5, 23</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monitor: <entryFree id="n29553" type="main" key="mo^ni^tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭtor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29553.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one who reminds</hi> one of any thing, <hi rend="ital">an admonisher, monitor</hi> (syn.: hortator, auctor). </sense><sense id="n29553.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">nil opus fuit monitore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monitor et praemonstrator,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">est enim (hoc praeceptum) non tam acutum quam necessarium, magisque monitoris non fatui quam eruditi magistri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:24:99" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 24, 99</bibl></cit>: stet ad latus monitor, <cb n="MONO" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 94:72" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 94, 72</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">officii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monitoris egere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 18, 67</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29553.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29553.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">The counsellor who furnishes an orator with his points of law, a remembrancer, an assistant</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">video mihi non te sed hunc librum esse responsurum, quem monitor tuus hic tenet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:16:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 16, 52</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29553.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">He who reminds one of people's names, a nomenclator</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">per monitorem appellandi sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 77</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29553.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">An overseer, superintendent</hi>, e. g. of youth; <hi rend="ital">an instructor, guide, teacher</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvenis monitoribus asper,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">generosa pubes Te monitore regi, mores et facta priorum Discere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:147" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 147</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:205" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Th. 12, 205</bibl>.—Of farm-slaves, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:9:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 9, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7" default="NO">7</bibl>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 3, 6, 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:7:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 33, 7, 8</bibl>; <hi rend="ital">leader, general of troops</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:8:370" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 8, 370</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29553.6" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A prompter</hi> in the theatre: monitores qui monent histriones in scenā, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=138" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 138</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4916</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29553.7" n="E" level="2"> In relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">one who leads in praying</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">MONITOR AVGVR, Inscr. Don. cl. 1, 44: sine monitore, quia de pectore oramus, precantes sumus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Apol. 30</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monitorius: <entryFree id="n29554" type="main" key="mo^ni^to_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭtōrĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monitor</etym>, <sense id="n29554.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that serves to remind</hi> or <hi rend="ital">admonish, monitory</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">fulmen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:39:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 39, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:ib. 2:49:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 49, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monitum: <entryFree id="n29555" type="main" key="mo^ni^tum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>moneo</etym>, <sense id="n29555.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">admonition, advice, counsel</hi> (rare but class.): <cit><quote lang="la">meis consiliis, monitis, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:8:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 5, 8, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tuis monitis praeceptisque,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 13, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">meas aures omnium praeceptis monitisque patuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:14:7:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 14, 7, 20</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 1, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:21:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Deut. 21, 20</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29555.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A prophecy, prediction</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">deorum monita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:25:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Har. Resp. 25, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Carmentis Nymphae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:336" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 336</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monitus: <entryFree id="n29556" type="main" key="mo^ni^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood>, from moneo.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29557" type="main" key="mo^ni^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnĭtus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>moneo</etym>, <sense id="n29557.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a reminding, warning, admonition</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29557.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (only <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">monitu nutricis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:18:115" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 18, 115</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">finierat monitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 2, 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laevo monitu pueros producit avaros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:228" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 228</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monitus acres tradere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:475" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 475</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n29557.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">admonition by the gods</hi> through omens, <hi rend="ital">an omen, prognostic, prophecy, the will of the gods, a warning</hi> by oracles, lightning, etc. (class.): fortunae monitu, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:41:86" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 41, 86</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">revererique numinum monitus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:76" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fulgarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 24</bibl></cit>: pecudum, <hi rend="ital">sacrificial signs</hi> or <hi rend="ital">prognostics</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:1:29" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 1, 29</bibl>: sub obtentu monituum deorum quaedam enuntiare, Mos. et Rom. Leg. Coll. 15, 2, 6.</sense></entryFree>
monnula: <entryFree id="n29558" type="gloss" key="monnu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monnŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29558.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a darling</hi>, a late Lat. term of endearment, Inscr. Mur. 2083, 2.</sense></entryFree>
monobelus: <entryFree id="n29559" type="greek" key="mo^no^be^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏbĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/belos</foreign> (all shaft): i. q. magno pene praeditus, Heliog. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Heliog. 8, 7</bibl>.</entryFree>
monobolon: <entryFree id="n29560" type="greek" key="mo^no^bo^lon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏbŏlon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mo/nos-bo/los</foreign>, <sense id="n29560.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a single throw</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">leaping alone</hi>, a game in which various feats of bodily agility are performed without the aid of a leapingpole; <cit><quote lang="la">diff. from the contomonobolon, where the performer is furnished with such a pole (post-class.),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 3, 43, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monoceros: <entryFree id="n29561" type="hapax" key="mo^no^ce^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏcĕros</orth>, <itype>ōtis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/kerws</foreign>, <sense id="n29561.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a unicorn</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">asperrimam autem feram monocerotem, reliquo corpore equo similem, capite cervo, pedibus elephanto, cauda apro, mugitu gravi, uno cornu nigro mediā fronte cubitorum duūm eminente,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:76" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 21, 31, § 76</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monochordos: <entryFree id="n29562" type="greek" key="mo^no^chordos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏchordos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/xordos</foreign>, <sense id="n29562.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one string</hi>: cithara, Aeron. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 216</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏchordon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <foreign lang="greek">mono/xordon</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">the monochord, tonometer</hi>, Boëth. Instr. Mus. 1, 27 al.‡ † <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏchŏrĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mo/nos-xo/ros</foreign>, <hi rend="ital">one who dances alone, who executes a pas seul</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monochromata: <entryFree id="n29563" type="greek" key="mo^nochro_ma^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnochrōmăta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monoxrw/mata</foreign>, <sense id="n29563.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">paintings of but one color</hi> (postAug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:117" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 39, § 117</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:56" default="NO" valid="yes">35, 8, 34, § 56</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monochromateus: <entryFree id="n29564" type="spur" key="mo^nochro_ma^te_us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">† mŏnochrōmătēus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">monoxrwma/teios</foreign>, a false reading for <foreign lang="la">mox neogrammatea</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 5, 11, § 29</bibl>.</entryFree>
monochromatos: <entryFree id="n29565" type="greek" key="mo^nochro_ma^tos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnochrōmătos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">monoxrw/matos</foreign>, <sense id="n29565.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-colored, of a single color</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">picturam singulis coloribus, et monochromaton dictam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 3, 5, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf. monochromata.</sense></entryFree>
monochromos: <entryFree id="n29566" type="greek" key="mo^no^chro_mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏchrōmos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/xrwmos</foreign>, <sense id="n29566.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-colored, monochromatic</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83, 2</bibl>. <pb n="1162" /> <cb n="MONO" /></sense></entryFree>
monochronos: <entryFree id="n29567" type="greek" key="mo^nochro^nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnochrŏnos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/xronos</foreign>, <sense id="n29567.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one time, of the same time</hi> or <hi rend="ital">measure</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">tempus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 9, § 982</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monoclonos: <entryFree id="n29568" type="greek" key="mo^noclo_nos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnoclōnos</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/klwnos</foreign>, <sense id="n29568.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a single branch</hi> or <hi rend="ital">shoot</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">herba monoclonos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 10</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monocnemos: <entryFree id="n29569" type="main" key="mo^nocne_mos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnocnēmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/knhmos</foreign>, <sense id="n29569.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-legged, a one-legged man</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 83</bibl> dub.</sense></entryFree>
monocolus: <entryFree id="n29570" type="greek" key="mo^no^co_lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏcōlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/kwlos</foreign>, <sense id="n29570.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">onelegged</hi>, epithet applied to a fabled race of giants, each with but one leg of prodigious strength (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">hominum genus, qui monocoli vocarentur, singulis cruribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 2, 2, § 23</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:9:4:9" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 9, 4, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 52, 29</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monocrepis: <entryFree id="n29571" type="greek" key="mo^nocre_pis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnocrēpis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monokrhpi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29571.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-shoed, he that has but one shoe</hi> (postclass.): <cit><quote lang="la">monocrepis, id est uno pede calceatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 12" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 12</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monoculus: <entryFree id="n29572" type="greek" key="mo^no^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>vox hybr. from <foreign lang="greek">mo/nos</foreign> and oculus</etym>, <sense id="n29572.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-eyed, a one-eyed man</hi> (post-class.), Firm. Math. 8, 19; 8, 22; cf. Gloss. Lab. monoculus = <foreign lang="greek">mono/fqalmos</foreign>.</sense></entryFree>
monodia: <entryFree id="n29573" type="main" key="mo^no_dia"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnōdia</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. monodium.</entryFree>
monodiaria: <entryFree id="n29574" type="gloss" key="mo^no_di^a_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnōdĭārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">monw|di/a</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29574.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that sings alone, a female solo-singer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2633</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monodiarius: <entryFree id="n29575" type="gloss" key="mo^no_di^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnōdĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29575.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a solosinger</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Not. Tir.</author> p. 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monodium: <entryFree id="n29576" type="gloss" key="mo^no_di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnōdĭum</orth>, <itype>ĭi</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monw/|dion</foreign>, <sense id="n29576.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the song of a solo-singer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 489</bibl>.—Also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnōdĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monw|di/a</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 6, 19, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monodus: <entryFree id="n29577" type="gloss" key="Mo^no^du_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏnŏdūs</orth>, <itype>ontos</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">mono/dous</foreign>, onetoothed</etym>, <sense id="n29577.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Prusias, who had only a solid bone instead of teeth</hi>.—So, also, <hi rend="ital">Pyrrhus, king of the Epirotæ</hi>, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=148" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 148</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 16, 15, § 69</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:8:12" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 8, 12</bibl> <hi rend="ital">ext.</hi></sense></entryFree>
monoecus: <entryFree id="n29578" type="main" key="Mo^noecus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Mŏnoecus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*mo/noikos</foreign> (that dwells alone), <sense id="n29578.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of Hercules;</hi> hence, Arx Monoeci, <hi rend="ital">a promontory and harbor in Liguria</hi>, the mod. <hi rend="ital">Monaco</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">portus Herculis Monoeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 47</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Arx Monoeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:830" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 830</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:408" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 408</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 15, 10, 9</bibl>.—Called also: <cit><quote lang="la">Saxa Monoeci,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:586" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 586</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monogamia: <entryFree id="n29579" type="greek" key="mo^no^ga^mi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏgămĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monogami/a</foreign>, <sense id="n29579.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a marrying of but one wife, monogamy</hi> (eccl. Lat.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Monog. 2 sq.</bibl>; Hier. in. Jovinian. 1, 14.</sense></entryFree>
monogamus: <entryFree id="n29580" type="greek" key="mo^no^ga^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏgămus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/gamos</foreign>, <sense id="n29580.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who has but one wife</hi> (eccl. Lat.), Hier. in. Jovinian. 1, 15; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ep. 69, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monogenes: <entryFree id="n29581" type="main" key="mo^no^ge^ne_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏgĕnēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym><foreign lang="greek">monogenh/s</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n29581.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">onlybegotten, only</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Valent. 7</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
monogramma: <entryFree id="n29582" type="greek" key="mo^nogramma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnogramma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/gramma</foreign>, <sense id="n29582.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a character consisting of several letters, a monogram</hi> (post-class.), e. g. <foreign /> = Christus, <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul. Nol.</author> Carm. 26, 618</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monogrammus: <entryFree id="n29583" type="greek" key="mo^nogrammus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnogrammus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">-on</orth>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/grammos</foreign>, lit. of pictures, <sense id="n29583.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that consist of lines merely, outlined, sketched;</hi> hence transf., </sense><sense id="n29583.1" n="I" level="1"> Of incorporeal gods, <hi rend="ital">shadowy</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Epicurus monogrammos Deos et nihil agentes commentus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:23:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 23, 59</bibl></cit>.—Hence, as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnogrammus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, comically, <hi rend="ital">a skeleton, a shadow</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monogrammi dicti sunt homines macie pertenues ac decolores: tractum a picturā, quae priusquam coloribus corporatur, umbra fingitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 37, 11 sq.</bibl></cit>; Lucil. ap. Non. l. l.—</sense><sense id="n29583.2" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A species of jasper</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae zmaragdo similis traversā lineā albā praecingitur et monogrammos vocatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 37, 9, 37, § 118</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monoides: <entryFree id="n29584" type="main" key="mo^no^i_de_s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏīdēs</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">monoeidh/s</foreign>, <sense id="n29584.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">having a single form</hi>: luna, Firm. Math. 4 praef.</sense></entryFree>
monolinum: <entryFree id="n29585" type="greek" key="mo^no^li^num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏlĭnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/linon</foreign>, <sense id="n29585.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a necklace consisting of a string of pearls</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Max. Jun. 1, 8</bibl> (al. monolium).</sense></entryFree>
monolithus: <entryFree id="n29586" type="greek" key="mo^no^li^thus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏlĭthus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/liqos</foreign>, <sense id="n29586.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of a single stone, monolith</hi> (ante- and post-class.): columnae, Laber. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 544, 33</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">postes marmorei monolithi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1206,001:Lib. Mem. 8:12" default="NO"><author>Ampel.</author> Lib. Mem. 8, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1593</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monolium: <entryFree id="n29587" type="main" key="monolium"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monolium</orth>, v. monolinum.</entryFree>
monoloris: <entryFree id="n29588" type="main" key="mo^no^lo_ris"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏlōris</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hybr. <foreign lang="greek">mo/nos-</foreign> lorum</etym>, <sense id="n29588.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with one thong</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vestes,</quote> <trans><tr>having a single stripe of purple</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 46, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monomachia: <entryFree id="n29589" type="greek" key="mo^no^ma^chi^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏmăchĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monomaxi/a</foreign>, <sense id="n29589.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a single combat, duel</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cur ad monomachiam recurritis?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Var. 3</bibl></cit>, <cb n="MONS" /> 24; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 6, 136</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 2, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monomachus: <entryFree id="n29590" type="greek" key="mo^no^ma^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏmăchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/maxos</foreign>, <sense id="n29590.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">he who fights in single combat</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Hist. Eccl. 1, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 37</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monometer: <entryFree id="n29591" type="greek" key="mo^no^me^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏmĕter</orth>, <itype>tra, trum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/metros</foreign>, <sense id="n29591.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of one metre, monometer</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> Metr. Ter. p. 1320</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
monopodium: <entryFree id="n29592" type="greek" key="mo^no^po^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏpŏdĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monopo/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n29592.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a table</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stand with one foot</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 6 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 3, 8, § 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monopodius: <entryFree id="n29593" type="greek" key="mo^no^po^di^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏpŏdĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">monopo/dios</foreign>, <sense id="n29593.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one-footed</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Commod. 10</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monopolium: <entryFree id="n29594" type="greek" key="mo^no^po_li^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏpōlĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monopw/lion</foreign>, <sense id="n29594.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the exclusive privilege of dealing in</hi> or <hi rend="ital">selling a thing, a monopoly</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:71" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 71</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 37, 56, § 135</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monopteros: <entryFree id="n29595" type="greek" key="mo^nopte^ros"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnoptĕros</orth>, <itype>on</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/pteros</foreign>, of buildings, <sense id="n29595.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">with one wing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 7</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monoptota: <entryFree id="n29596" type="greek" key="mo^nopto_ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnoptōta</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/ptwta</foreign>, in the later grammarians, <sense id="n29596.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">nouns which have but one case-ending, monoptotes</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Diom.</author> p. 288</bibl> P.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 672</bibl> ib. et saep.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 242 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
monosolis: <entryFree id="n29597" type="main" key="mo^no^so^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏsŏlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>vox hibr., from <foreign lang="greek">mo/nos</foreign>-solea</etym>, <sense id="n29597.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">single-soled</hi> (post-class.), Edict. Diocl.</sense></entryFree>
monostichium: <entryFree id="n29598" type="greek" key="mo^nosti^chi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnostĭchĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">monosti/xion</foreign>, <sense id="n29598.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poem consisting of a single verse</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. 7, 8</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monostichum: <entryFree id="n29599" type="greek" key="mo^nosti^chum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnostĭchum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/stixon</foreign>, <sense id="n29599.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a poem consisting of a single verse</hi> (postclass.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Ecl. 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monosyllabus: <entryFree id="n29600" type="greek" key="mo^no^sylla^bus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏsyllăbus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">monosu/llabos</foreign>, <sense id="n29600.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monosyllabic</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">VOX,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 269</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, § 520</bibl>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst., a monosyllable</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnŏsyllabon</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (sc. verbum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. Lit. Monosyll. 13</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monosyllaba, sc. verba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:9:4:42" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 9, 4, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 3, § 294</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monotriglyphus: <entryFree id="n29601" type="greek" key="mo^notri^gly^phus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnotrĭglyphus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">monotri/glufos</foreign>, <sense id="n29601.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that has only one triglyph</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:4:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 4, 3, 7</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monotropus: <entryFree id="n29602" type="greek" key="mo^notro^pus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnotrŏpus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/tropos</foreign>, <sense id="n29602.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of one kind, single</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nosmet inter nos ministremus monotropi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:5:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 5, 4, 7</bibl></cit> (v. Ritschl ad h. l.).</sense></entryFree>
monoxylus: <entryFree id="n29603" type="greek" key="mo^noxy^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mŏnoxylus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, = <foreign lang="greek">mono/culos</foreign>, <sense id="n29603.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that consists of a single piece of wood</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">linter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 105</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
mons: <entryFree id="n29604" type="main" key="mons"><orth extent="full" lang="la">mons</orth>, <itype>tis</itype> (archaic <case>abl.</case> montei, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 222, 33</bibl>; cf. Ann. v. 420 Vahl.), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>etym. dub., perh. from the root min, whence also, emineo, mentum, minari; cf. minae; lit. a projecting body; hence</etym>, <sense id="n29604.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountain, mount</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29604.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">montium altitudines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:39:98" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 39, 98</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altissimi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:23:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 23, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inaccessi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 28, 32, § 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapidosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 44</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">parturiunt montes, nascetur ridiculus mus, said where much is promised but little performed,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:139" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 139</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29604.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n29604.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a</hi> (heaped-up, towering) <hi rend="ital">mass, a heap, quantity</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argenti montes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:2:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 4, 2, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">montes mali ardentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,011:3:4:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Merc. 3, 4, 32</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 78</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita mali maeroris montem maxumum conspicatus sum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:2:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 2, 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mons in Tusculani monte,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a lofty, splendid building near Tusculum</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:21:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 21, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aquae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:105" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 105</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">armorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:549" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 549</bibl></cit>.—Of a wagon-load of stones: <cit><quote lang="la">eversum fudit super agmina montem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:258" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 258</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 145</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">montes auri polliceri,</quote> <trans><tr>to promise mountains of gold, to make great promises</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 18</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">maria montesque polliceri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 23:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 23, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnos montes promittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:65" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 65</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29604.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A mountain-rock, rock</hi> in gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">fertur in abruptum magno mons improbus actu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:687" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 687</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graii,</quote> <trans><tr>Greek marble</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:1:145" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 1, 145</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29604.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mountain-beasts, wild beasts</hi> (late <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">consumant totos spectacula montes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Cons. Mall. Theod. 310</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monstrabilis: <entryFree id="n29605" type="main" key="monstra_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monstro</etym>, <sense id="n29605.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">worthy to be shown</hi> or <hi rend="ital">noticed, conspicuous, remarkable</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">probitate morum monstrabilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:21:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 21, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monstratio: <entryFree id="n29606" type="main" key="monstra_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29606.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a showing, direction</hi> (only in Terence and Vitruv.): <cit><quote lang="la">defessus sum ambulando: ut, Syre, te cum tuā Monstratione magnus perdat Juppiter,</quote> <trans><tr>direction</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:6:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solers et expedita monstratio,</quote> <trans><tr>indication, hint</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:6:1:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 6, 1, 12</bibl></cit>. <cb n="MONS" /></sense></entryFree>
monstrator: <entryFree id="n29607" type="main" key="monstra_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>monstro</etym>, <sense id="n29607.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a shower, pointer out, introducer, inventor, teacher, informant</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">aratri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Triptolemus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacri iniqui,</quote> <trans><tr>an introducer of human sacrifices</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:399" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Ib. 399</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hospitii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:979" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 979</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monstratus: <entryFree id="n29608" type="main" key="monstra_tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos>, v. monstro <sense id="n29608.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29609" type="main" key="monstra_tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrātus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype> (only in the <sense id="n29609.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">abl. sing.</hi>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>monstro</etym>, <hi rend="ital">a showing</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">cujus monstratu,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 112, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstratu Helenae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Per. Iliad. 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monstrifer: <entryFree id="n29610" type="main" key="monstri^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monstrum-fero</etym>, <sense id="n29610.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monster-bearing, that produces monsters</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">campi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:222" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novercae,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Juno, who sent monsters to Hercules</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 5:43" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sinus (i. e. mare),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:ib. 2:498" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 498</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">antra,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Stil. 2, 110</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29610.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Monstrous, horrid, misshapen</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animalium hominumque effigies monstriferas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 187</bibl></cit> (but the better reading is monstrificas).</sense></entryFree>
monstrificabilis: <entryFree id="n29611" type="main" key="monstri^fi^ca_bi^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrĭfĭcābĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monstrificus</etym>, <sense id="n29611.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monstrous, strange</hi> (ante-class.): mirum ac monstrificabile, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 138, 26</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monstrifice: <entryFree id="n29612" type="main" key="monstri^fi^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrĭfĭcē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. monstrificus <sense id="n29612.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
monstrificus: <entryFree id="n29613" type="main" key="monstri^fi^cus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrĭfĭcus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monstrumfacio</etym>, <sense id="n29613.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monstrous, strange</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">artes,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>magical</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:6:152" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 6, 152</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natura hyaenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum ingenia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 5, 13, § 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 3, 3, § 7</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and so the better reading,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:187" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 30, 35, § 187</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 13, 19, § 88</bibl>.—Hence, <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrĭfĭcē</orth>, <hi rend="ital">in a monstrous</hi> or <hi rend="ital">strange manner</hi> (post-Aug.), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:181" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 11, 49, § 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
monstrigena: <entryFree id="n29614" type="hapax" key="monstri^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>monstrumgigno</etym>, <sense id="n29614.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">monster-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrigenis fluctibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Perieg. 799</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monstriger: <entryFree id="n29615" type="main" key="monstri^ger"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrĭger</orth>, <itype>ĕra, ĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monstrum-gero</etym>, = monstrifer, II., <bibl default="NO"><author>Salv.</author> Gub. Dei. 5, 8</bibl>.</entryFree>
monstro: <entryFree id="n29616" type="main" key="monstro"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstro</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum</itype>, (archaic mostro; v. Brix ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:2:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 2, 61</bibl>), <itype>1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>like monstrum, from moneo</etym>, <sense id="n29616.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to show, point out, to indicate, intimate, inform, advise, teach, instruct, tell</hi> any thing (in class. prose very rare, and only in the lit. signif.; in Cic. only a few times; in Cæs. and Sall. not at all; syn.: indico, significo, ostendo, exhibeo). </sense><sense id="n29616.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: qui erranti comiter monstrat viam, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:16:51" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 16, 51</bibl> (Trag. v. 387 Vahl.); cf.: qui sibi semitam non sapiunt, alteri monstrant viam, id. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:58:132" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 58, 132</bibl> (Trag. v. 358 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:13:9" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 13, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palmam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">digito,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:1:28" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 1, 28</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstra quod bibam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:1:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 1, 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:4:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 4, 2, 31</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu ... si quid librari ... non intellegent, monstrabis, i. e. dices,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:22:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 22, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res gestae ... Quo scribi possent numero, monstravit Homerus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inulas ego primus amaras Monstravi incoquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:8:51 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 8, 51 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrate mearum Vidistis si quam hic errantem forte sororum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:321" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 321</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cujus prudentia monstrat Summos posse viros ... nasci, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:48" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 48</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Pass.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod monstror digito praetereuntium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:3:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 3, 22</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Impers. pass.</hi>: si voles advortere animum, comiter monstrabitur, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=89" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 89</bibl> Müll. (Trag. v. 386 Vahl.).—</sense><sense id="n29616.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n29616.3" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To ordain, institute, appoint</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">monstratas excitat aras,</quote> <trans><tr>appointed</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:549" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 549</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">piacula,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:636" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 4, 636</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:3:11:53" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 3, 11, 53</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29616.4" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To indict, impeach</hi> for a crime, <hi rend="ital">to denounce, accuse, inform against</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">alii ab amicis monstrabantur,</quote> <trans><tr>were pointed out, informed against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Nerone Scribonios fratres ... ad exitium,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 41</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29616.5" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To advise</hi> a person in any manner, or to do any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">alicui bene,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:1:2:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 1, 2, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non periclumst ne quid recte monstres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:3:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 3, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre manum pudor iraque monstrat,</quote> <trans><tr>advise, urge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 44</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a., conspicuous, distinguished, remarkable</hi> (Tacitean): <cit><quote lang="la">et hostibus simul suisque monstrati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,002:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> G. 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">propinquitate Galbae monstratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 1, 88</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monstrose: <entryFree id="n29617" type="main" key="monstro_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrōsē</orth>, <orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">monstrōsus</orth>, v. monstruose, monstruosus.</entryFree>
monstrositas: <entryFree id="n29618" type="main" key="monstro_si^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrōsĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>monstrosus, -uosus</etym>, <sense id="n29618.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unnaturalness, monstrosity</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 7, 26. <pb n="1163" /> <cb n="MONT" /></sense></entryFree>
monstrum: <entryFree id="n29619" type="main" key="monstrum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>moneo</etym>. <sense id="n29619.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig. belonging to relig. lang., <hi rend="ital">a divine omen indicating misfortune, an evil omen, portent</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">ostentum, prodigium, portentum): quia ostendunt, portendunt, monstrant, praedicunt, ostenta, portenta, monstra, prodigia dicuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:42:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 42, 93</bibl></cit>; cf.: monstrum dictum velut monestrum, quod moneat aliquid futurum; prodigium velut praedicium, quod praedicat; portentum quod portendat; ostentum, quod ostendat, Paul. ex <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=140" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 140</bibl> and 138 Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:ib" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> p. 157: hic est nullum (dubium) quin monstrum siet, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 469, 6</bibl> (Trag. v. 326 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">monstra deūm,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 59</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:15:571" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 15, 571</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n29619.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a monster, monstrosity</hi> (whether a living being or an inanimate thing). </sense><sense id="n29619.2" n="A" level="2"> Ofliving beings: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum hominis,</quote> <trans><tr>you monster of a man</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:4:4:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 4, 4, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monstrum advenit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">horrendum, of Polyphemus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 658</bibl></cit>.—Also with respect to character: <cit><quote lang="la">en monstrum mulieris,</quote> <trans><tr>that monster of a woman</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,015:1:2:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Poen. 1, 2, 64</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nulla jam pernicies a monstro illo atque prodigio comparabitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:2:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 2, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fatale, of Cleopatra,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:37:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 37, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tune etiam, immanissimum ac foedissimum monstrum ausus es?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:14:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 14, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum,</quote> <trans><tr>monsters of men</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:17:1:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 17, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—Of beasts: <cit><quote lang="la">succinctam latrantibus inguina monstris, i. e. canibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:6:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 6, 75</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae plurima terrae monstra ferunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:185" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 1, 185</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n29619.3" n="B" level="2"> Of inanim. things, of the sea, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 849</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">infelix, of the Trojan horse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 245</bibl></cit>.—Of the ship Argo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">non mihi jam furtum, sed monstrum ac prodigium videbatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:73:section=171" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 73, § 171</bibl></cit>: monstra narrare, dicere, <hi rend="ital">to relate wonders, prodigies, marvels</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mera monstra narrabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:4:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 4, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:4:24:54" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 4, 24, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac portenta loqui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:590" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 590</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">totaque jam sparsis exarserat insula monstris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:248" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 248</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in vitā suā fecit monstra,</quote> <trans><tr>he did wonderful things</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,030:48:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Eccl. 48, 15</bibl></cit>; Sap. 19, 8.</sense></entryFree>
monstruose: <entryFree id="n29620" type="main" key="monstru^o_se_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrŭōsē</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrōsē</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos>, v. monstruosus <sense id="n29620.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
monstruosus: <entryFree id="n29621" type="main" key="monstru^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrŭōsus</orth> (post-class. <orth extent="full" lang="la">mon-strōsus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monstrum</etym>, <sense id="n29621.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">strange, preternatural, monstrous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">monstruosissima bestia, of the ape,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:32:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 32, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hominum partus monstrosi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:557" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 557</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferculum longe monstruosius,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">scriptis monstruosus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:15" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">libidines,</quote> <trans><tr>unnatural</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulier si monstrosum aliquid aut prodigiosum enixa sit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Paul.</author> Sent. 4, 9, 3</bibl></cit> (but in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:1:18:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 1, 18, 61</bibl>, instead of monstrosi the correct reading seems to be morosi; so B. and K.; v. Madv. ad h. l.).—Hence, * <pos>adv.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">monstrŭōsē</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">monstrōsē</orth>), <hi rend="ital">strangely, unnaturally, monstrously</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cogitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:71:146" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 71, 146</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
montanianus: <entryFree id="n29622" type="main" key="Monta_ni^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Montānĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, v. 3. Montanus, II. <sense id="n29622.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
montaniculus: <entryFree id="n29623" type="gloss" key="monta_ni^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montānĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <sense id="n29623.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. dim.</hi> [1. montanus], <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 128</bibl> P.</sense></entryFree>
montanilla: <entryFree id="n29624" type="gloss" key="Montanilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Montanilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n29624.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 1146, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
montaninus: <entryFree id="n29625" type="gloss" key="Monta_ni_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Montānīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29625.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 713, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
montaniosus: <entryFree id="n29626" type="main" key="monta_ni^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montānĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mons</etym>, for montanus, <sense id="n29626.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mountainous</hi> (post-class.): locus, Auct. Rei Agrar. p. 239 Goes.; Gromat. Vet. p. 331, 20.</sense></entryFree>
montanus: <entryFree id="n29627" type="main" key="monta_nus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29627.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a mountain, mountain-; full of mountains, mountainous</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">locus montanus an planus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:10:37" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 10, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">flumen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:305" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 305</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacumina, i. e. montium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:310" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 310</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppida,</quote> <trans><tr>on a mountain</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:100" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 27, 28, § 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">loca montana et aspera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:1:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 1, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ligures,</quote> <trans><tr>dwelling in the mountains</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:35:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 35, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines asperi et montani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:57:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 57, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">uxor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vulgus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:74" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 74</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Dalmatia,</quote> <trans><tr>mountainous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:78" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 78</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Montāni</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">mountaineers</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:39:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 39, 2</bibl>.—<orth extent="full" lang="la">Mon-tāna</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <hi rend="ital"><orth extent="full" lang="la">n</orth>., mountainous regions</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter montana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 34</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,005:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Deut. 1, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,003:1:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Luc. 1, 39</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n29628" type="main" key="Monta_nus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Montānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n29628.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman surname</hi>. </sense><sense id="n29628.1" n="I" level="1"> Curtius Montanus, <hi rend="ital">a favorite of the emperor Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:16:28 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 16, 28 sq.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 4, 42</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:16:11" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 16, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:4:107" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 4, 107</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:131" default="NO">131</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n29628.2" n="II" level="1"> Votienus Montanus, <hi rend="ital">an orator of the reign of Tiberius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 42</bibl>; Sen. Contr. <cb n="MONU" /> 4, 24, 3.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Montānĭānus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">belonging to the orator Montanus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Contr. 4:28:17" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Contr. 4, 28, 17</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
montensis: <entryFree id="n29629" type="gloss" key="montensis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mons</etym>, for montanus, <sense id="n29629.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to mountains, mountain-</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">DII,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Grut.</author> 21, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monticellus: <entryFree id="n29630" type="main" key="monti^cellus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montĭcellus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n29630.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small mountain, a mount</hi> (post-class.), Auct. Rei Agrar. p. 231 Goes. (Gromat. Vet. 306 sq.).</sense></entryFree>
monticola: <entryFree id="n29631" type="main" key="monti^co^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montĭcŏla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>mons-colo</etym>, <sense id="n29631.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dweller in the mountains, a mountaineer</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">monticolae Silvani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 193</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
monticulus: <entryFree id="n29632" type="gloss" key="monti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>mons</etym>, <sense id="n29632.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small mountain</hi>: monticulus, <foreign lang="greek">o)/rion, bouno/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Gloss. Philox.</author> Donat. Art. Gram. 2, 2, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
montifer: <entryFree id="n29633" type="hapax" key="monti^fer"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montĭfer</orth>, <itype>fĕra, fĕrum</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>monsfero</etym>, <sense id="n29633.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mountain-bearing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">montiferum Titana (al. monstriferum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Oet. 1212" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Oet. 1212</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
montigena: <entryFree id="n29634" type="gloss" key="monti^ge^na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montĭgĕna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>comm.</gen> <etym>mons-gigno</etym>, <sense id="n29634.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mountain-born</hi>: montigena, <foreign lang="greek">o)resigenh/s</foreign>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Gloss. Philox.</author> Anthol. Lat. 1, 53, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
montinus: <entryFree id="n29635" type="main" key="Monti_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Montīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>mons</etym>, <sense id="n29635.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a mountaingod, god of the Mountains</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 4, 132</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
montivagus: <entryFree id="n29636" type="main" key="monti^va^gus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">montĭ-văgus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>mons-vagus</etym>, <sense id="n29636.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">mountain-roaming, that wanders over mountains</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">Diana,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,003:1:450" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Ach. 1, 450</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:404" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 404</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">genus ferarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:597" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 597</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1081" default="NO" valid="yes">1081</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ac silvestres cursus lustrationesque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:27:79" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 5, 27, 79</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
